name: Wyndham Grand Rio Mar Rainforest, Beach & Golf Resort
description: Golden sands, turquoise waters and tropical breezes abound this oceanfront resort, fresh from a multi-million dollar renovation introducing new exciting experiences, plus three sparkling beachfront pools, incredible dining with nine restaurants and lounges, lively casino, relaxing Mandara Spa, two world-class golf courses and more awaits. This resort is the idyllic retreat for any occasion, whether you yearn for a Caribbean golf getaway, crave an oceanfront escape, or you and the one you love need a little time under the sun and stars, there's no place like Puerto Rico.

name: El Conquistador Resort - Puerto Rico
description: Perched on a 300-foot cliff overlooking the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea, El Conquistador Resort, is a peaceful oasis on the Island of Enchantment currently offering 368 rooms and suites, growing back to its 750 room footprint by 2025. Our luxurious Puerto Rico resort is divided into five villages, providing a soothing getaway from the stress of the world. Enjoy spectacular, panoramic ocean views at The Grand Hotel in the villages of Las Brisas.

name: Hilton Ponce Golf & Casino Resort
description: Located only 5 minutes from downtown Ponce, known as "The Pearl of the South", and 10 minutes from La Mercedita Airport, this 80-acre oceanfront resort has everything you need for an unforgettable stay – elegant rooms and suites, first-class dining and facilities for business, relaxation, and recreation. Luis Muñoz Marín International Airport is also only 90 minutes from the resort.

name: San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino
description: The San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino is a AAA Four-Diamond oceanfront hotel that focuses on customer service and cultural experience. Located in the heart of Condado, guests don’t have to leave the premises to appreciate the beauty of the beach, situated just a few feet away. Visitors have a variety of over 20 restaurants and stores within walking distance to do some fine dining and shopping.

name: Group Services, Inc.
description: Truly comprehensive destination managers with offices in San Juan and Fajardo, and staff of 85 plus. All transportation needs, personalized meet-and-greet, rainforest and city historical tours, golf program, eco tours, dine-around, St. Thomas excursions, snorkeling and sailing, team building, spouse programs and more. Hands on, flexible, and we tailor our services to your special needs. Operations office at the LMM Airport.

name: Caribbean Trading Company, Inc. - Río Grande
description: Corporate Gift buying made EASY… Caribbean Trading Company is a Puerto Rico based service organization that specializes in customized gift solutions for the corporate group incentive/meetings and conventions market. We've had the pleasure of working on thousands of programs over 25 years. None of them more important to us than yours! We provide Gifting events and hands down the best gifting experience you'll find.

name: Caribe Golf
description: Caribe Golf, Inc. is an advanced golf reservation company that specializes in setting up golf tee times for individuals and groups at any of the exceptional golf courses that Puerto Rico has to offer. We can secure your tee time(s) up to 60 days for individuals and months in advance for groups at NO COST. Make sure to ask about the 'Tee Time Tomorrow' discount offer.

name: Carabalí Rainforest Adventure Park
description: Welcome to The Ultimate Caribbean Adventure. Located between the lush foothills of El Yunque National Rainforest and the crystal waters of the Atlantic Ocean, Carabalí Rainforest Adventure Park is an action-packed ranch and a favorite adventure destination in Puerto Rico. In addition to their legendary adventures, Carabalí Bar & Grill serves steaks, seafood and the best of Puerto Rican cuisine. There is a Gift Shop for purchasing accessories, souvenirs, clothes and more.

name: East Island Excursions
description: East Island Excursions hosts snorkeling and boat trips on Puerto Rico's offshore islands and cays. They offer a variety of quality marine excursions with professional captains and caring crew for an unforgettable experience. Snorkel the crystal clear Caribbean waters, explore their deserted cays, beautiful white sand beaches and then kick back and enjoy a sumptuous lunch buffet on board. Bar includes sodas, water, juices and local beer for sale. Top it off with a cold piña colada or East Island Excursions' famous tropical rum punch. That's the East Island Experience!

name: Museo de Arte de Ponce
description: The Museo de Arte de Ponce’s internationally renowned collection is comprised of more than 4,500 works of art from many cultures, dating from the ninth century C.E. to the present. This dynamic, wide-ranging collection includes paintings, sculptures, prints, photographs, drawings, decorative arts, pre-Hispanic and African objects, Puerto Rican folk art, contemporary ceramics, video, and sound art.

name: Museo de Arte de Puerto Rico
description: Designed in accordance with the strictest and most modern standards of contemporary museum design, the Museo de Arte de Puerto Rico (MAPR) is composed of 130,000 square feet of modern spaces. The Museo de Arte de Puerto Rico (MAPR) has 24 exhibition galleries distributed between the historical building in the west wing and the addition in the east wing.

name: Plaza Las Américas
description: Plaza Las Américas is the largest shopping center in the Caribbean, where you can go shopping, eat in any of its more than 50 restaurants or food establishments, enjoy in one of its 15 movie theaters and visit Dave & Buster's. With the three anchor stores Macy's, JCPenney and Sears, in addition to more than 250 stores, Plaza Las Americas has the largest variety of local stores and internationally recognized brands that exist under one roof in Puerto Rico.

name: Puerto Rico Premium Outlets
description: Located in the town of Barceloneta, Puerto Rico Premium Outlets offers essential outlet shopping for locals and tourists alike. The only outlet destination with all your favorite fashion brands at everyday savings of up to 65% off. Enjoy shopping at your favorite stores such as Ann Taylor Factory Store, LOFT Outlet, Michael Kors Outlet, Calvin Klein, Journeys, Kipling, LACOSTE, Rojo’s Collection, Skechers, Sunglass Hut, Gap Factory, Guess Factory, Nautica, Nike Factory Store, Oakley, Perry Ellis, Polo Ralph Lauren Factory Store, Tommy Hilfiger and more...

name: Marina Puerto del Rey
description: Puerto del Rey is the largest and most complete Marina in the Caribbean and a natural gem to boats from all over the world. As one of two a Blue Flag Marinas in Puerto Rico, Puerto del Rey lies in a beautiful and naturally protected bay, where its massive breakwater has proved shelter to thousands of boats for over 30 years. Its Wet Slip area is composed of over 1,000 slips which accommodate boats up to 180 LOA and 15 feet of draft, accompanied by extensive storage and repair facilities with more than 650 dry stack spaces on 60 acres of land.

name: Puerto Rican Arts & Crafts
description: This location has a collection of the finest Puerto Rico arts and crafts displayed in a beautifully restored building. There are over 100 artists and artisans bring us their handmade hammocks, “santos,” jewelry and ceramics, both functional and decorative. There are famous Ponce and Loiza masks, tropical wood products, and original artwork, framed and unframed.

name: Holiday Inn Ponce & Tropical Casino
description: Stay at the Holiday Inn® Ponce & Tropical Casino Hotel and discover the beautiful city also known as ‘The Pearl of the South’. Enjoy peaceful mountainous surroundings and gorgeous views to the Caribbean Sea while being minutes from downtown Ponce. Our location off Highway 2 grants business travelers easy access to Mercedita Airport and El Tuque y Reparada Industrial Park. Also convenient for leisure guests, we are near the main attractions of the city.

name: Four Points by Sheraton Caguas Real Hotel & Casino
description: Four Points by Sheraton Caguas Real Hotel & Casino is just a short drive from downtown San Juan where you will find everything you are looking for whether it's breathtaking mountain views or our tropical outdoor pool. We offer easy access to all the best things to do in Caguas and many major corporations. We're the perfect Caguas hotel. At our Caguas hotel, we'll make your stay smooth and easy with our casual ambiance and comfort. Settle in after a long day of fun, business or both.

name: Holiday Inn Mayagüez & Tropical Casino
description: An elegant well-lit lobby welcomes you to the Holiday Inn® Mayagüez & El Tropical Casino Hotel conveniently located to explore the city and discover Porta del Sol region. Have fun in the sun at Boquerón Beach or Rincón Beach, and enjoy the different festivals the city has throughout the year such as the Mango Festival or Porta del Sol Culinary Festival.

name: Grand Reserve Golf Club
description: The golf course was designed by PGA professional Tom Kite and is located in Río Grande, east of San Juan, by the sea and overlooking El Yunque U.S. National Forest. It is composed of 36 holes, divided into two 18-hole courses: the "Championship" and the "International". The club offers the best facilities and services in its luxurious clubhouse of 4,273 square meters including restaurant, lounge, meeting rooms, sauna, hot tub, locker rooms, and shops, among others.

name: Dragonfly Global Destination Services
description: Dragonfly Adventures DMC, Puerto Rico’s most proactive DMC with over 30 years in the tourism industry, inspired by our passion for our island the gem of the Caribbean! Our services along with our extensive local knowledge, expertise and specialization in design and implementation of unique events, activities, team buildings, spousal programs, tours, ground transportation and customized services along top notch logistics. Our commitment with our clients, which is our main drive, ensures the gain of your goals; exceed yours and clients expectations of our destination.

name: Condado Vanderbilt Hotel
description: An ultra luxury hotel from day one, the Condado Vanderbilt shone for its beauty and magnificence, attracting the kind of guests envisioned by Mr. Vanderbilt. From the richly appointed surroundings to the unsurpassed cuisine and highly personalized service, the only standard that applies to Condado Vanderbilt is that of absolute perfection. Now restored to its original grandeur and welcoming guests once again, the Condado Vanderbilt Hotel showcases 4 outdoor swimming pools, a spa and wellness center, two 11-story towers, including Commodore Suites and Biltmore Suites.

name: Acampa Nature Adventures
description: Since 1998 Acampa is the official outdoor, travel and camping store in Puerto Rico with the most complete selection of outdoor, camping, adventure and travel products from brands such as Patagonia, Osprey, Petzl, La Sportiva, Salomon, MSR, Keen, Vasque and much more. We offer excellent personal service, travel and camping orientation. The largest inventory in hiking boots, backpacks, fuel canisters, outdoor clothing and more.

name: Kayaking Puerto Rico
description: Kayaking Puerto Rico is a quality award-winning aquatic tour operator specializing in top of the line bio bay kayak tours, mini speed boat excursions, and all-inclusive kayak & snorkeling adventures through Puerto Rico's East Coast and Culebra Island! They can accommodate groups of up to 30 guests per excursion with a maximum company capacity of 170 guests per day. All adventures can be fully customized to your needs. Transportation service available for some tours.

name: Antiguo Casino de Puerto Rico
description: Retaining its distinguishing Spanish and French influence, El Antiguo Casino is part of the Puerto Rico Convention Center District. After its restoration, this majestic place has become a preferred venue for wedding celebrations and other social events. The lush gardens, balconies, molding, white marble floors, extravagant central staircase, and its beautiful twelve-foot candelabrum chandelier make up its elegant ambiance, setting the Antiguo Casino apart as one of the most prestigious architectural relics of the 20th Century of the Old San Juan.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Fundación Luis Muñoz Marín
description: FLMM is located at Muñóz Marín's former residence in San Juan, with an adjacent arboretum, called Doña Inés Park. FLMM operates a museum, and an historical archive. The museum has three exhibit areas: the residence, the library office, and a tropical garden with a wooden palm tree-roofed ranch. The FLMM is available for company meetings, events and educational/cultural conferences.

name: Hacienda Campo Rico
description: A classic Caribbean Style Hacienda located on the grounds of a former sugar cane plantation in Carolina, Puerto Rico, just a short 15-minute drive from San Juan's main airport (SJU). The unique 1930’s Hacienda consists of a main structure; “ Mi Casa', the primary event venue, suitable for a diversity of experiences. "Mi Casa" is an extraordinary structure used for private events, celebrations, exhibitions and team-building experiences, day or night. The venue has open-space capacity for up to 480 guests or more, if the green area is included.

name: Flavors of San Juan Food & Culture Tours
description: Flavors of San Juan Food and Culture Tours® knows the island is so much more than its beaches and invites visitors to live like locals and explore this island's history and culture through your tastebuds.

name: Bahia Beach Golf Club
description: Bahía Beach Golf Course – The golf course is a 72 par championship course designed by Robert Trent Jones Jr. providing the best playing surface in the Caribbean and arguably the world. With 15 holes that have a water element in play, surrounded by beautiful palm trees and an array of vegetation that decorates the boundaries of every hole, spectacular finishing holes along the ocean, undulating fairways, scenic lakes and gentle ocean breezes; the course's incredible splendor is matched only by its world-class play.

name: Toro Verde Nature Adventure Park
description: ToroVerde is the new ecotouristic park where you'll spend hours of neverending adventures. Enjoy the most beautiful landscapes that will leave you breathless; in addition try some extreme sports and interact with the nature that surrounds you. If you are one of those who love to feel that adrenaline rush, this is the place for you. Here you can hang from a cable thousands of feet up in the air, climb a mountain, ride world mountain bike class trail at Marla Streb's Singletrack Jungle!

name: Vamonos Puerto Rico, Inc.
description: Vamonos we do two things extremely well: we run safe and unique cultural immersion tours to multiple destinations, and secondly, we intentionally create meaningful interactions with local people daily. We believe educational travel is enhanced through community outreach and service opportunities. These experiences are often life-changing.

name: GO Puerto Rico Shuttle
description: Puerto Rico Shuttle offers affordable, reliable, on time and safe ground transportation to, from Luis Muñoz Marín international airport (SJU), and to Hotels, Cruise Terminals, Businesses and Residences, throughout the Island. They strive and take pride in providing the best transportation services at the best rates. They can manage transportation for families, small, medium, and large groups. Their lively service provides sedan and private van service throughout the island of Puerto Rico.

name: The Mall of San Juan
description: The Mall of San Juan is conveniently located just minutes away from the Luis Muñoz Marín Airport, adjacent to the San José Lagoon at the South End of the Teodoro Moscoso Bridge in San Juan. Offering a diverse mix of fashion and lifestyle retailers and local, popular favorites, it's Puerto Rico's newest must-see shopping destination.

name: Ticket Center, Inc.
description: This is a major ticketing company in the Caribbean with operations in Puerto Rico and Panama. Ticket Center's computerized ticketing system handles the ticketing needs of multiple venues and facilities such as coliseums, stadiums, theaters, performing arts, conventions halls, exhibitions and trade centers. Ticket Center manages and operates regional ticketing networks with island-wide coverage and distribution channels such as Box Office, Call Center, Internet and Point of Sales Outlets.

name: Dorado Beach, A Ritz-Carlton Reserve
description: Once a plantation, Dorado Beach, a Ritz-Carlton Reserve is now one of the most exclusive Caribbean luxury resorts in Puerto Rico inspired by the legacy and memorable vacation experiences of its original developer, Laurance S. Rockefeller. Its remoteness, discreet individualized service and deep respect for the environment distinguish it from other ultra-luxury resorts by allowing extraordinary moments to unfold in the most unexpected ways.

name: Coliseum of Puerto Rico José Miguel Agrelot
description: The biggest indoor arena in Puerto Rico dedicated to entertainment and sports. It is located in the Hato Rey district of San Juan, the island's capital. The "Choli" as the coliseum is known by locals, opened its doors to the public on September 4, 2004. The venue can accommodate up to 18,500 spectators and can be reached by the Tren Urbano metro system.

name: Spoon
description: Founded in 2012, Spoon is Puerto Rico’s leading tour operator and travel planning & logistics company with a specialization in culinary experiences. Our experiences are designed to be immersive, authentic, informative and educational, providing our customers with insights into the local food systems, culinary traditions, and sustainable practices. We champion diversity and have a passion for travel, tourism, the culinary industry and Puerto Rico.

name: Escuela Artes Plásticas y Diseño de Puerto Rico
description: The Escuela de Artes Plásticas y Diseño is the only educational institution in Puerto Rico that offers a Bachelor of Fine Arts. The school originated in the art workshops of the Instituto de Cultura Puertorriqueña and has managed to become a university center dedicated to the arts and design, without losing sight of its workshop heritage. It also serves the community with art and design courses and workshops for adults, youth, and children.

name: Explora Puerto Rico
description: Explora is a true connection with untouched nature in a private nature reserve, an exclusive, protected wildlife sanctuary in the mountainous karst area in Arecibo, with amazing caves, canyons and rivers fed by underground springs. The five hours off the beaten path eco-experience includes, hiking through a beautiful jungle, spelunking through a caves and Body Rafting™ a unique sport created by Explora to float downstream while viewing the striking, towering canyons.

name: Quiñones Candal Puerto Rican Art Gallery
description: The gallery of Puerto Rican artist Andrés Quiñones Candal is located inside of Old San Juan's Cuarte de Ballajá.

name: Interactive DMC Puerto Rico
description: Interactive specializes in developing and producing events that will align with your program goals. Our approach to each event is to actively LISTEN to your needs and establish the direction and course of action. Our team of experts and creative partners will collaborate with you to design, develop and produce events that are memorable and interactive!

name: Bosque Estatal de Guajataca
description: The Guajataca State Forest is located in the northwest region of Puerto Rico. The facilities count with hiking trails, gazebos, bathrooms, parking, recreational areas, among others. Camping spaces are available, but they must be separated in advance through the Puerto Rico Department of Natural Resources. Prices per night for adults is $4.00 and prices for children younger than 10 years old is $2.00.

name: Lago Garzas
description: Lago Garzas is located in Puerto Rico's central mountain region, in the coffee-producing town of Adjuntas. This man-made lake was constructed in 1943, and its waters are used for the production of drinking water and as a source of hydroelectric power. The lake has recreational facilities for visitors that wish to go boating, kayaking, fishing, or hiking. A favorite with locals is finding the Puente Hamaca, a suspension bridge that crosses over the lake— making it a great photo-op opportunity. There's parking as well as bathrooms available on site.

name: Barefoot Travelers Rooms & Adventures Guesthouse
description: This unique adventure guesthouse is walking distance to the beach, easy access to the East and North parts of interest, including the rain forest, Old San Juan, Guavate, Luquillo Beach, ferries to Culebra and Vieques and many more secret spots around our area to share. We offer a chilled out, clean, comfortable and affordable guesthouse for all travelers, friends, families, solo travelers and couples. 'Barefoot' is an easy going relaxing spot to spend part or all of your Puerto Rico exploration. We also offer kayaking Eco-tours and rentals.

name: Mayagüez Resort & Casino
description: Welcome to the Mayagüez Resort & Casino. Either on business or enjoying your vacations, we hope your stay at the Mayaguez Resort & Casino is a pleasant one. Escape with your family discovering a water and sun paradise with ancient ruins, castle, and tropical forest. Discover an island of pure aquatic fun. We invite you to the River Pool Village at The Best in the West and create unforgettable experiences and memories.

name: Bosque Estatal de Guilarte
description: The Guilarte State Forest is located in the municipality of Adjuntas, and it's managed by the Puerto Rico Department of Natural Resources (DRNA). In this forest, you'll find Puerto Rico's seventh highest peak, Pico Guilarte, at an elevation of 3,950 feet above the sea level. Due to its richness in local flora and fauna, the Guilarte State Forest is a great spot for hiking, birdwatching, photography, or simply for enjoying Puerto Rico's great outdoors.

name: Royal Isabela
description: Escape to an intimate oceanfront resort on Puerto Rico’s spectacular northwest coast. Blessed with stunning Atlantic views, dramatic cliffs and a landscape lush with native flora and fauna, Royal Isabela is an epic backdrop for heartwarming family vacations, unforgettable golf getaways, romantic escapes, milestone celebrations, and gracious resort living. Enjoy the natural majesty of Isabela, Puerto Rico’s from your private Casita, as you play around on the Royal Isabela Golf Club, explore two miles of quiet beach or paddleboard on the mysterious Guajataca River.

name: Hacienda Tres Ángeles
description: At Hacienda Tres Ángeles, a hidden gem tucked into the mountains of Adjuntas, you can enjoy a cup of coffee on their spacious deck while admiring the mesmerizing view of the coffee plantation below. Their coffee is one of the finest Specialty Coffees of the World, as recognized by the United Nations World Tourism Association. Don't miss out on this unique experience!

name: Saint Voodoo's Mar Azul
description: Saint Voodoo's Mar Azul is a dive bar in Vieques that's known for their cheap drinks, bar food, and spectacular sunset views.

name: Garabatos Bar & Grill
description: This captivating bar is serious about its music and atmosphere, often bringing live DJs. They also have a vast selection of late night food, including a sushi menu.

name: Esquina Watusi
description: The Watusi is a dive bar found in the Santurce area of San Juan. The spot is small, but it's a beloved hangout location for locals who from Thursday to Friday, take over the streets that are adjacent t to El Watusi. On Thursday nights, local "plena" musicians play their music, making it the perfect opportunity for enjoying traditional Puerto Rican music and culture.

name: Taberna Los Vazquez
description: This emblematic bar is one of the many spots at La Placita where you can enjoy local beers while practicing your salsa steps. They often have live salsa, karaoke nights, and happy hours.

name: Smoke City
description: SMOKE SHOPS & SMOKE BAR. Wholesale and retail options. 8 Stores in Puerto Rico!

name: The Lobby at Fairmont El San Juan Hotel
description: Fairmont El San Juan Hotel creates an atmosphere of convivial camaraderie for locals and travelers alike. Made iconic by the people, parties, and performances that defined El San Juan nightlife beginning in the roaring ’60s, the hotel’s jovial spirit lives on in its imaginative and intimate bars. Food, drink, and diversion come in a variety of settings, each exuding joie de vivre reflective of Puerto Rico’s island culture.

name: Café Teatro Tierra Luna
description: A cozy restaurant that also functions as a comedy club, small theater, and music venue. The space is available for rent for both family and corporate events.

name: Café Lucero
description: Café Lucero Restaurant offers delicious dishes with various options, including vegetarian dishes, drinks, and exquisite coffee, harvested in Ponce. In a family atmosphere, they have a catering service, and wheelchair access.

name: Café Nativo
description: The store layout, menu listings, and family environment provide an intimate setting to catch up on reading or get together with friends. The menu offerings will be supplemented by free books and magazines related to the coffee industry around the world that customers can read inside the coffee bar. Nativo coffee shop offers espresso-based coffee drinks such as lattes, mochas, cappuccinos, etc, and in addition, brewing coffee methods.

name: Hacienda San Pedro
description: Harvested in the mountain town of Jayuya, Hacienda San Pedro's coffee is a favorite among locals. Hacienda San Pedro is a four-generation artisanal coffee that's slightly sweeter than other roasts, with notes of chocolate and spices. Plan a visit to the plantation in Jayuya where you can take a tour of the grounds, learn about coffee production, and enjoy lunch or a cup of coffee surrounded by the highest peaks of Puerto Rico.

name: Red Coral Lounge
description: The Red Coral Lounge provides an ambiance that transitions from a place to be during the day to the place to be seen in the evening, offering innovative cocktails, including the famous dragon berry mojito – the Red Coral Lounge provides guests with evening entertainment that ranges from guest DJ’s to 10 piece live bands playing salsa and merengue!

name: The Cigar House
description: For decades, the Cigar House has been a sanctuary for anyone who prides himself or herself on enjoying exquisite tobacco products. A vast, walk-in humidor boasts the largest selection of fine cigars in all of the Caribbean, counting more than 500 units. But don’t fret if you’re not an expert on cigars. Rest assured that a knowledgeable and friendly staff member will guide you through an experience that is as luxurious as the products they offer.

name: El Mercado Libre
description: El Mercado Libre is a shopping center that promotes local and organic products at fair prices made by local businesses owned mostly by women. It's inspired by traditional markets where the community gathers in search of delicious coffee, a good conversation, and a local buy. We offer opportunities and support to local entrepreneurs within an environment that connects Puerto Rico through entertainment and culture.

name: Necromancy Cosmetica
description: 100% Vegan Matte Lipsticks, handcrafted in Puerto Rico with an unusual range of shades for the audacious and creative.- Necromancy Cosmetica

name: Acampa Outdoor, Travel and Adventure Store
description: Since 1998 Acampa is the official outdoor, travel and camping store in Puerto Rico with the most complete selection of outdoor, camping, adventure and travel products from brands such as Patagonia, Osprey, Petzl, La Sportiva, Salomon, MSR, Keen, Vasque and much more. We offer excellent personal service, travel and camping orientation. The largest inventory in hiking boots, backpacks, fuel canisters, outdoor clothing and more.

name: Rincon Diving & Snorkeling
description: Explore the pristine waters and reefs of Rincón’s shores as you snorkel or dive under the guidance of experienced, certified guides. We offer some of the best shore diving in Puerto Rico, USA, with NO BOAT REQUIRED to get to some of the best local reefs. All our experiences start with safety briefings and professional equipment fittings. For those who want to perform certification dives in the warm Caribbean waters – we are the local experts with the best-established dive center in the area.

name: Para la Naturaleza
description: Para la Naturaleza is a non-profit organization that integrates society in the conservation of its natural ecosystems. Its goal is to ensure that the percentage of protected natural areas in Puerto Rico is 33% by the year 2033. Para la Naturaleza provides each person and community with transformative experiences that inspire and motivate concrete actions in favor of nature, such as voluntary work, the donation of funds and land, or the establishment of conservation easements.

name: Plaza Carolina Simon Mall
description: Plaza Carolina is the second-largest shopping center in Puerto Rico. It also features over 175 stores, including JCPenney, Forever 21, Express, and TJ Maxx. Plaza Carolina Mall is a wonderful climate controlled indoor mall. When visiting the mall, you'll also find many exciting dining options from sit down places such as Chili's to grab and go choices such as Pizza Hut. The mall also includes Caribbean Cinemas, a movie theater with the latest technology. Conveniently located right off the intersection of Monserrate Avenue, 65 Infantry Avenue, Route 66 and Baldorioty De Castro Avenue.

location.street_address: 606E Avenida Jesús M. Fragoso Avenida Jesús M. Fragoso

name: The Outlet at Route 66
description: Featuring top brands like Tommy Hilfiger, Calvin Klein, Guess, Skechers, Nautica, Perry Ellis and Burlington, the Outlet at Route 66 is a premiere shopping center located in the Puerto Rico East area, near Carolina, Canóvanas, Río Grande and Fajardo, and only 15 minutes drive from the metropolitan area.

name: Eco's Sports Park
description: Eco's Sports Park is located at the heart of San Juan, in the Parque Luís Muñoz Marín, and it can be accessed through the park's Domenech Avenue entrance. The sports park is located directly next to the Pedrín Zorrilla Coliseum and the Hiram Bithorn Stadium. Eco’s Sports Park facilities include: • 3 Soccer fields with Footsal dimensions. The highest grade artificial grass by Astro-Turf the pioneers of the synthetic grass industry. The three fields combine to create a larger Football, Kicking-ball, Whiffle-ball, Flag-football or Ultimate Frisbee and other sports.

name: Ciudad Deportiva Barranquitas
description: The facilities at Barranquitas Sports Complex include: basketball courts, a baseball park, a municipal gym, a running track, tennis courts, a public pool, and more.

name: Yauco Urban Park
description: The Yauco Urban Park has over 22 acres of outdoor recreational spaces. Visitors to the park can enjoy a stroll along the park's trails, ride their bicycles along the designated paths, play beach volleyball, among many other activities. With more than 400 natives trees, the park is also a great spot for birdwatching.

name: Ramey's Skate & Splash Park
description: Ramey's Skate and Splash Park is located in the west region of Puerto Rico in the coastal town of Aguadilla. The park has three main areas: a water playground zone, a non-wet playground area, and an expansive skateboarding park with various skating pools.

name: Jaime Benítez National Park
description: Laguna del Condado National Park is a very popular spot for all the family. Great place for a walk or a jog, you can also practice sportslike paddleboard, kayak, roller skating and skateboard. Every first Saturday ofthe month free movies are shown here at 7pm in a big inflatable screen.

name: Balneario de Carolina
description: The Balneario de Carolina, which for several years has been awarded the Blue Flag Award for cleanliness and water quality, is one of the busiest and favorite beaches in the metropolitan area. It has spectacular white sand and beautiful clear water. The beach has attractions for everyone in your group, there are watersports, a Beach Volleyball court, a small water park for the kids, and food options to please everyone's taste. Some of the small restaurants that you'll find along the beach include BambooBei Beach Bistro and Vaivén Beach Bar.

name: Teatro Francisco Arriví
description: The Teatro Franciso Arriví is located in the Santurce neighborhood of San Juan, and it's easily accessed from both Condado and Old San Juan. The theatre dates back to the 1940s when it was built to serve as an Art Deco movie theatre. Later in the 1970s, the theatre was closed, but it has since reopened as a performing arts theatre. The events held at the Francisco Arriví Theatre can range from small-scale musicals or performances to cultural festivals and more.

name: Centro de Bellas Artes Luis A. Ferré
description: The Centro de Bellas Artes Luis A. Ferré opened its doors in 1981, immediately becoming Puerto Rico's most important cultural center. Also known as Bellas Artes de Santurce, the performing center's regular schedule of events includes local as well as international theatre productions, intimate concerts, and presentations from both the Puerto Rico's symphony and philharmonic orchestras. In January 2019, the center's theatre venue hosted the three weeks of performances of the Broadway hit, Hamilton.

name: Hipódromo Camarero
description: Puerto Rico's only horse racing track is located in Canóvanas, only 30 minutes away from San Juan. You can catch their races every afternoon from Thursday to Sunday.

name: Las Cascadas Water Park
description: Located in the heart of Aguadilla, Puerto Rico, Las Cascadas Water Park stands as one of the largest and most thrilling water parks in the entire Caribbean region. With a selection of 15 attractions pulsating with excitement and fun, it has become the preferred destination for families, groups of friends, and adventurers seeking a refreshing escape under the Caribbean sun. Its attractions are ideal for all ages, from wave pools and crazy rivers to water slides and a children's play area. Ensuring that every visit finds its own piece of enjoyment in the aquatic charm.

name: Albergue Olímpico Germán Rieckehoff
description: The Albergue Olímpico German Rieckehoff Sampayo or Olympic Training Center is an athletic training and recreational center located in Salinas, Puerto Rico. It is a complete sports center, and it is used by professional athletes and by the general public for health, educational, and recreational activities. It has a territorial expansion of 1,500 acres (6.1 km) and has multiple sports installations. Among these are: various multiple-use courts, a baseball complex, an aquatic complex, a tennis complex, gyms, and different sports halls.

name: Centro Cultural Carmen Solá de Pereira de Ponce
description: The Carmen Solá de Pereira de Ponce Cultural Center was founded in 1963 and it's Ponce's main cultural center. Located in the city's historical zone, the center hosts educational art exhibits as well as cultural events. Since 1992, the cultural center's headquarters are a landmark colonial house that dates back to the 1870s. Every month, the center has a special gallery night, where they showcase works of art from local artists.

name: Galería Éxodo
description: Inhabiting a colonial edification impregnated with stories that talk about changes trough the pass of time, not too far from the sea, we can find the works of artist that come from different corners of the world. In this eclectic space, diverse artistic views convergence, and even the most opposing voices salute each other.

name: Galería W. Labiosa
description: Among the oldest art galleries in Puerto Rico, Galeria W. Labiosa was established in Old San Juan during the late 1960’s by the renowned Puerto Rican artist Wilfred Labiosa. Celebrating almost twenty years in the same location – 200 Tetuan Street with works by important local artists such as: Labiosa, Homar, Tufiño, Torres de la Haba, Hernandez Acevedo, Irizarry, Gaztambide, Gomez, Soto, Noble, Vando, Alicea, Alduvar, Sobrino, Rosado, Martinez-Geigel, Figueroa, Wood Carver Pagani, and Zeno, among many others.

name: Museo de Historia y Arte Carolina
description: Carolina's Art and History Museum showcases the town's history in a modern and interactive way. The museum uses advanced technology in both the holographic projection room and in its 360 projection exhibition.

name: Galeria de Arte de la Universidad del Sagrado Corazon
description: This is an ongoing exhibition program featuring works from local artists. Since 1995, Galería de Arte USC has been committed to the local art scene. Through the gallery's relentless ideology and cultural convictions, Galería de Arte USC has become well known as a strong collaborator of the Puerto Rican artists' scene. Galería de Arte USC has been instrumental in the careers of more than 20 artists.

name: Museo Casa Escuté
description: The museum Casa Escuté is Carolina's main cultural center, hosting exhibitions from both local and international plastic artists. The museum has three main exhibition rooms dedicated to the town's historical figures and history.

location.street_address: Plaza de Recreo Rey Fernando III

name: La Casa de la Cultura Orocoveña
description: La Casa de la Cultura Orocoveña has rotating exhibitions, and it is located in the town's urban center. The small museum is found in the same building, where you'll find Orocovis's tourist information office.

name: Museo de Arte Caribbean University
description: The Museo de Arte de Caribbean University was founded in 2005 and houses within its permanent collections works of art from artists such as Tomás Batista, Wichie Torres, Sofía Maldonado, Diógenes Ballester, Anaida Hernández, Tere Sanz, Luis Felipe Passalacqua, Mildred Collazo, Abdías Méndez Robles, among others.

name: Museo de Arte e Historia Oscar Colón Delgado
description: This small museum is located in the north region of Puerto Rico in the town of Hatillo. The museum has rotating exhibitions from local artists as well as a permanent collection related to the town's history.

name: Museo de las Américas
description: This museum offers three permanent collections as well as temporary exhibitions— all emphasizing the conservation and promotion of the cultural heritage of Puerto Rico and the Americas, with a firm commitment to the community. The museum's permanent exhibitions are Folk Arts in the Americas, Our African Heritage, and Conquest and Colonization. The Museo de las Américas is located inside the historic Cuartel de Ballajá, which in Spanish colonial times was used as the military's barracks.

name: Museo de Historia, Antropología y Arte de la Universidad de Puerto Rico
description: This is Puerto Rico's first and oldest museum and it is housed within the grounds of the University of Puerto Rico, Río Piedras campus. The building was designed by the prominent German architect, Henry Klumb. The museum's collection of Antillean archeology is one of the most complete in the Caribbean. The museum offers exhibitions, guided tours, art workshops, conferences, forums, and concerts.

name: Sala de Historia Sergio E. Calzada Rivera
description: Located right next to Canóvanas's town hall, the Sala de Historia Sergio Calzada Rivera takes visitors on a journey through the town's history. The museum is open from Wednesday to Sunday from 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM, and entrance is $2.00 per visitor.

name: Museo de Artes Populares de Caguas
description: The Museo de Artes Populares de Caguas (Caguas Folk Art Museum) pays tribute to the Puerto Rican artisans and Creole hands that have created unique handmade products of practical use or aesthetic and artistic value. The museum has two main areas: the first hall contains a permanent collection of Puerto Rican master craftsmen, such as saint woodcarvers Zoilo Cajigas, Celestino Avilés, and Domingo Orta. The second hall exhibits a selective sample of eight miniature pieces by Caguas master artisan, Mr. Edwin Báez, as well as quarterly temporary exhibitions.

name: Museo de San Juan
description: The Museo de San Juan is housed within the historical building that in the 19th century served as Old San Juan's main public market. In one wing of the museum, you'll find a permanent exhibition tied to Puerto Rico's history while the second wing is used for temporary exhibits.

name: Galería Botello
description: Located in a 350 year old Spanish building in Old San Juan. Galería Botello showcases some of the finest internationally recognized artists. The gallery features paintings, sculptures, ceramics and noteworthy collections of rare, antique carved santos. Angel Botello’s bronze sculptures, oils, lithographs and linocuts highlighted as well as the works.

name: Galería Petrus
description: Galería Petrus has a vast array of works of contemporary art by Puerto Rican artists. The works of art at the gallery include paintings, sculptures, photography, and several other mediums. Petrus' mission is to create curatorial projects of great magnitude to contextualize the history of Puerto Rican art.

name: Estudio de Arte Samuel Lind
description: A humble host and an impressive exposition of culture and art is what you will find in Samuel Lind Studio. The art studio of the well know Puerto Rican artist Samuel Lind is a beautiful experience for those who love the arts and are thrilled to experience culture through art.

name: Ángel Lito Peña Art Center
description: Humacao's art center is named after the famous orchestra musician Ángel "Lito" Peña. The art center is used for various conferences and other art-related events.

name: Galería Guatibiri
description: For more than 40 years the Galería Guatibiri in Río Piedras has served as one of San Juan's main cultural platforms. In addition, to the exhibits of local works of art, the gallery also offers custom-made framing.

name: Museo De Arte De Bayamón
description: The Museo de Arte de Bayamón is located inside of Bayamón's Parque de las Ciencias— an educational and recreational park dedicated to the sciences and arts. The museum has a permanent exhibition and a rotating temporary exhibit.

location.street_address: Parque de Las Ciencias Luis A. Ferré

name: Museo de Arte de Caguas
description: El Museo de Arte de Caguas (MUAC) es un programa de promoción de todas las disciplinas de las artes visuales, dentro del Departamento de Desarrollo Cultural del Municipio Autónomo de Caguas. Expone y promueve la producción de las artes plásticas en su sala de exposición permanente Carlos Osorio y a través de exposiciones temporeras que contribuyan a la promoción del aprecio por el conocimiento artístico y ofrece servicios educativos que aporten al desarrollo integral de nuestra sociedad.

location.street_address: Cll. Luis Padial Esq. Segundo Ruiz Belvis

name: Museo Dr. Pío López Martínez
description: The Museo Dr. Pío López Martínez is located within the University of Puerto Rico's Cayey campus. The museum's main exhibition, La Casa Frade, aims to conserve the legacy of Puerto Rican artist Ramón Frede. The museum has two other exhibition rooms, one dedicated to Puerto Rico's long tradition of graphic arts and a third one for rotating exhibitions.

name: Museo de Arte Francisco Oller
description: The Francisco Oller Art Museum was created to preserve the important legacy of one of Puerto Rico's most celebrated artists— Francisco Oller. The museum aims to honor his contributions to the island's cultural and artistic heritage, while also conserving his legacy for the enjoyment of future generations.

name: Macro Mural Brisa Tropical
description: Brisa Tropical is a macro mural in Yauco. Under the direction of architect Samuel González, neighbors of the La Cantera community transformed their neighborhood and turned it into a giant canvas. The residents themselves painted 19 houses, several stairs, and a square with different colors to turn them into a colorful work of art.

name: Teatro Victoria Espinosa
description: This theater is named after Victoria Espinosa, a well-known Puerto Rican professor of theater at the University of Puerto Rico. This performance art theater presents high-quality plays, fused with some cultural and historic Puerto Rican inspirations. Check their listings for artistic events that will interest you!

name: Artesanías Castor Ayala
description: This small artisan shop is located in the grounds of the Ayala Brother's Batey in the town of Loíza. The shop specializes in traditional "vejigante" masks as well as other unique finds.

name: Teatro Ernesto Ramos Antonini
description: The Ernesto Ramoos Antonini Theater is located in the town of Barceloneta and it's used for theater functions as well as private events.

name: Olimpia Water Park
description: Olimpia Water Park is located at the Albergue Olímpico of Puerto Rico, and it's the perfect place for a family day of fun. Buy your Olimpia Passport and enjoy the rock climbing park Piedra Chiquita (from 9 am to 4 pm), the mini-golf course, the water parks of Villa Enchumba, Jungla Chica, and Vendaval. Your pass also includes access to the Ola Marina water park complex, which has stations like El Yunque, Toro Negro, and Isla Chiquitines.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Aguadilla
description: Located in Aguadilla Mall. Enjoy some family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Feeling hungry? Enjoy a variety of theater snacks from the concession stands.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Arecibo
description: Enjoy some family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Feeling hungry? Enjoy a variety of theater snacks from the concession stands. Celebrate your birthday or special event in their event halls.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Barceloneta
description: Located in Puerto Rico's Premium Outlets in Barceloneta. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Enjoy a variety of cinematic experiences like 3D movies, rooms with enhanced audio effects or birthday and event rooms.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Fine Arts Miramar
description: Fans of great cinema can enjoy the latest releases of independent and foreign films at Fine Arts. Enjoy an indulgent, guest-focused cinematic experience with the comfort of spacious seating and relaxed ambiance. The cinema offers a variety of food and wines in their lounge. Located just five minutes away from the Convention District.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Las Piedras
description: The Caribbean Cinemas movie theater located in Olympic Plaza Shopping Mall. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Elevate your cinematic experience by celebrating your birthday or special event in their party rooms.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Montehiedra
description: The Caribbean Cinemas movie theater that will transport you deep into movie-land with the most advanced sound and vision technologies in cinema. An adventure designed to elevate your movie-viewing experience. Enjoy a variety of cinematic experiences like 4K technology projection cinema rooms, 3D movies and party rooms.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Plaza Cayey
description: The Caribbean Cinemas movie theater located in Plaza Cayey Shopping Center. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Plaza del Caribe
description: The Caribbean Cinemas movie theater located in Plaza del Caribe. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen or celebrate your special event in one of their party rooms.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Plaza del Norte
description: The Caribbean Cinemas movie theater located in Plaza del Norte Shopping Center. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Ponce Towne Center
description: The Caribbean Cinemas movie theater located in Ponce Towne Center. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Elevate your cinematic experience by celebrating your birthday or special event in their party rooms.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - The Outlet 66
description: Conveniently located in The Outlet 66 Mall. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Elevate your cinematic experiences by celebrating your birthday or special event in their party rooms.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Vega Alta
description: Located in Centro Gran Caribe mall. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Plaza Las Américas
description: Located on Plaza Las Americas second level; San Juan's principal shopping center. Enjoy a variety of cinematic experiences, like 3D movies, rooms with enhanced audio visual projection, party rooms or traditional cinema rooms.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Dorado
description: Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Located in Paseo del Plata Shopping Center. Elevate your cinematic experience by celebrating your birthday or special event in their event halls.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Fajardo
description: Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Elevate your cinematic experience by celebrating your birthday or special event in their party rooms.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Fine Arts Popular
description: Fans of great cinema can enjoy the latest releases of independent and foreign films at Fine Arts. Enjoy an indulgent, guest-focused cinematic experience with the comfort of spacious seating and relaxed ambiance. Located in the San Juan Financial District, commonly known as "Las Milla de Oro".

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Las Catalinas
description: The Caribbean Cinemas movie theater located in Las Catalinas Shopping Center has the best entertainment in the best environment. Conveniently surrounded by a variety of restaurants, this movie theater is the place to go if you're looking to enjoy a chill night of dinner and a movie. Credit cards not accepted, only debit or cash.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Plaza del Sol
description: The Caribbean Cinemas movie theater located in Plaza del Sol Shopping Center. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Elevate your cinematic experience by celebrating your birthday or special event in their party rooms.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Plaza Guaynabo
description: Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Located in Plaza Guaynabo shopping center. Elevate your cinematic experiences by celebrating your birthday or special event in their event halls.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Plaza Río Hondo
description: The Caribbean Cinemas movie theater, conveniently located in the Plaza Rio Hondo shopping center. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - San Germán
description: Enjoy a Hollywood film in one of the rooms in this traditional cinema theater while eating buttery popcorn and the refreshment of your choice. Credit cards not accepted, only debit or cash.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - San Patricio
description: Located in San Patricio Plaza's main floor, this Caribbean Cinemas theater is designed to give you the ultimate viewing experience. Go catch Dinner and a Movie at San Patricio VIP Cinemas movie theater. Enjoy a guest-focused cinematic experience with the comfort of spacious seating and relaxed ambiance.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Santa Isabel
description: Located in Plaza del Prado Shopping Center. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Elevate your cinematic experiences by celebrating your birthday or special event in their party rooms.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Western Plaza
description: Located in Western Plaza Shopping Center. Enjoy family-oriented entertainment and catch new releases on the big screen. Elevate your cinematic experiences by celebrating your birthday or special event in their party rooms.

name: Destilería Coquí Inc
description: In the year 2006, a young Puerto Rican couple Héctor Augusto and María Cristina took upon the mission of taking the oldest and most traditional rum from Puerto Rico “Ron Caña”, which was illegal for over 500 years and legalized it as the registered brand Pitorro® to produce with pride and love.

name: La Destilería Craft Spirits
description: Whether you are a spirits geek or just want a unique experience in the Puerto Rican mountain range, we extend an invitation to our facilities. We are located in Jayuya, PR, just off the main road.

name: Escape Room Puerto Rico
description: YOU ARE LOCKED IN A ROOM... You have 45 minutes to Escape. 3 Unique rooms. Local Themes. Lots of fun! WILL YOU ESCAPE? Escape Room is a new, fun and exciting team-building activity. The team must work together to escape a room in which the members are trapped. These games are designed for group cooperation and offer rewarding challenges. This is a great way to get out of the office for a high-quality team-building exercise.

name: Salsipuedes Aventuras
description: Family-friendly escape room located in the grounds of La Hacienda del Don in Añasco.

name: The Escape Room PR
description: Puerto Rico’s most unique and accessible Escape Rooms. The Escape Room PR main goal is to provide a completely different and amazing experience in our fully immersive rooms. Solve exhilarating puzzles and use lasers, virtual keyboard, computers, and many other devices to find out who was the murderer before times runs out and the assassin strikes again, or eliminate terrorists, free the hostages, and defuse a bomb before it kills us all. We promise you’ll have one of the best experience of your life!

name: Baños de Coamo (Coamo Hot Springs)
description: Discovered in 1847, the Coamo springs are a relaxing oasis nestled in Puerto Rico's mountains. Visitors to the hot springs can enjoy any of the two thermal pools available on site, a spa, gift shop, and a café. The springs are open daily from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm, and the entrance fee is only $3.35.

name: Bosque Comunitario de Río Hondo - Mayagüez
description: A secondary forest that extends to about 70 acres with great agricultural and ecological assets. Located in Barrio Rio Hondo, Mayaguez municipality.n

name: Jardín Botánico de la Universidad de Puerto Rico
description: The University of Puerto Rico's Botanical Garden in San Juan has more than 30,000 native species, endangered species, lakes, waterfalls, trails, and sculptures. The Botanical Garden covers more than 289 hectares, and it has a herbal preservation room with 36,000 preserved plant samples. You can visit the garden on your own, or you can arrange a guided visit ahead of time. Reservations are required for visiting the garden, from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

name: Jardín Botánico y Cultural de Caguas William Miranda Marín
description: Caguas Botanical Garden is known for its history and natural beauty. Tropical plants, endemic plants, and artworks are part of this tropical treasure. In the grounds, you'll find a small lake offering a panoramic view of the botanical garden.

name: Reserva Natural Caño la Boquilla
description: The Caño Boquilla natural reserve is an estuary swamp forest that was officially recognized by the Puerto Rico Department of Natural Resources in 2002. The reserve's ecosystems are ideal for nesting of endangered sea turtles such as the leatherback and the hawksbill. The Antillean manatee has also been seen in the area.

name: Punta Santiago Reserva Natural de Humacao
description: The Humacao Natural Reserve is located on Puerto Rico's southeast coast, between the towns of Humacao and Naguabo. This natural reserve was established in 1986 and it's managed by Puerto Rico's Department of Natural Resources. There is kayaking and bike rental on site. Within the reserve, you'll find multiple trails for hiking and biking, stretches of beaches, fishing spots, and more.

name: Refugio Vida Silvestre, Embalse Guajataca
description: This natural reserve was established specifically for the promotion and management of recreational fishing. The Guajataca Reservoir Wildlife Refuge has facilities specially designed for shore fishing and fishing by boat. The refuge has an information office, gazebos, bathrooms with showers, ramp and carts for boats, and on-site parking for vehicles.

name: Vieques National Wildlife Refuge
description: The Vieques National Wildlife Refuge consists of approximately 17,771 acres of land (3,100 acres on western Vieques and 14,671 acres on eastern Vieques) and it is considered one of the most ecologically diverse wildlife refuges in the Caribbean. It was created from former lands managed by the U.S. Navy. The Refuge contains habitats that include beaches, coastal lagoons, upland forested areas, and mangrove wetlands. It is also home to endangered plants and animals such as the Antillean manatee, the brown pelican, and four species of sea turtles.

name: Vivero de Peces de Maricao
description: The Maricao Fish Hatchery was built in1937 under the direction of renowned biologist Dr. Samuel F. Hildebrand of the Department of Agriculture and Commerce. The purpose of the hatchery was to study some freshwater fish and introduce new species to the island such as Rainbow Trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss) and Brown Trout (Salmo trutta).

name: Bosque Estatal del Nuevo Milenio
description: One of 20 state forests in Puerto Rico, the Nuevo Milenio State Forest is located to the east of the Botanical Garden of Río Piedras. In the forest, you'll find native birds, plants, and trees.

name: Casino del Mar at La Concha Resort
description: Casino del Mar is a beach-styled casino located at La Concha Hotel. The interior design is inspired by the sea highlighting blue tones and open spaces. The Casino atmosphere is elegant, but the energy is spellbinding. Located in the open lobby of La Concha Resort, Casino Del Mar combines atmosphere with high-energy action designed to excite the senses.

name: Casino Metro
description: Live the Casino Metro Experience, “San Juan’s Best Bet” with over 23 thousand square feet of pure entertainment in the Convention District. Strategically located in the heart of the San Juan Convention District. Our privileged location offers visitors easy access to the iconic and cobbled Old San Juan historic site and also to the Condado and Isla Verde touristic areas.

name: Casino Real Caguas at Four Points by Sheraton Caguas Real Hotel & Casino
description: This casino is located inside the Four Points by Sheraton hotel in Caguas. You can test your luck in this entertainment center on the roulette, the Mini Baccarat, the Poker (Texas Hold'em) or the dices; it also counts with 570 slot machines, which makes it the casino with the largest quantity in all of Puerto Rico.

name: El Tropical Casino Bayamón
description: Tropical Casino Bayamón features 14,000 sq ft of gaming space that includes 300 slots machines of denominations that range from $.01 to $5.00 and table games which include Blackjack, Roulette, Craps, and Poker. Along with our gaming, Tropical Casino boasts a bar and lounge area which feature live music, sporting events, and other popular on-demand entertainment shows.

name: Casino at the Wyndham Grand Rio Mar Puerto Rico Golf and Beach Resort
description: Try your luck in the fun and relaxed atmosphere at Wyndham Grand Rio Mar’s on-property casino! A variety of slots & table games are offered, including blackjack, roulette, and Texas hold ‘em. Swing by on the weekends for live music and Sunday Bingo. The casino is open daily from 9 am-10 pm.

name: Casino de la Plaza at Ponce Plaza Hotel & Casino
description: CASINO DE LA PLAZA is Ponce’s premier entertainment and gaming destination. We have an exciting range of table games including live blackjack, craps, roulette, and bingo. The Casino has over 260 state-of-the-art slot machines and offers weekly entertainment.

location.street_address: Calle Reina Esq. Unión & Méndez Vigo

name: Oasis Casino at Embassy Suites by Hilton San Juan
description: Try your luck at the Oasis Casino at the Embassy Suites San Juan Hotel & Casino, featuring 286 slot machines and seven casino tables including blackjack, roulette and 3 Card Poker. This Isla Verde casino is ideal for the rookie gamer playing bingo or the seasoned high-roller at the poker tables.

name: Ocean Casino at Courtyard by Marriott Aguadilla
description: The Ocean Casino is open 24 hours and it's located inside of the Courtyard by Marriott in Aguadilla.

name: Casino del Sol at Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde Beach Resort
description: If you enjoy games and gambling, a stop at Casino del Sol in the Courtyard Marriott at Isla Verde is a stop you should not miss, if you're near this area and feel like trying your luck. This is an exciting place where you will get great service in the best ambiance. Choose from blackjack, poker, roulette and slot machines while you have a drink or munch from the food the Casino offers. This place is going to make your stay an unforgettable experience in Puerto Rico and will exceed your expectations.

name: La Casa del Libro Museo Biblioteca
description: La Casa del Libro Museum and Special Library (LCDL) houses a world-renowned collection of rare books from the 15th Century on as well as historical documents, printing presses, book arts-related objects, and local artworks. Children and adults workshops moderated by bookmakers and professional artists are offered all year round. La Casa del Libro also has a small store that features museum items, books, Puerto Rican arts, and crafts plus unique gifts and souvenirs in support of LCDL’s mission.

name: Chrome Rabbit by Bikismo
description: You'll find this impressive mural in Calle Cerra in Santurce, an area that's replete with colorful murals by both Puerto Rican and international artists. The artist behind this Chrome Rabbit mural is one of the island's most famous muralists, Bikismo, who's internationally-recognized for his singular chrome painting style.

name: Detachment by Susana Cacho
description: This is the first grand-scale mural from Puerto Rican artists Susana Cacho.

name: Glass half full by Fintan Magee
description: Australian artists Fintan Magee made his first mural in Puerto Rico during the 2016 edition of the island's famous street art festival, Santurce es Ley. The mural aims to raise awareness about climate change by depicting a boy carrying an iceberg as water level rise around hin.

name: Ponce es Ley - Jean Ortiz
description: Ponce es Ley is a Street Art event hosted annually where dozens of artists team up to fill the town with murals. Jean Ortíz's mural is of a person covering their face with both hands, as if blinded by something. Various blue circles encase the figure.

name: Ponce es Ley - José Vega
description: Ponce es Ley is a Street Art event hosted annually where dozens of artists team up to fill the town with murals. This mural by artist José Vega depicts two boys outside a small wooden, seemingly poor, house. Underneath, the message "Esperando el regreso del progreso en los tiempos del retroceso", reads.

name: Ponce es Ley - The Stencil Network
description: Ponce es Ley is a Street Art event hosted annually where dozens of artists team up to fill the town with murals. One of these works of art was created by The Stencil Network and features three people tugging a rope. Each of them has a shirt with a primary color and have their faces covered up by masks with a sparkling stars design. The geometric pattern within the bodies helps with the contrast of the body parts.

name: Ponce es Uvita by Sheez Nicole Sanchez
description: This piece was produced at Ponce es Ley, a Street Art event hosted annually where dozens of artists team up to fill the town with murals. Uvita por Sheez by Nicole Sánchez shows a politician in various bright blue and purple tones doing a hand gesture.

name: Señora Señorial by Lapstract
description: This piece was produced at Ponce es Ley, a Street Art event hosted annually where dozens of artists team up to fill the town with murals. Senora Senorial is a mural painting, showcasing a queen-like figure with the flag of Ponce waving behind her.

name: Venados de Culebra by David Zayas
description: You'll find this mural at Playa Sardinera in Culebra.

name: Centro Interpretativo las Salinas de Cabo Rojo Efrén Pérez
description: This visitor center is situated right across from the observation tower that overlooks Cabo Rojo's salt flats. Run by a not-for-profit entity, Caborrojeños Pro Salud y Ambiente, they offer guided visits through the salt flats. The guided visits must be arranged in advance, they're offered Thursday to Saturday from 8:30 am to 4:00 pm, and Sundays from 9:30 am to 5:00 pm.

name: Fuerte de la Concepción
description: The Fuerte de la Concepción was a Spanish military fortress guarding the port and town of Aguadilla, Puerto Rico, in the 18th and 19th centuries. In 1986, the fort's single surviving building was listed on the U.S. National Register of Historic Places.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Centro Ceremonial Indígena de Cagüana
description: The Caguana Indigenous Ceremonial Site is the Caribbean's most important Taíno archeological site, offering visitors a unique glimpse into the indigenous cultures that inhabited the region before the Spanish colonization. The Caguana site is located in Puerto Rico's mountainous town of Utuado, to the east of the Tanamá River. Administered and protected since 1955 by the Instituto de Cultura Puertorriqueña, visitors to the park are allowed to walk through the extensive site, which has 10 "bateys," stone monoliths, and countless petroglyphs.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Antiguo Arsenal de la Marina Española
description: The old Navy Arsenal was built in the 1800s by the Spanish to store ammunition and weapons. After the Spanish-American War, the Americans handed it over to the local government for use as government offices. Nowadays, the old Navy Arsenal is managed by the Instituto de Cultura Puertorriqueña, who rents it out for special events and exhibitions such as the MECA Art Fair.

name: Antiguo Palacio de la Real Intendencia
description: You'll find this imposing structure on the western edge of Old San Juan's Plaza de Armas.

name: Logia Cuna de Betances
description: Birthplace of Ramón Emeterio Betances— a leader of Puerto Rico's abolitionist and independence movements. The property is now used as the headquarters for Cabo Rojo's masonic lodge.

name: Castillo Labadie - Palacete Los Moreau
description: Also known as Hacienda Labadie, the plans to build this historical landmark designed by French architect Paul Servajean date back to the late 19th century, but construction wasn't finished until 1905. Originally, the hacienda's 1,262 acres of land were used for the cultivation of coffee, however, after the Spanish-American war, a switch was made to the on-demand crash cop of the time— sugar cane.

name: Castillo Villa del Mar
description: This beautiful house was built in 1917 by Don Faustino Rodríguez Fuertes, a local sugar cane plantation owner. The style of the house combines victorian elements with "criollo" components such as hydraulic tiles. In 1977, the seafront residence was included in Puerto Rico's national register of historic places. Nowadays, you'll only find the abandoned structure of the house, but even in despair, it's still possible to appreciate the architectural beauty of this historic residence.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Casa Morales Lugo
description: This beautiful residence is the perfect representation of the Victorian style structure of the 20th century, influenced by the North American architecture. It was built by Juan Barón Capriles, an architect from San Germán, for the Don Tomás Vivoni Family. Today, it serves as a home and a wondrous garment placed in front of the Porta Coeli Church, making it a desired place to visit.

name: Casa Olímpica
description: The neoclassical home that houses Puerto Rico's Olympic Committee was built in 1913. The committee has multiple event spaces that it rents out for special events.

name: Cuartel de Ballajá
description: Located in front of Castillo San Felipe del Morro, the Cuartel de Ballajá was built from 1854 to 1864 in order to house the Spanish and Puerto Rican regiments in Old San Juan. After the 1898 invasion by the US Army, the US infantry occupied the Cuartel de Ballajá until 1936. During the Second World War, this structure became a hospital, and in 1976 the Puerto Rican government bought the building. Eventually, this beautiful structure was abandoned and decayed quickly.

name: Font-Ubides House
description: The Font-Ubides House, also known as the Monsanto Residence, is a historic building located on the north side of Castillo Street in Ponce's historic district. The building dates back to 1913 and it was designed by the architect Blas Silva. The building is of architectural significance for its aggressive incorporation of curvilinear forms and ornaments.

name: Isla Culebrita Lighthouse
description: This lighthouse was inaugurated in 1886, and it belongs to the municipal government of Culebra. While the lighthouse is currently closed, you can still admire it from the outside. The beaches and roads in Culebritas are accessible to the general public during the day. To visit Culebritas, you can arrange an excursion with a Water Taxi or any other private options.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Ponce Historic Archive
description: The Ponce Historic Archive is the biggest collection of documents, letters, photos, microfilms and more, on the entire island. It houses over 300,000 files, each containing thousands of more items. Although most of its contents are Ponce related, there are also some collections dedicated to other Puerto Rican municipalities.

name: Casa Ramón Power y Giralt
description: Number 155 Tetuán Street in Old San Juan was the birthplace of Ramón Power y Giralt, the first Puerto Rican delegate to the Courts of Cádiz in Spain. The house was acquired in the late 18th Century by the Power y Giralt family, remaining under their property for many generations until the Conservation Trust of Puerto Rico decided to buy the property in 1989, after having undergone many changes in its use for both residential and commercial purposes.

name: Casa Alcaldía de Ponce
description: The Ponce City Hall is the oldest colonial building in the city, dating back to 1840. The building was listed on the U.S. National Register of Historic Places in 1986 as "Casa Alcaldía de Ponce-City Hall."
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Casa Consistorial de Mayagüez
description: The Casa Consistorial de Mayagüez is also known as the Alcaldia de Mayagüez (town hall). The original structure was built in 1845, but it was destroyed during the 1918 earthquake. Today's structure was rebuilt after the earthquake and inaugurated in 1926.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Antiguo Casino Camuyano
description: This historical structure dates back to 1916 when it was commissioned by the Arrieta family. The original structure was lost during a fire in 1919, and the current structure was inaugurated in 1923. Throughout the years, the property has been used for many purposes, including a casino, a municipal court, and commercial activities.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: La Fortaleza
description: La Fortaleza means “The Fortress,” and it was certainly intended as such when it was completed in 1540 as part of a massive construction effort to secure the island’s defenses. It didn't do so well, though, falling to the Earl of Cumberland in 1598 and the Dutch Commander Boudewyn Hendrick in 1625. In 1846, it was remodeled and converted for full-time use as the governor’s house. The building, which is also known as El Palacio de Santa Catalina (Santa Catalina Palace), has housed no less than 170 governors of Puerto Rico.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Antigua Casa Alcaldía de Bayamón
description: What used to be the official Town Hall of the town of Bayamón until 1980 today houses the Francisco Oller Museum.

name: Antiguo Casino De Ponce
description: The Antiguo Casino de Ponce, or simply the Casino de Ponce, is a historic structure, built-in 1922 and located in Ponce, Puerto Rico. Originally built as a social club for Ponce's elite, it is currently used as the premier reception center in southern Puerto Rico. The building, designed by Agustin Camilo Gonzalez in the Second Empire and Neo-Rococo styles, has a French facade and tones. It was listed in the National Register of Historic Places on October 28, 1987.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Ponce High School
description: The Ponce High School is a public educational institution in Ponce that teaches grades ten through twelve. The school's main building is a historic structure located in the Ponce Historic Zone. From its beginning, the school has secured a unique place in Puerto Rico's educational history. Of over 3,000 schools erected in Puerto Rico in the first quarter of the twentieth century, Ponce High was the largest, "at a time enrolling more students than all the other Puerto Rico high schools combined." For many years, it enrolled more students than any other high school in Puerto Rico.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Castillo San Cristóbal
description: Built from 1634 until 1765, for centuries the Castillo San Cristóbal has been standing guard at the eastern gate of Old San Juan. The imposing fortress was built to guard the city from enemies approaching by land, serving as a counterpart to Castillo San Felipe del Morro. The citadel covers over 27 acres and is the largest one made by the Spaniards in the New World. Fort San Cristóbal, as it is also known, defended the San Juan Bay from foreign attacks, such as the Battle of San Juan in 1797, perpetrated by Ralph Abercromby.

name: Castillo San Felipe del Morro
description: A representative landmark of Puerto Rico’s colonial legacy, the Castillo San Felipe del Morro, or El Morro for short, is an impressive citadel that sits at the very top of Old San Juan. Its construction began in 1539 and concluded around 1790; during those 250 years, the castle became a six-level fortress designed to protect the island from attackers approaching by sea. The bastion – integrated by barracks, dungeons, and storerooms – still holds some of the original cannons facing the ocean.

name: Antigua Chimenea
description: This old chimney is what remains of one of Peñuelas' most influential sugar plantations, Hacienda Clementina.

name: Museo de los Próceres
description: Inaugurated in 1995, this museum is dedicated to Puerto Rico's most illustrious figures, specially those born in Cabo Rojo. The museum has six permanent exhibitions rooms and two temporary ones. The museum's private collection includes works of art by the following Puerto Rican artists: Antonio Martorell, Augusto Marín, Lorenzo Omar, John Balossi, Fernando Santiago, Hiram Palermo, and Sixto Febus.

name: Paseo De La Princesa
description: Enjoy a stroll along San Juan's most beautiful promenade— El Paseo de la Princesa. When visiting Old San Juan, this picture-perfect boardwalk is a must. You can start or end your stroll at the historic Puerta de San Juan, the official gate used during colonial times to guard and protect the old city. The Paseo de la Princesa is lined with beautifully adorned lamp posts and fountains as well as street vendors and hard-to-compete views of the San Juan Bay.

name: Panteón Nacional Román Baldorioty de Castro
description: Panteón Nacional Román Baldorioty de Castro, also known as Cementerio Antiguo de Ponce, is Ponce's oldest cemetery-turned-museum. With over a hundred years of history since its inauguration in 1842, it was converted into an official pantheon in 1991. This famous burial place is considered Puerto Rico's only National Pantheon, as well as the only cemetery made into a museum in the Caribbean. As the name leads on, the remains of the famous politician Baldorioty de Castro are located here, as well as those of other illustrious people.

name: Plaza Colón - San Juan
description: Plaza Colón is one of the most important plazas in all of San Juan. If you enter the San Juan islet by land, through Puerta de Tierra, this plaza will be right at the entrance of the walled city. Before 1897, this eastern part of San Juan was protected by the Puerta de Santiago, one of the stone walls that encircled Old San Juan. Later on, this wall was deemed unnecessary and an obstacle to San Juan’s economic progress, and it was quickly demolished in May of that year.

name: Catedral de San Juan Bautista
description: Old San Juan's venerated cathedral is Puerto Rico's grandest religious building, and one of its most important. In fact, San Juan Bautista is the seat of the Archdiocese of Puerto Rico. It's also the second oldest church in the Western Hemisphere, and the oldest church on U.S. soil. The history of the church dates to 1521 and the earliest beginnings of the Spanish colonization of the island. The building you see today wasn't the original church, which was demolished by a hurricane. The current structure dates to 1540.

name: Capilla del Santo Cristo de la Salud
description: This chapel was built between 1753 and 1780. Legend has it that the Chapel of Christ the Savior was erected to honor a miracle. It is said, that in the year 1750 the Cristo Street was host to a horse race where one of the participants could not stop his horse and fell off the cliff. The Secretary of Government at the time, Don Tomás Mateo Prats is said to have invoked the Santo Cristo de la Salud and that the young man who fell off the cliff was saved. And so, the Secretary of Government ordered the construction of the chapel on sight to honor the miracle.

name: Ruinas Faro Punta Borinquen - Aguadilla
description: Found in the northwest town of Aguadilla, the ruins of the Punta Borinquen lighthouse are found near Aguadilla's Punta Borinquen golf course and they overlook a popular surfing spot. These stunning ruins are the remnants of a lighthouse built in the 18th century by the Spanish, which was partially destroyed by an earthquake in 1918.

name: El Capitolio de Puerto Rico
description: Puerto Rico's Capital building is located at the entrance to the historic Old San Juan area. The structure was inaugurated in 1929 after an initial investment of $300,000. Visitors can arrange for guided tours of the premises.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: La Perla
description: A colorful neighborhood in Old San Juan with one of the most spectacular views of the bay. Located near El Morro, La Perla (the Pearl) has been the setting of various music videos, including “Despacito” by Luis Fonsi and Daddy Yankee. This picturesque sector also hosts a few bars and is becoming a go-to hangout experience for visitors.

name: Mt. Britton Tower
