description: Constructed of stone, the tower was built by the Civilian Conservation Corps in 1937-38, becoming the tallest of the Civilian Conservation Corp towers built with stone masonry. On a clear day, the tower’s observation deck affords the lucky hiker a panoramic view of the surrounding forest, the Atlantic Ocean, the Caribbean Sea, and the southeastern, and northeastern coastal plain. Mt. Britton Tower is located within El Yunque Rainforest. To reach it, you'll need to do a 1.3 km hike that takes around 45-minutes (each way).

name: Alcaldía de Yauco
description: Yauco's Town Hall was built in 1864 and reconstructed in 1924.

name: Aduana de San Juan
description: Known as U.S. Custom House too. This building is designed by Albert B. Nichols. The architecture plateresque style from the Spaniards makes it a unique experience in San Juan. Recognized as a place with historic value. Since its construction was finished, in 1931, this building doesn't have that many alterations. Come by to enjoy this wonderful space, filled with Puerto Rican historical treasures.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Puerta de San Juan
description: The entrance to Old San Juan is known as Puerta de Aguas or Puerta de San Juan (San Juan Gate). It is one of the most colorful and known of all the entrances to the walled city and it has stood tall for centuries. The gate is 16 feet tall and 20 feet thick and leads you to the romantic Paseo La Princesa. The inscription above it reads “Benedictus Oui Venit In Nomine Domini” which translates to “Welcome those who come in the name of God,” a testament to the island’s Catholic roots.

name: Faro de Puerto Ferro
description: This lighthouse was one of the last ones built by the Spanish before the Spanish-American War. The Puerto Ferro lighthouse is located on the island's southern coast, and though it is abandoned since 1926, you'll find that it bears a resemblance to Vieques's other lighthouse, the Punta Mulas lighthouse.

name: Faro Los Morrillos de Cabo Rojo
description: Located on an isolated point with white lime cliffs surrounded by lagoons and marshes, Cabo Rojo's lighthouse, built in 1882, marks the southeast entrance from the Caribbean Sea through the Mona Passage into the Atlantic Ocean. Cabo Rojo's lighthouse has simple decorative elements including an unelaborated cornice that is repeated in the tower. Although originally housing two keepers and an engineer, the lighthouse was left unmanned following a 1967 renovation and automation.

name: Hector El Protector
description: Hector El Protector was Thomas Dambo's contribution to the art festival Culebra Es Ley on the island of Culebra in Puerto Rico. Hector was made in 5 days using pallets from the local junkyard. Hector is a permanent installation protecting the island from visitors with bad intentions towards the nature of the island.

name: Cruceta Del Vigía
description: Cruceta del Vigía is a 100 feet tall cross located atop Vigia Hill in Ponce, across from Museo Castillo Serrallés. It houses a tourist center at its base, a ten-story vertical tower, and a horizontal sky bridge that has panoramic views of the city and the Caribbean Sea. Visitors can reach the skybridge via glass elevators or a staircase. Made of reinforced concrete, the cross has withstood various natural disasters. The arms of the cross measure 70 feet. It was inaugurated in 1984.

name: Plaza Las Delicias
description: Plaza Las Delicias is the main plaza in the town of Ponce, Puerto Rico. The historic Parque de Bombas and Ponce Cathedral buildings are located within the plaza, which actually consists of two squares: Plaza Muñoz Rivera on the north and Plaza Degetau on the south. The square is the center of the Ponce Historic Zone, and it is surrounded by the Ponce City Hall, the historic Teatro Fox Delicias, the Banco de Crédito y Ahorro Ponceño and Banco de Ponce buildings, and the Armstrong-Poventud Residence. The square dates back to the early Spanish settlement in Ponce of 1670.

name: Plaza Publica de Peñuelas
description: This is Peñuela's main town square and where you'll find the town's most important historical buildings. In this plaza, you'll also find an exhibition of the town's first locomotive.

name: El Túnel del Tren en Guajataca
description: The Guajataca Tunnel of Isabela was constructed in 1904 and it crosses the mountain that separates Playa Guajataca from Playa Mirador. In 2000, it was declared a Historical Monument and it is one of the most visited spots in this part of the Island. Come for a walk thru this tunnel and discover the history and the many surprises it has in store for you.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Puente Dos Hermanos
description: This is not your typical bridge. The brothers Hernan and Sosthenes Behn where part of the process of urbanization in Santurce, they built this bridge. The people from Santurce started calling the bridge Puente Dos Hermanos (Bridge Two Brothers, in English) and has been called like this ever since. From Condado to Ashford Avenue, it directs you to Old San Juan. Enjoy the view of the amazing Laguna del Condado (Condado Lagoon, in English).

name: Puente Teodoro Moscoso
description: The Puente Teodoro Moscoso is a water toll bridge that connects San Juan to Isla Verde by crossing the Laguna San José. It's just a couple of minutes away from the Luis Muñoz Marín airport, the Mall of San Juan and Isla Verde's most popular hotels. The Puente is also the annual setting for the World's Best 10K, which can boast a massive following of amateur and professional marathoners. As of May 2018, the toll cost is $3.50 one way.

name: Puente Villarán
description: Also known as the Canóvanas Bridge, the Puente Villarán was built in 1892 between the town of Río Grande and Río Piedras. This historic bridge was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1995.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Puente De Trujillo Alto
description: This bridge was built in 1938 for a total cost of $125,000. In 1985, it was replaced by a more modern bridge, and in 2004 it was declared a historical monument.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Museo de la Historia de San Germán
description: Travel through time and discover the wonders this museum has to offer. The museum has four exhibition halls devoted to significant moments in San Germán's history. One of the museum's exhibition rooms is fully dedicated to the town's basketball team, the Atléticos.

location.street_address: Calle Don Félix Arce Lugo #32, esquina De la Cruz

name: Hacienda Pons
description: Hacienda Pons, formerly known as Hacienda Buena Vista, was founded in 1936 by Pedro Pons Arbona. This farm located in the Castañer sector, Bartolo neighborhood, continues to operate in the coffee sector, maintaining its original structures and machinery. It produces the Café Bartolo brand coffee named in honor of Barrio Bartolo the name of the neighboorhood where it is located. Services offered at Hacienda Pons: • historical tour • wet and dry coffee process • coffee roasting • coffee tastings • gastronomy • Any other need that is required.

name: Alcaldía de Añasco
description: Añasco's Town Hall building is built in the same lot where the original structure once stood. The original town hall structure was destroyed in the earthquake of 1918.

name: Centro Cultural de Arecibo
description: Here you'll find a small museum dedicated to the history of Arecibo and its illustrious sons and daughters.

name: Casa Alcaldía de Comerío
description: This architectural landmark houses the official town hall for the town of Comerío.

name: Alcaldía de Las Marias
description: The town hall building in Las Marias was built following the local architecture style and not the typical Spanish style that you'll find throughout many other towns. The structure was built towards the end of the 19th century, after the town's founding in 1871.

name: Aduana de Ponce
description: The US Custom House building has been accumulating bits of history since it first opened in 1842. It's the oldest customs house in the island and the only one of its type under the United States flag. Located in the Barrio Playa in Ponce, the place served as a base for the American Army during the Spanish-American War. The building has survived a number of dangerous events, such as a massive fire and an earthquake, even though it got remodeled after the later in 1924.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Alcaldía de Aguada
description: The original structure for Aguada's Town Hall dates back to the town's founding in 1648. Throughout the years, the original structure suffered severe damage due to natural disasters and a fire in 1912. Starting in 1925, architect Rafael Carmoega worked on a new town hall, and construction was finalized in 1929. The style of this historical building is neoclassical, and it follows the 19th century's preference for clean and stylized lines.

name: Alcaldía de Cabo Rojo
description: After being inaugurated in 1907, Cabo Rojo's Town Hall building has gone through two renovations, one in 1958 and the second one in 2003.

name: Alcaldía de Ciales
description: The town hall building for the town of Ciales was built in 1915.

name: Casa Alcaldía de Culebra
description: Culebra's Town Hall was originally built in the 1930s, and it was remodeled in 1989 after Hurricane Hugo.

name: Alcaldía de Dorado
description: The official town hall for the town of Dorado was built during the early 20th century.

name: Alcaldía de Guayama
description: While Guayama's Town Hall was remodeled in the 1920s, it still conserves the architectural style of the late 19th century.

name: Alcaldía de Guayanilla
description: This town hall building was built in 1852, and in the past, it also served as a prison and a hospital.

name: Alcaldía de Gurabo
description: Gurabo's Town Hall was built in 1854, following the neo-classical architectural style. In 1994 the town built a new town hall, phasing the old one out of use.

name: Alcaldía de Hatillo
description: Hatillo's Town Hall is located right across from the town's main public square.

name: Alcaldía de Hormigueros
description: This town hall dates back to 1927, but due to renovations done in 1989, the building appears to be more modern.

name: Alcaldía de Lajas
description: This town hall dates back to 1889, and in the past, the building was also used as a jail, a court, and even a telegraph office.

name: Casa Alcaldía de Naguabo
description: Initially built between 1924 and 1929 as a jail, this historical landmark used to house Naguabo's town hall.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Alcaldía de San Lorenzo
description: This town hall was built in the late 19th century, specifically in 1877.

name: Casa Alcaldía de Santa Isabel
description: Built in the late 19th century, Santa Isabel's Town Hall follows the neo-classical architectural style of the time.

name: Edificio Antigua Casa Alcaldía Trujillo Alto
description: Este edificio data de 1928, se utilizó hasta el 2006 como el Centro de Administración Municipal pero fue remodelado y reconstruido en el 2012. Dicha estructura, es dedicada a la memoria de la ex alcaldesa, Elsie Calderón Rodríguez. Actualmente, este edificio alberga las oficinas de Desarrollo Comunal, Servicios al Ciudadano, Vivienda, Alianza Municipal de Servicios Integrados y la Oficina de Servicios a Personas con Impedimentos.

name: Alcaldía de Vega Baja
description: Vega Baja's Town Hall was inaugurated in 1924. In this town hall, you'll see a clock designed and made by one of the world's most famous clock makers, Seth Thomas from Bristol, England. The clock, one of the few ones on the island, stopped working in 1970 and in 1984 it was repaired.

name: Alcaldía de San Juan
description: San Juan’s town hall sits in front of the Plaza de Armas, right at the heard of the walled city. Its iconic facade of pillars and arches is reminiscent of the late Renaissance architecture, although the construction of the structure started around the turn of the 18th century. Over the centuries, the town hall experienced numerous additions and expansions. Its final design was completed in 1842 by architect Pedro García. Inside you can admire its regal staircase and walk around its patios.

name: Alcaldía de Moca
description: Moca's current town hall is situated in the same space as where the original used to be, which dated back to 1827.

name: Antigua Casa Alcaldía de Caguas
description: The original town hall of the city of Caguas dates back to 1860, although it didn't officially become the government center until 1887. The building is incredibly well-maintained, and it still conserves the original facade and its neoclassical architectural style. While it no longer functions as the official town hall, the structure is now used as the town's official museum.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Alcaldía de Corozal
description: This is the official Town Hall for the town of Corozal, which is located in the island's central mountains.

name: Casa Alcaldía de Adjuntas
description: The first two town hall structures built on the town of Adjuntas both suffered the same ending— they were both burned to the ground in accidental fires. After the last fire, in 1923, a new town hall was built in the same space that the previous one had occupied.

name: Alcaldía de Arroyo
description: Arroyo's Town Hall dates back to 1860. When the town hall was first inaugurated, it housed a jail on the first floor and offices on the second.

name: Alcaldía de Cayey
description: The town hall for the town of Cayey dates back to 1899 when it was fully rebuilt after the passing of Hurricane Ciriaco.

name: Casa Alcaldía de Coamo
description: Coamo's Town Hall dates back to the mid-ninetieth century, and its architectural style is in tune with the Andalusian style.

name: Alcaldía de Utuado
description: Utuado was founded in 1739. It is known as the "City of Viví" and the town of "Los montañeses". Its patron is Saint Michael the Archangel. The territory of the municipality extends across 299 square kilometers (115 square miles). It is made up of the neighborhoods: Utuado-town, Angeles, Arenas, Caguana, Caníaco, Caonillas Arriba, Caonillas Abajo, Consejo, Don Alonso, Guaónico, Las Palmas, Limón, Mameyes Abajo, Paso Palmas, Río Abajo, Roncador, Sabana Grande, I jumped down, I jumped up, Santa Isabel, Santa Rosa, Tetuán, I lived up and I lived down.

name: Antigua Casa Alcaldía de San Germán
description: This structure now houses the tourism office for the town of San Germán, but initially, it functioned as a town hall. The building was completed in 1844.

name: Castillo El Cortijo
description: This "castle" build in the Spanish Revival architectural style was constructed in the 1930s for the family of Don Secundino Lozana Cepa. The house was designed by fame Puerto Rican architect, Rafael Carmoega Morales, who was also involved in the design of Puerto Rico's capitol building.

name: Cementerio Santa María Magdalena de Pazzis
description: The Santa María Magdalena de Pazzis cemetery was established in the 19th Century and is cataloged as one of the most beautiful memorial parks in the world. The oceanfront location of the historical landmark is derives from a superstitious belief that the deceased started a journey over to “the great beyond”. This cemetery is the final resting place of many of Puerto Rico's most prominent natives.

name: Busto del Cacique Hayuya y Tumba del Indio
description: This monument and mausoleum honor the cultural heritage of Puerto Rico's pre-Columbian inhabitants, the Taínos.

name: Hacienda Muñoz
description: Just half an hour from San Juan, Hacienda Muñoz is a small coffee plantation located in rural San Lorenzo. Take a walking tour of the hacienda where you'll learn about Puerto Rico's coffee history as well as modern methods for grow, processing, and roasting coffee. The tour ends with a tasting of Hacienda Muñoz's specialty coffee. After the tour, stop by their coffee shop or enjoy a hearty, traditional lunch at the hacienda's restaurant.

name: Hacienda Los Eucaliptos
description: This family-owned third-generation farm is home to over 150,000 coffee trees. You can visit the hacienda to participate in their coffee experience, where they'll teach you about the history of coffee in Puerto Rico, the harvest/production process, and give you the chance to tour an old hacienda house filled with antiques. The venue can also be rented out for special events.

name: Monumento A La Herencia Taína
description: Inaugurated in 2001, this bronze monument, located in the north entrance of the city of Caguas, exhibits a Taína woman with her arms extended in a welcoming gesture. Accompanied by a beautiful fountain, this monument has become an iconic symbol of the city. This piece was made by the artist María Elena Perales, and it is an homage to the island's Taíno roots, as well as a tribute to the women of Caguas.

name: Monumento Jesús T. Piñero
description: This bronze statue was made in 1965 by the sculptor José A. Buscaglia and it represents Puerto Rico's first Puerto Rican governor, Jesús T. Piñero.

name: Fuente de los Leones
description: The famous Fuente de Los Leones (Lios Fountains) is located in Ponce's main town square, Plaza las Delicias. It's a one-of-a-kind water fountain surrounded by lion statues, which are the main symbol of the city of Ponce. The fountain dates back to 1939 when it was purchased at New York's World Fair.

name: San Juan National Historic Site
description: The San Juan National Historic Site preserves the history of the island, told through Castillo San Felipe del Morro, Castillo San Cristóbal, Fuerte San Juan de la Cruz (El Cañuelo), the San Juan Gate, and most of the city walls. For centuries, countries fought for control of this Caribbean island because of its strategic location. Be inspired by the stories and the beauty of the architecture and the ingenuity of design of this UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Faro de Punta Higüera
description: Rincón's lighthouse, Faro de Punta Higüera, was built in 1892 to cover the distance between two other lighthouses on Puerto Rico's west coast. Since 1993 the lighthouse has functioned as a recreational park with a maritime museum, kiosks, and an observation deck that looks out to the Atlantic Ocean. Depending on the time of year, whales sightings might be possible. The lighthouse is right next to Domes Beach in Rincón, a surfer beach where surfing competitions are routinely held.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Monumento Fernando Luis Garcia Ledesma
description: With this monument and mural, the town of Utuado honors the legacy of the first and only Marine from Puerto Rico to receive the Medal of Honor. Fernando Luis Garcia Ledesma was awarded the medal of honor posthumously for his services during the Koren War.

name: Plaza de Recreo de la Revolución
description: The town of Lares is known for an attempted revolution that a group of Puerto Ricans led against the Spanish in 1868. In the town's beautiful plaza, you'll find a monument commemorating the famous Grito de Lares as well as the bust of Don Ramón Emeterio Betances, the leader of the attempted revolution.

name: Casa Ulanga
description: This was the first three-story structure built in Arecibo. Dating back to 1850, Casa Ulanga has served multiple functions throughout the years. Initially, it was the residence of the Ulanga family, but it went on to be used as a hospital, jail, courthouse, and more. Today, Casa Ulanga houses the Casa de la Cultura Arecibeña.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Ruinas de Puerto Hermina
description: Legend has it that the ruins found at Herminia beach in Quebradillas used to be a storage place or a hideout for pirates. Dating back to the 18th century, it's more plausible that these ruins were a military post or a customs office. The fort was almost completely forgotten until 1952 when the ruins were rediscovered.

name: Faro Punta Mulas
description: Standing tall and proud atop a hill in Vieques, you'll find the Faro Punta Mulas. This lighthouse was built in 1895 and since then it's been restored a number of times. Nowadays, the lighthouse houses a small museum on maritime history.

name: Mausoleo Dr. Ramón Emeterio Betances
description: The mausoleum for one of Puerto Rico's most illustrious figures, Ramón Emeterio Betances, is found in Cabo Rojo's main town square. Born in 1927 in Cabo Rojo, Betances was a doctor and one of the leaders of the island's abolitionist and independence movements.

name: Monumento al Veterano - Camuy
description: This monument honors all of the fallen soldiers from Camuy that participated in any of the wars fought by the United States.

name: Monumento al Soldado - Añasco
description: This monument honors the fallen soldiers from Añasco on the Second World War, the Korean War, and the Vietnam War.

name: Monumento al Soldado - Corozal
description: This monument honors the legacy to all of the fallen soldiers from Corozal that participated in the Korean War and the Vietnam War.

name: Monumento a la Máscara Hatillana
description: This bronze monument celebrates and honors one of Puerto Rico's most famous celebrations, the Festival de las Máscaras de Hatillo. This festival is celebrated every year on December 28, the Day of the Innocents.

name: Plazuela de la Rogativa
description: Hidden away to the right side of Puerto Rico's governor's mansion, La Fortaleza, you'll find La Rogativa sculpture. With one of the best views of the San Juan Bay, the sculpture commemorates a women-led religious procession that took place in 1797. The legend goes that the British Armada was planning to invade San Juan, but were spooked away by hundreds of torches that they saw on land and believing that they were reinforcements they halted their invasion.

name: Monumento Salvador Brau
description: This monument honors the legacy of Puerto Rico's first official historian, Salvador Brau, who was born in the town of Cabo Rojo in 1842. He was also a poet, journalist, and playwright. The monument was made by Spanish sculptor F. Mares, and it's one of the highest monuments found on the island.

name: Obelisco de Cabo Rojo
description: Cabo Rojo's Obelisk Monument was built in 1961 in honor of the 128 families that signed the petition to officially established the town of Cabo Rojo.

name: Plaza Dársenas
description: Located right next to Port 1 of San Juan, Plaza Dársenas has always been a center for friends to meet and enjoy music and art. During the day, you can enjoy the view of the Bay of San Juan, see the cruise ships arrive, eat, and drink. At night, you can still eat and drink but you will also get to enjoy live music, art exhibitions, and party on board the boat La Rumba. Some of the attractions of this square are The Casita de los Rones bar, water taxis, food stands, and more.

name: Fuerte Caprón
description: Found at the end of one of the most hiked trails in the Bosque Seco de Guánica, Fuerte Caprón has some of the most scenic views in the dry forest. From the fort ruins, you'll be able to bask in the breathtaking views of the Guánica Bay and the astounding natural surroundings of this tropical dry coastal forest. Fuerte Caprón was originally built in the 16th century by the Spanish and later repurposed by U.S. troops after the Spanish-American war.

name: Casa De Piedra
description: This architectural gem was built in Maricao's State Forest during the 1930s as part of President Roosevelt's Civilian Conservation Corps.

name: Plaza de Recreo Adjuntas
description: The town of Adjuntas is located high-up in Puerto Rico's central mountain range. Surrounding the town's plaza, you'll find several historic buildings such as the town's church and town hall.

name: Plaza Pública de Aguas Buenas
description: Make your way over to Aguas Buenas' urban center, and you're bound to see the town's main plaza. The plaza is beautifully kept with a garden and a fountain that lights up at night.

name: Plaza de Recreo de Naguabo
description: Naguabo's main town square is the second largest town square in all of Puerto Rico. The beautiful plaza is surrounded by luscious trees, and it has a grand total of five water fountains. One of the plaza's water fountains is the town's original aqueduct. In the plaza, visitors will also encounter several historical monuments like the town's first Catholic church and the statue of Ramón del Rivero "Diplo," one of Puerto Rico's first comedians.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Plaza Pública de Orocovis
description: On October 29, 1838, the Saint John Baptist parish was inaugurated in the town's main plaza. Over the years the structures of the church and the plaza have been rebuilt and remodeled several times. The lands where the plaza and church are built were donated by the town's founder, Juan de Rivera y Santiago.

name: Plaza Pública de Rincón
description: Rincón's town plaza is one of the island's most visited, and after just one visit you'll understand why. The plaza is surrounded by numerous restaurants, bars, and stores. Every Thursday night, this town square is taken over by local artisans selling their beautifully made crafts.

name: Plaza de Recreo Santiago R. Palmer
description: Caguas' main town square was originally built in the 18th century. However, it wasn't until 1906 when the plaza got its name, in honor of the Puerto Rican politician Santiago R. Palmer. Today, the town square is surrounded by the town's main museums, restaurants, and more. Come and have a cup of local coffee while enjoying the view of the town's Cathedral.

name: Plaza de Recreo Trujillo Alto
description: La construcción de la primera Plaza de Recreo comenzó en 1910 y se terminó en 1913, la misma, constaba con un diseño de un solo nivel paralelo con la Parroquia Santa Cruz y bordeada con escalinatas y bancos. En aquella época era el punto de encuentro en donde se realizaba todo tipo de eventos sociales. Luego en 1975, se le cambió completamente el diseño, a uno de dos niveles y con una concha acústica para celebrar eventos.

name: Plaza Pública de Villalba
description: Just like all of the municipalities in Puerto Rico, Villalba's town plaza is surrounded by the town's most important buildings, including the town hall.

name: Plaza Salvador Brau
description: An open space with a lot of history. Named after the first American-appointed governor of Puerto Rico, Salvador Brau. Surrounded by artworks. Experience a traditional Puerto Rican space. Check for events and other activities that might be of your interest. Plaza Salvador Brau, a park where you can hang out with friends and locals.

name: Alcaldía de Juana Diaz
description: Juana Díaz's town hall was built at the end of the 19th century, following the Spanish architectural style of the time.

name: Hacienda Don Carmelo
description: This location is an ideal place to celebrate Wedding Ceremonies, Private Receptions and Corporate Events. There are guided tours on the first Saturday of the month, from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. It is also the Horse Breeders Headquarters of the Puerto Rican School of Equestrian Art.

name: Alcaldía de Carolina
description: Welcome to Carolina, also known as the Land of Giants! We invite you to discover, explore, and enjoy our beautiful and great city. Come visit our renowned museums, where you will meet our giant Felipe Birriel, the famous poet Julia de Burgos, one of the greatest baseball players of all time, Roberto Clemente, and many others. Learn about our history, art, and what makes our town special.

name: US Post Office and Courthouse
description: The Miguel Angel Garcia Mendez Post Office Building in Mayagüez, Puerto Rico, previously known as the United States Post Office and Courthouse and also known as Correo Central de Mayagüez is a post office and courthouse facility of the United States, housing operations of the United States District Court for the District of Puerto Rico. It was designed by Louis A. Simpson and was built in 1935.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Caribbean University Bayamón
description: In 1969, Caribbean Junior College, the predecessor institution of Caribbean University, was founded in the city of Bayamón, Puerto Rico. This is characterized as a private education institution, non-profit, co-educational and non-sectarian. Caribbean University was authorized by the Higher Education Council of Puerto Rico to offer associate degrees in 1974 and baccalaureate degrees in 1978. In 1977, it received its first accreditation from the Middle States Association of Colleges and Schools.

name: Mirador de Aguadilla
description: A roadside observation area with panoramic views of the Aguadilla bay. Ideal as a rest stop from a road trip or to observe a beautiful sunset.

name: Hiram Bithorn Stadium
description: The Hiram Bithorn Stadium is a baseball park in San Juan that can accommodate up to 18,000 attendees. Additionally to its primary function as a baseball park, the stadium is also used for concerts and festivals. In 2014, the stadium which was built in 1962 was added to the National Register of Historic Places. On occasion, the Major League Baseball will play some of its winter season games in the Hiram Bithorn Stadium.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Monte Sagrado
description: Hacienda Horizonte is the refuge of Draco Rosa. This paradise is over 247 acres, where you can see and feel the beauty of nature in every corner of the hacienda. It is a restful place where you can learn and experience corporal and spiritual healing. Hacienda Horizonte is a unique place located in Utuado, Puerto Rico where you can savor its abundance of foods that are harvested from the farm.

name: Ponce YMCA Building
description: Ponce's YMCA Building has been in continuous use since 1955 when it was inaugurated. In 2012, the structure was added to the National Register of Historic Places, mostly due to its interior mural by Rafael Rios Rey.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Arecibo Lighthouse & Historical Park
description: The Arecibo Lighthouse and Historical Park is a cultural theme park located in the Arecibo Lighthouse. It has an innovative and unique concept that includes five cultural representations of Puerto Rico's history. Transporting visitors through historical and cultural events that include the Spanish Conquest of 1493 and the Spanish-American War of 1898.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: El Yunque National Forest
description: The only rainforest within the U.S. National Forest System receives an annual fluvial precipitation of almost 400 billion liters of rain. Its waterfalls, orchids, giant ferns, imposing tabonuco trees, and palms make it a true paradise for the photographer and nature lover. On El Yunque's main road, visitors will find La Coca waterfall and Yokahú Tower, an observation spot that looks over the rainforest's lush green vegetation and on to the east coast of the island.

name: Bosque Estatal de Guánica
description: A United Nations International Biosphere Reserve, the Guánica State Forest, also know as El Bosque Seco de Guánica, is one of the most extensive tropical dry coastal forests in the world, totaling around 9,000 acres of land. The reserve features 12 different trails to choose from, with varying degrees of difficulty. It is a paradise for birdwatchers with a variety of exotic birds that thrive in warm habitats. The forest is a nature-lover ideal adventure, as it contains more than 600 species of flora and fauna, as well as its 48 endangered animal species.

name: La Guancha de Ponce
description: La Guancha is one of the hottest hang out spots in Ponce, literally, it's right next to the beach. Take a trip to this boardwalk facing the Caribbean Sea to find an array of fun things to do. Start by having a meal at some of the kiosks turned restaurants, and then have a drink at one of the bars. You can also buy some seeds and feed the birds, fish, and pelicans that are always around the boardwalk grounds. Finish the visit by going up the Guancha Lighthouse and enjoying the view.

name: Playa Puerto Hermina
description: You'll find this beach almost hidden at the end of road #4485 in the town of Quebradillas. This beach is a great surfing spot year-round, but both surfers and swimmers are encouraged to exercise caution as the area can have rip currents.

name: Museo Casa Blanca
description: Originally built in 1521 as the main residence for Puerto Rico's first governor, Juan Ponce de León, this landmark is Old San Juan's oldest residence. Nowadays, the residence serves as a museum housing 16th and 17th-century artifacts. Museums Hours of Operation: Wednesday to Sunday 8:00AM – 11:45AM 1:00PM – 4:00PM

name: Museo y Parque Histórico Ruinas de Caparra
description: The Caparra Archeological Site is a National Historic Landmark that encompasses the location and significant remains of Puerto Rico’s first capital – some of the oldest evidence of the Spanish in the “New World.” The archeological site at Caparra has provided information that has been instrumental in understanding early construction materials and techniques in Puerto Rico, as well as Spanish colonialism in the Caribbean Island region.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Centro Ceremonial Indígena de Tibes
description: The Centro Ceremonial Indigena, located in Tibes ward, close to the town of Ponce, is one of the largest and most important ceremonial sites in Puerto Rico. Archeological investigation and radiocarbon dating indicate that the site's major period of occupation was from 400 through 1000 AD. The site consists of several stone-lined courts/plazas shaded by native trees. The last inhabitants of the site are believed to have been Tainos. Admission is $3/adult, discount for children under 12, seniors, handicapped, students (with ID). Adults over 75 and kids under 5 are free. Cash only.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Mural de Zama
description: This indigenous "mural" is located on the island's highest point, Cerro Punta. Only accessible after a long hike, the rocks were the "mural" is inscribed is full of indigenous petroglyphs, with the most famous one being the Sol Taíno de Jayuya.

name: Fortín Conde de Mirasol
description: The Fortín Conde de Mirasol was the last small fort built by the Spaniards in America. It sits atop a beautiful hill overlooking the town of Isabel Segunda in Vieques and nearby cays. The fort was never completed and now houses an art and history museum, as well as Vieques's historic archives, and a radio station.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Museo de Arte Religioso Porta Coeli
description: The former convent chapel was built in 1606, and it is the second oldest church in Puerto Rico. It is also one of the oldest churches in the Americas and the most important religious art museum on the island. The over 400-year-old museum is managed by the Instituto de Cultura de Puerto Rico, and it's open from Wednesday to Sunday.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: San José Church
description: The second oldest church in the Americas was established in 1532 under Spanish rule, and it highlights the Gothic architecture of the time. It was the resting place of Juan Ponce de León for 350 years, and it still bears his coat of arms. It remains the final resting place of José Campeche, one of Puerto Rico's most revered artists. Since 2003, the church has been under works for preservation, and it was named one of the US' most endangered sites due to its deterioration.

name: Ermita San Antonio De Padua De La Tuna
description: Built during the 1730s the Ermita San Antonio De Padua De La Tuna, was the original church built in the village that preceded the establishment of the town of Isabela. The ruins are easily accessible from the main PR-2 road.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Catedral Nuestra Señora de la Guadalupe
description: In the center of Ponce's historic zone is the Cathedral Our Lady of Guadalupe, better known as Ponce Cathedral. The building adds up around 300 years of history, going through many changes in its lifetime.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Hacienda Luz de Luna
description: Hacienda Luz de Luna is a working coffee hacienda that's located in the mountainous region of Puerto Rico, specifically in the town of Adjuntas. The coffee hacienda offers tours through their plantation as well as historical tours. Additionally, the hacienda has multiple spaces to accommodate groups, events, private meetings, and more. There's a restaurant on-site, but prior reservation is required.

name: Museo de la Historia de Ponce
description: Casa Salazar-Candal is a historic house located in Ponce's historic town center. The structure dates back to 1911 and it was designed by the architect Blas Silva. The architecture draws from multiple architectural styles including 19th Classical revival, Art Nouveau, and Spanish Revival. Today the Salazar–Candal Residence houses the History Museum of Ponce. Inaugurated in 1992, the museum depicts the city's ecology, economy, architecture, government, and elements of daily life.

name: Parque de Bombas
description: You'll find the historic and emblematic red and black Parque de Bombas in the southern town of Ponce. Instantly recognizable, this old fire station is one of the island's most photographed landmarks. The Parque de Bombas is located in Ponce's enchanting town square, Plaza de las Delicias, directly behind the town's cathedral. For many years, the building housed the city's main fire station, and now it houses a small museum. The Parque de Bombas was Puerto Rico's first-ever fire station, and it was listed in the National Register of Historic Places on July 12, 1984.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Teatro Priscila Flores
description: Built at the start of the 20th century, the Priscila Flores Theatre was considered the social center of the town of San Lorenzo. Reconstructed twice, first after Hurricane San Felipe in 1928 and then after a fire in the 1940s, the theatre functioned until 1984. In 1986, the municipality bought the theatre to preserve it. Nowadays, the theatre can be rented out for private functions/events.

name: Museo de la Guardia Nacional
description: Inaugurated in 2002, the Museo de la Guardia Nacional takes visitors through the history of Puerto Rico's National Guard.

name: Museo y Centro Cultural Casa del Rey
description: Constructed as a "parador," or inn, about 1823, Casa del Rey, the "King's House," provided housing for Spanish government personnel. The building, the oldest in the town of Dorado, also served as the regional military headquarters. In 1848, Jacinto López purchased the structure; in converting it into a residence, he added two wings which created a U-shaped configuration around an interior patio. In 1871, Casa del Rey became the home of Manuel Alonso y Pacheco--Puerto Rico's notable romantic writer.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Castillo Serrallés
description: The Castillo Serrallés Museum is a 1930s Spanish Revival-style home built by the Serrallés family of the famous DonQ rum. It has a butterfly nursery, the Vigía Cross, and a Japanese garden: an oasis of peace with benches, pagodas, and koi ponds. This venue is perfect for weddings, social events, and more. The museum has a permanent exhibition, and guided tours are given in English and Spanish.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Basílica Menor Nuestra Señora de la Monserrate
description: The Basílica Menor Nuestra Señora de la Monserrate dates back to the 17th century and it's only one of two minor basilicas recognized by the Pope in Puerto Rico.

name: San Germán de Auxerre Church
description: The church of San Germán de Auxerre (French Saint of the 5th century) bears its name in honor of Doña Germana de Foix, second wife of King Ferdinand the Catholic. It is located on a mound dominating the Francisco Mariano Quiñones public square, in the center of town, and facing the old town hall. The original structure was made of wood and straw.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Batería del Escambrón
description: Batería del Escambrón is a great family spot. The place offers various entertainment options. You can enjoy a bike tour or simply a walk by the deck enjoy the sea breeze.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Fortín de San Jerónimo del Boquerón
description: The Fortress of San Jerónimo del Boquerón is a small fort located at the mouth of the Condado Lagoon, across from the historic sector of Miramar in San Juan. It was built during the 18th century to replace a smaller battery (called El Boquerón) that stood at the easternmost end of the San Juan islet. The original Boquerón battery was used by the Spanish to defend the city of San Juan from attacks by Sir Francis Drake in 1595 and George Clifford, the third Earl of Cumberland in 1598, who managed to destroy it during his attack.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Casa Paoli
description: Casa Paoli is a historic house in barrio Cuarto in Ponce that was the birthplace of the Puerto Rican tenor Antonio Paoli, who was born in 1871. The house was the childhood home of the artist and where he was introduced to art and opera. In 1987, the house was turned into a museum to honor the career of Antonio Paoli, and in 2009 it was listed on the U.S. National Register of Historic Places in 2009.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Casa Wiechers Villaronga
description: The Casa Wiechers-Villaronga is a neo-classical style mansion in Ponce. It was designed and built in the early twentieth century. The house was acquired and restored by the Instituto de Cultura de Puerto Rico and now operates as the Museo de la Arquitectura Ponceña.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Museo Casa Cautiño
description: Take a glimpse at life in the 19th century at this historic house turned museum filled original furnishings, paintings, and personal artifacts.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Alcaldía de Luquillo
description: Construction on Luqiillo's town hall was finished in 1932. Since then, the building has been in continuous use as the municipality's main administrative center.

name: Antiguo Acueductos del río Piedras
description: For more than a century, the Aqueduct promoted the growth of the city along its mainline and through its branches to the rest of the neighborhoods throughout the city. The historic site is an oasis within the urbanized atmosphere of San Juan. It covers approximately 24 r of which nine are managed by Para la Naturaleza and include a two-kilometer segment of the Piedras River.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Casa Aboy Inc.
description: For many years Casa Aboy was the residence of the Aboy-Ferrer family, The historical residence now houses the Federation of Photojournalists of Puerto Rico. The structure has been declared part of Puerto Rico's cultural heritage, and it often hosts many cultural events and workshops.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Faro de Punta Tuna
description: The Punta Tuna Lighthouse was built in the 1890s by the Spanish government to serve the south-eastern coast of the Island. Sitting atop a small peninsula, the views from the lighthouse are some of the Island's best. The lighthouse park is open from Wednesday to Sunday from 9 am to 4 pm.

name: Museo De Arte De Aguadilla
description: The Museo de Arte de Aguadilla y el Caribe, is an art museum located in the northwestern region of the island, specifically in the town of Aguadilla. The small but significant collection of Puerto Rican art includes works from Puerto Rican artists such as Hernández Cruz, Tufiño, Antonio Maldonado, Cervoni, Nevares, Brenes, Eliseo Echevarría, and Susana Herrera.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Catedral Nuestra Señora de la Candelaria
description: Originally constructed in 1763, the cathedral of Mayagüez has been restored twice, after the fire of 1854 and after the 1918 earthquake. The cathedral sits on the eastern end of the town's main square, Plaza Colón.

name: Museo de Historia de Caguas
description: Located in the former City Hall Building of Caguas, the Museo de Historia de Caguas consists of five exhibition halls presenting the historical evolution of the criollo identity. The exhibition walks attendees from the indigenous Taíno culture, through the socioeconomic transformations of the five centuries that followed the discovery by Christopher Columbus in 1493, up to the present time. The building that houses the museum, was constructed in 1887 and in 1989 it was declared a historical landmark.

name: Teatro Excelsior
description: The Excelsior Theater was built in 1871 and it was initially used for plays and later for screening of movies. In 2016, the theater was reopened and it now functions as a movie theater presenting Hollywood films. Adults pay $5, children $4, and seniors $2.50. The theater can also be rented out for private events.

name: Parroquia Inmaculada Concepción
description: Catholic Church. Patron saint of the town that is recognized as historical heritage.

name: Iglesia Nuestra Señora del Rosario Naguabo
description: This historic church can be found in the Naguabo's main square, and it's one of the town's oldest structures. Built between 1853 and 1856, the Nuestra Señora del Rosario church is a historic monument that's listed in Puerto Rico's register of historical landmarks.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Santuario Cruz de Colón (Puerta del Descubrimiento)
description: To commemorate and celebrate the 400th anniversary of Puerto Rico's discovery by Christopher Columbus, this monumental cross was installed in the area that is believed to be where Columbus landed in 1493. While the original cross was installed in 1893, the monument was destroyed in the 1918's earthquake, so it was rebuilt in 1928.

name: Casa Museo Luis Muñoz Rivera
description: The Casa Museo Luis Muñoz Rivera honors and preserves the legacy of the illustrious Puerto Rican poet, journalist, and politician Luis Muñoz Rivera. The museum is housed within the former family home of Muñoz Rivera in the urban center of Barranquitas.

name: Museo Casa Alonso
description: Museo Casa Alonso is Vega Baja's official art and history museum and it is housed within one of Puerto Rico's finest examples of 19th-century architecture. In the museum, you'll find pieces of art, historical documents related to the town's history, and personal objects belonging to some of Puerto Rican most famous poets.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Biblioteca Juvenil de Mayagüez
description: This library was founded in 1992 as the first independent, public, and bilingual community library specializing in serving the children and youth of Puerto Rico. In 2004, they were the first Puerto Rican library to receive the Institute of Museum and Library Services (IMLS) National Award for Excellence in Community Service. You can visit them on the 3rd floor of the Banco Popular Building on the Plaza Colón in Mayagüez.

name: Hacienda Mis Sueños
description: Hacienda Mis Sueños in Hatillo recreates the way of living in Puerto Rico in the late 19th century and early 20th century. The museum has over 2,000 historical artifacts related to Puerto Rico's not so distant past and a small farm. The hacienda is only open Saturday and Sundays, from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm.

name: Casa Museo José Celso Barbosa
description: Dating back to the 19th century, this former family house turned museum was the family home of Puerto Rican physician and political leader José Celso Barbosa. Today, visitors of the museum will find a recreation of what the house looked like while Celso Barbosa lived in it.

name: Teatro Liberty
description: The Liberty Theatre of Quebradillas was built in 1921, serving as the town's only movie theatre as well as a performing arts center. In 2012, the theatre was renovated and it is now used for special theatrical presentations.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Caribbean University Carolina
description: In 1969, Caribbean Junior College, the predecessor institution of Caribbean University, was founded in the city of Bayamón, Puerto Rico. Caribbean University is characterized as a private education institution, non-profit, co-educational, and non-sectarian. In December of 1991 it received authorization to offer graduated studies: Masters in Education with specialization in Administration and Educational Supervision, and another with specialization in Special Education.

name: Caribbean University Ponce
description: In 1969, Caribbean Junior College, the predecessor institution of Caribbean University, was founded in the city of Bayamón, Puerto Rico. Caribbean University is characterized as a private education institution, non-profit, co-educational, and non-sectarian. In December of 1991 it received authorization to offer graduated studies: Masters in Education with specialization in Administration and Educational Supervision, and another with specialization in Special Education.

name: Caribbean University Vega Baja
description: In 1969, Caribbean Junior College, the predecessor institution of Caribbean University, was founded in the city of Bayamón, Puerto Rico. Caribbean University is characterized as a private education institution, non-profit, co-educational, and non-sectarian. In December of 1991 it received authorization to offer graduated studies: Masters in Education with specialization in Administration and Educational Supervision, and another with specialization in Special Education.

name: Conservatorio de Música de Puerto Rico
description: The Puerto Rico Conservatory of Music (PRCM) is a public institution of higher learning that offers professional programs of excellence at undergraduate and graduate levels, as well as services, studies, and programs aimed at the community at large. As the musical university of Puerto Rico, the PRCM is dedicated to the development of musicians in the fields of music performance, composition, jazz, Caribbean music, and music education.

name: Parque Histórico Cueva María de la Cruz
description: In 1948, historical and archaeological evidence was found in this Loíza cave. The archaeological finds included rustic pottery, remains of archaic human bones that predate the time of Christ, animal remains, fruit seeds, and marine fossils.

name: Teatro Yagüez
description: The Teatro Yagüez was inaugurated in 1909 as a silent film venue. After a fire in 1919, the theatre was completely rebuilt in the baroque style, and in 1976 it received official recognition as a historical architectural landmark. Nowadays, the theatre hosts concerts, locally produced plays, ballet performances, and more.

name: Antigua Tabacalera
description: During the golden age of tobacco, this structure built in 1830 served as a workshop for the de-stemming of tobacco. Nowadays, this historic landmark is used as an events space for the community of Aibonito and it houses a small museum dedicated to the town's history.

name: Plaza Publica Nemesio Canales
description: This is the main town square of the town of Jayuya.

name: Teatro Oller
description: This architectural landmark was built in 1938 by the Oller family in Bayamón. The theatre can accommodate up to 662 people.

name: Paseo del Litoral "Shorty" Castro
description: This area is close to two miles long, and it was built in 2010 when Mayagüez hosted the 2010 Central American and Caribbean Games. The area’s main attractions include the flag square, an amphitheater, a skateboard park, and beach volleyball and football areas, among others.

name: Plaza Bicentenaria Monseñor Miguel A. Mendoza
description: This plaza was fully reconstructed in 2003, to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the founding of Barranquitas.

location.street_address: Plaza Bicentenaria Monseñor Miguel A. Mendoza

name: Plaza Colón - Mayagüez
description: Mayagüez's historic and beautiful main town square dates back to the 1840s. Filled with historic statues and monuments, and surrounded by historic buildings, sitting in this plaza is almost like stepping back in time.
type: U.S. National Register of Historic Places Listings

name: Paseo de los Presidentes
description: The Walkway of the Presidents sits in Constitution Avenue right across the Capitol of Puerto Rico. The walkway celebrates all the presidents who've visited Puerto Rico since the end of the Spanish-American war in 1898.The Puerto Rican government commissioned a set of US presidents statues that feature presidents Gerald R. Ford, John F. Kennedy, Dwight D. Eisenhower, Harry S. Truman, Franklin D.

name: Hacienda Lealtad
description: A visit to Hacienda Lealtad, an old coffee estate in Lares, will take you back to the 1800s when coffee was one of the main exports of Puerto Rico. The coffee served is grown in municipalities along the Central Mountain Range and is packed right on the property. It is a medium-dark roast with a smooth texture and full aroma. Pair your coffee with some of their homemade pastries or flans or enjoy a meal with a view at their bistro and restaurant. Make sure to book your tour of the hacienda in advance.

name: Cueva del Indio (Las Piedras)
description: The Taínos left evidence of their presence in the form of petroglyphs, which were carved on rocks in streams, ball courts, and caves. This historic ceremonial park has more than 200 petroglyphs, three "bateys" (ceremonial plazas), and hiking trails and camping areas. The park can only be visited with a prior appointment that has to be coordinated through the town's local tourism office.

name: Cara del Indio
description: Welcoming every visitor to the town of Isabela is the impressive rock sculpture of the Cacique (chief) Mabodamaca. When driving along the route #2, on your way to the west coast, pay close attention as this landmark can be easy to pass by.

name: Área Recreativa La Piedra Escrita
description: This recreational area in the town of Jayuya is one of the island's most impressive examples of indigenous petroglyphs. Visitors to the site will encounter a monumental stone replete with petroglyphs, serving as a window into the island's indigenous culture and history. This spot along the river is also a popular swimming spot, so don't forget your bathing suit.

name: Las Dos Ceibas
description: You'll find these two Ceiba trees in the middle of road PR-2, so you'll encounter them if you're driving from the north side of the island to the west or vice versa.

name: Bosque Estatal de Piñones
description: A wood trail, a diversity of trees and animals, and a breeze of fresh air is the perfect combination for a day in the outdoors and what you'll find at the Bosque Estatal de Piñones. In this state forest, you'll find the most extensive natural system of mangroves in all of Puerto Rico. Additionally, while enjoying the trail, you’ll also find reefs, seagrass meadows, salt flats, islets, and dunes. This natural wonderland is home to animals like crabs, sea turtles like the leatherbacks, and birds.

name: Calle Loíza
description: Calle Loíza is an emblematic area in the heart of Santurce. The neighborhood is a creative and musical space, rich in culture and history. It is no accident that many great artists like Ismael Rivera grew up in these streets! In recent years, Calle Loíza has become a trendy spot where new businesses are flourishing, making it a popular place for people to hang out. The area is filled with local restaurants, bars, and boutiques.

name: La Placita de Santurce
description: La Placita de Santurce is a must stop for anyone visiting Puerto Rico. The location was founded more than 100 years ago as a two-tiered market square. The market was a place where people could buy fruits, vegetables, meat, and much more. Nowadays, during the day it functions as a market place with some open restaurants. In the evening, beginning at 6:00 pm, the famous Placita de Santurce fully comes to life. You'll find recognized restaurants and local kiosks that sell fried foods like empanadillas, alcapurrias, and bacalaítos.

name: Teatro Tapia
description: Inaugurated in 1832, Old San Juan’s iconic Teatro Tapia is one of the oldest continuously operating theaters in the United States. Its neoclassical facade features a row of austere arches and solemn pilasters encasing balconets, all painted painted in white and Naples yellow; it certainly contrasts quite noticeably with the powder-blue structure of the Antiguo Casino just across the Plaza Colón. At the Teatro Tapia, you can ease yourself into one of its comfortable, red velour chairs and enjoy an intimate concert, a play or even a stand-up comedy show.

name: Club Náutico Boquerón
description: Club Nautico de Boqueron is located in Boquerón village, on the south-west coast of Puerto Rico. The local Boquerón Beach (Balneario de Boquerón) is rated as one of the best on the island and was awarded Blue Flag Beach status. The west region is home to some of the best beaches in Puerto Rico.

name: Altitude Trampoline Park
description: This is an enclosed park for all types of high-energy trampoline activities, such as dodgeball, basketball slam dunking or just regular jumping fun. This park is safe environment for children and has a trained staff, as well as food services and fun activities. This is a fun and exciting environment for your friends and family!

name: Parque Julia de Burgos
description: The Julio de Burgos Park is a recreational space in the metropolitan town of Carolina. In the park, you'll find a five-mile-long trail, exercise areas, and a small water park for kids called Aquasol.

name: Área Recreativa del Lago Cerrillos
description: The area is located right next to the lake and features gazebos and benches. The place is perfect for family activities and even for an exercise group. Fishing and water activities are also allowed.

name: Parque de Los Próceres
description: This beautiful park is located near Mayagüez's urban center and it goes around the Yagüez river.

name: Parque Del Tercer Milenio
description: Parque del Tercer Milenio is a large recreational space located shortly after the entrance to Old San Juan on the Luis Muñoz Rivera Avenue. On one side of the park, you'll find Escambrón beach and on the other, the Luis Muñoz Rivera Park, making this area an excellent outdoor recreational spot. The park has lanes for cyclists and pedestrians, a special area for shows and outdoor events, a marine park, a pedestrian bridge that connects the area with the Luis Muñoz Rivera Park, and ample parking for the convenience of its visitors.

name: Parque De Niños Activos
description: This park has a maximum capacity of 300 people and its attractions include exercise stations, playgrounds, water play areas, mini-golf, and go-karts.

name: Parque Pasivo Janet Gonzalez Sanchez
description: This passive park has lanes for walking, running, and biking. Additionally, the park also has multiple playgrounds for children of all ages.

name: Parque Pasivo Las Croabas
description: While this park offers the same attractions as any other neighborhood park, what sets it apart is that it is the departing point for kayaking tours of the Fajardo's bio bay. During the day, you'll also find multiple water taxis making the round-trip to the stunning keys that make up the Cordillera Keys Nature Reserve.

name: Luis Muñoz Marín Park
description: The recently renovated Luis Muñoz Marín Park is the perfect spot to spend a relaxing family day in the outdoors. The park has a small water park area, a dog park, gazebos for rent, biking and pedestrian lanes, playgrounds, and more.

name: Luis Muñoz Rivera Park
description: The Luis Muñoz Rivera Park is an urban park that's found in the entrance to Old San Juan, just steps away from Escambrón beach. The park grounds are filled with magnificent trees, wooden benches, playground areas, and various sculptures. While the park is an ideal location for outdoor recreation, it's beautiful grounds also make it a favorite spot for photography enthusiasts.

name: Parque Pasivo Rafael Fey Méndez Cabrero
description: This public park is located in the town of San Sebastián, which is centrally located between the island's west side and the central mountain range.

name: Parque Central de los Niños
description: This park in Bayamon was built and designed especially for children of all ages. The entrance to this park is free.

name: Plaza de Armas
description: One of Old San Juan's most emblematic plaza, Plaza de Armas, dates back to Spanish colonial times when it was designed as the city's main town square. To one side of the plaza, you'll find San Juan's official town hall building and on another the Puerto Rico Department of State. To better enjoy the Plaza de Armas, grab a coffee and a Puerto Rican pastry from any of the local spots and grab a sit in any of the public benches. A popular photo-op spot in the plaza is the bronze statue of famous Puerto Rican salsa composer Tito Curet Alonso.

name: Plaza de la Identidad Pepiniana
description: The Plaza de la Identidad Pepiniana in the town of San Sebastián celebrates the town's history and important figures.

name: Plaza del Quinto Centenario
description: In the northern point of Old San Juan sits a modern square or plaza that was built in 1992 as a commemoration of Columbus’ first voyage to the Americas over 500 years ago, giving it the name of Quincentennial Plaza. A 40 feet tall tower known as El Tótem Telúrico stands tall in the middle of the plaza and is meant to symbolize the origin of the New World. The plaza sits across from Old San Juan's most impressive sight, the Castillo San Felipe del Morro.

name: Plaza del Sol
description: Plaza del Sol shopping mall is located in the metro area, specifically in the town of Bayamón. At Plaza del Sol, you'll find stores from your favorite brands, restaurants, a movie theatre, and the island's only Dave & Busters.

name: Auto Cine Santana
description: You can find Puerto Rico's only drive-in theatre in the town of Arecibo. On nights when it's open, the drive-in screens two movies simultaneously. From Friday to Sunday, there are two showtime slots, one at 7:30 pm, and one at 9:30 pm. Don't worry about bringing snacks as there is an onsite concession stand selling all of your favorite movie snacks.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Plaza Escorial
description: The Caribbean Cinemas movie theater located in Plaza Escorial is conveniently surrounded by a variety of restaurants. This movie theater is the place to go if you're looking to enjoy a chill night of dinner and a movie.

name: Caribbean Cinemas - Metro
description: Cine Metro was built in 1939 in Santurce, a city known for being the capital's entertainment center. It is one of the traditional cinemas that survived the construction of more modern ones, such as theaters that can be found in shopping centers. This historic place, in addition to showing the latest films, offers a variety of food, good coffee and snacks and more at reasonable prices.

name: Teatro Hollywood
description: Just steps from Coamo's main town square, you'll find one of the town's main attractions— the Hollywood Theatre. Built in the early 20th century, after a major renovation, the theatre reopened its doors as a single screen theatre. Open seven days a week, the theatre showcases a mix of commercial, Latin-American, and European movies. Additionally, the Hollywood Theatre is also available for private events.

name: Teatro Municipal Jose A Monrouzeau
description: Hatillo's historic theatre first served as a silent movie house between 1915 and 1938, and later on, it became a storage space for the town's abundant tobacco production. Nowadays, the theatre has been refurbished and it's used for local theatre productions as well as special functions.

name: Bahía de Guánica
description: It's narrow geographic form make Guánica's bay one of the safest ports in Puerto Rico, providing excellent shelter for boats during hurricanes and bad weather. The bay is surrounded by a couple of historic landmarks, and amongst are the ruins of Fuerte Caprón which can be reached through Guánica's dry forest.

name: Bahía de la Ballena
description: Bahía de la Ballena is part of Guánica's dry forest. To reach this area of the forest, you'll have to take road PR-333 and then do a short hike. In this part of the forest, there are two beaches, Playa Tamarindo and Playa Ballena.

name: Bahía Icacos
description: The Icacos Bay in Vieques is known for its white-sand beaches and shallow waters. The bay area is located on the north coast of the island.

name: Bahía Salinas
description: Salinas Bay is located on the north side of the island of Vieques and it's adjacent to the Bahía Icacos. Both of these bays are located within the Vieques National Wildlife Refuge.

name: Culebra National Wildlife Refuge
description: In 1909, portions of the Culebra Archipielago were designated as a wildlife reserve in accordance with an Executive Order signed by President Theodore Roosevelt. Administration of the Culebra lands was the responsibility of the U.S. Navy and the wildlife reserve designation was subject to naval and lighthouse purposes. Several of the small islands of the archipelago, as well as the Flamenco Peninsula, were used for gunnery and bombing practice by the U.S. Navy and Marine Corps until their departure in 1976.

name: Gilligan's Island
description: You can reach Gilligan's Island by renting a kayak and paddling your way over. Once at the cay, you'll find shallow crystal water that's ideal for snorkeling.

name: Laguna del Condado
description: The perfect lagoon for beach athletes or anyone looking for a water adventure in San Juan. You can experience kayaking, paddle boarding, snorkeling, and more. Laguna Condado is well maintained, but do not be surprise if you spot a couple of manatees while you're visiting.

name: Mosquito Bioluminescent Bay
description: The brightest bioluminescence effect in the world can be found on the magical island of Vieques, but don't take our word for it— it was recognized by the Guinness World Record in 2006. Vieques's breathtaking Mosquito Bay has also been designated as one of the 2020s Seven Wonders of the World by Condé Nast Traveller.

name: Bahía de Jobos
description: The Jobos Bay National Research Reserve is the second largest estuary in Puerto Rico. It covers the towns of Guayama and Salinas and its grounds were acquired by the Department of Natural and Environmental Resources in 1981. The visitor center has an exhibition room with a photographic and interactive exhibit about the reserve, its ecosystems, its flora and fauna, geography and hydrology, history and the Central Azucarera de Aguirre, among others. It also includes a library for the benefit of students, researchers, and the general public.

name: Reserva Natural Canal de Luis Peña
description: Established in 1999, this nature reserve shelters species of recreational and commercial value. Coral reefs, sea grass beds, and mangroves protect and nourish the great biodiversity within this reserve. Given the beautiful landscapes and resources found here, the Luis Peña Canal Natural Reserve stands out as one of the most highly-visited natural reserves in Puerto Rico

name: Pozo de Jacinto
description: The Pozo de Jacinto is a striking open sea cave found in Jobos beach in Isabela. The cave is over 30 feet deep and on one side it faces the Atlantic Ocean while on the other it faces the picture-perfect Jobos beach, making the area an impressive sight.

name: Cayo Caracoles
description: Caracoles is a small cay on the town of Lajas, Puerto Rico and part of La Parguera Nature Reserve.

name: Balneario de Puerto Nuevo
description: A Blue Flag distinguished beach, Puerto Nuevo Beach is known for its magnificent beauty and rock formations. Its calm blue waters and golden-sand shores are ideal for families to spend the day basking in the sun. The rock outcroppings act as a wave break, but also offer magnificent views and photo opportunities.

name: Balneario Sun Bay
description: Sun Bay Beach is an idyllic beach located on the south side of Vieques. The beach is managed by the Puerto Rico Department of Natural Resources, so it has a few "extras" that make it one of the island's most family-friendly beaches. The beach facilities include bathrooms, showers, changing rooms, BBQ grills, food kiosks, and more. Additionally, the beach has lifeguards on-site as well as security personnel. Camping on sun bay is possible, but it's important to keep in mind that a permit should be arranged in advance. Campsites are $10 per site per night

name: Playa El Escambrón
description: Often cataloged as a Blue Flag beach, El Escambrón is the perfect spot for family and friends to gather for a day of fun in the sun. This popular beach is protected by coral reefs that make the beach ideal for snorkeling and exploring some of Puerto Rico’s marine life. If snorkeling doesn’t spark your interest, you can walk along the scenic waves. Dubbed a metropolitan beach, El Escambrón is lined by golden sand and tall palm trees that provide shade and is only five minutes away from restaurants and food stands, as well as the Luis Muñoz Rivera Park.

name: Playa El Combate
description: Combate beach is part of the Boquerón National State Forest in Cabo Rojo and is a popular choice amongst locals. Its sparkling waters and large-scale reefs turn pristine shores into a paradise for diving enthusiasts. Preferred by younger crowds, this site is the ideal to enjoy the best sunsets in Puerto Rico.

name: Crash Boat Beach
description: Crash Boat beach is one of the most popular beaches in Puerto Rico's west coast and Aguadilla's crowning gem. Its turquoise waters make this beginner diving spot ideal for snorkeling, swimming, and even surfing during the summer. Crash Boat’s vibrant scene has dubbed it the island’s party beach, where you can hear music, and hop around the kiosks and food stands that are lined up around the pier.

name: Jobos beach
description: Jobos beach is a favorite with locals and a must-visit spot on the town of Isabela. Whether you're a surfer, a fan of paddleboarding or you simply want to lay under the sun, this beach is for you. Near the beach area, you'll find various beach bars and restaurants, so you're always a short walk away from your next Piña Colada. Do exercise caution when swimming on this beach as it is known for its powerful rip currents.

name: La Poza del Obispo
description: This small beach is located right next to Arecibo's beautiful lighthouse. La Poza del Obispo is protected by rock formations, which form a shallow area that's perfect for swimming. When visiting this spot, please exercise caution as depending on the weather swimming conditions may vary.

name: Montones beach
description: Direct access and its shallowness make this natural pool the family-preferred beach in Isabela. The depthless tides provide a safe environment for kids and toddlers to play around while the adults relish in the calmness of the scenery. A natural wall prevents the strong surf from rushing in. The crowd you’ll find there is mostly local.

name: Navio Beach
description: The minute you set sigh upon Vieques's Navio beach, you'll immediately understand why it's one of the island's most famous beaches. Due to its playful waves, this beach area is especially popular with body surfers and those interested in learning how to surf. To reach Navio beach, you'll have to make your way through the main entrance for Sun Bay beach.

name: Secret Beach (Pata Prieta)
description: You'll find this beach inside of Vieques National Wildlife Refuge. You can easily spend a whole day beach-hopping through the stunning beaches inside of the wildlife refuge, so pack your provisions for the day and go on the hunt for your favorite spot.

name: Playa Ballena
description: This hidden gem is found at the end of Road 333 in Guánica. Due to its location inside Guánica's Dry Forest, this beach is a rarely visited spot with white sand and turquoise waters. Keep in mind that once you reach the end of Road 333, you'll need to do a 30-minute hike to reach Playa Ballena.

name: Balneario Javier Calderón "Cerro Gordo"
description: The Javier Calderón Balneario, better known as Cerro Gordo in Vega Alta, is a government-run beach administered by Puerto Rico's National Parks program. It is recognized, not only for its spectacular beach but also for its camping area, which has enough spaces for 95 tents. There are showers, bathrooms, food and drink kiosks, and multiple green areas. The camping spaces have to be reserved in advance through the National Park's program. The price for tent per night is $13.00 and prices for vehicles vary from motorbikes at $2.00, cars at $4.00 and buses at $5.00.

name: Playa Costa Azul
description: Costa Azul Beach is located to the east of another popular beach in Luquillo, Balneario Monseratte. Its long stretch of sand and picture-perfect palm trees, make this beach a great photo spot.

name: Playa Escondida - Fajardo
description: While its name means "hidden beach," we're sharing the secret to reaching this secluded beach. To reach Playa Escondida in Fajardo, you'll need to do a 25-minute hike from Seven Seas Beach through a mangrove forest. Once you reach the beach, remember that swimming in this spot is not encouraged as the area is notorious for its strong currents and rip tides.

name: Playa Espinar
description: Located in Barrio Espinar, Playa Espinar is one of the many beaches found in Aguada and one of its most beautiful ones. The ecosystem in this beach is rich and diverse, and it includes endangered species of mangroves.

name: Flamenco Beach
description: Ranked as one of the top beaches in the world, Flamenco is a postcard-perfect stretch of white sand and turquoise waters. This beach is practically wave-less, which makes it ideal for snorkeling, swimming, unwinding, playing in the sand, or simply beach-bumming. Flamenco has amenities such as, lifeguards, camping area, showers, changing rooms and bathrooms, parking area, and kiosks where you can find authentic Puerto Rican food.

name: Playa La Esperanza - Manatí
description: Located in the northern town of Manatí, La Esperanza beach is a peaceful and secluded beach that's perfect for those looking to disconnect. What distinguishes La Esperanza, from other beaches in this part of the island, it's that this beach is part of a nature reserve managed by the Conservation Trust of Puerto Rico, also known as Para La Naturaleza. To reach La Esperanza, you'll have to follow the main road that leads to Hacienda La Esperanza and then drive along a dirt road where you'll find various parking areas with individual trails to the beach.

name: Playa La Pared
description: La Pared Beach in Luquillo is a year-round popular surfing spot. This beach is conveniently located only a block away from Luquillo's main town square. Once you've enjoyed the beach and explored the town's center, it's time to head to the famous Luquillo Kiosks, where you'll find all sorts of Puerto Rican food.

name: Playa La Posita
description: Playa La Posita is probably one of the better-known beaches in Piñones because of its accessibility. It's right on PR-187, and one of its distinctive attributes is that a long breakwater hinders the intense Atlantic waves from crashing into "La Posita," which translates as the pool, or the puddle. Its waters are similar to those of a pool: calm and cool, perfect for bathing without having to struggle with the waves' intensity. Moreover, you can park in front of the beach, and, across the PR-187, you can grab a bite in some of Piñones' best beach shack, like El Guariquitén.

name: Playa Las Palmas - Manatí
description: Las Palmas beach is found in the northern town of Manatí, and it's located right next to the more popular Poza de las Mujeres. A long stretch of sand with open waters, this beach is an ideal photo spot, but swimming is not recommended as the waters are known for its rough tides.

name: Playa Los Tubos
description: This beautiful beach on Puerto Rico's north coast is a favorite spot for local surfing aficionados. Manati is full of stunning beaches, but the allure of Los Tubos is its easy accessibility and Instagram-worthy coastline.

name: Playa Manglillo
description: Playa Manglillo is found in sunny Guánica, a town on Puerto Rico's beautiful southern coast. This beach has two main areas, a shallow beach with a sandy shore and a series of trails through the area's mangroves, leading to more secluded spots.

name: Mar Chiquita
description: Mar Chiquita is one of the most popular natural pools in the north coast. The half-moon opening is created by two limestone outcroppings that allow the intense turquoise waters of the Atlantic Ocean to rush in. The place is ideal for swimming and soaking in the sun, but there isn’t much shade, but umbrellas and chair rentals are available. There are some food trucks and stands during the weekends where you can find authentic Puerto Rican fritters and refreshing drinks.

name: Black Sand Beach
description: This rare and mesmerizing beach is located on the south side of the small island of Vieques. Black Sand Beach is a short drive from the town of La Esperanza, and while Vieques has many beaches that are worth a visit, this one is a definitive can't miss. To reach this beach, park alongside the road and make a short hike through the dirt road that leads to the beach.

name: Punta Arenas
description: While all beaches in Vieques can feel a bit secluded and remote, Punta Arenas is considered one of the island's most remote beaches. Also known as Green Beach, this beach is part of the Vieques National Wildlife Refuge.

name: Playa Sardinera de Hatillo
description: You'll find Playa Sardinera on the Island's north coast, in the town of Hatillo. Playa Sardinera is not just beautiful, but also ideal for enjoying the Caribbean's warm waters as it's shaped like a cove.

name: La Playuela (Playa Sucia)
description: La Playuela is commonly known as Playa Sucia and it is one of the most popular beaches in Cabo Rojo. With breathtaking views and plenty of wilderness to explore, this beach is part of the town’s nature reserve. This beach doesn’t have a strip of hotels or oceanfront businesses, but the striking landscape makes it a special natural wonder. It is the ideal place for beach-bumming and achieving that perfect sun-kissed tan. Playuela is just steps away from Los Morrillos Lighthouse and has limited parking, so make sure to get there early.

name: Playa Vacía Talega
description: Playa Vacía Talega is a crescent-shaped beach in Piñones where the water is calm and the sunsets are spectacular. This beach is very popular among locals, so it tends to be crowded during the weekend or on holidays. Go to Loíza Aldea to learn more about Piñones, its people, and its culture.
