Moreover, this beach has a beautiful forest of seagrape that can lead you to more remote, secluded beaches and caves, and yes, it's one of our favorite secret spots.

name: Playita del Condado
description: Playita del Condado Beach is an oasis in the heart of Condado. This family-friendly beach is hidden just off the east corner of Ashford Ave and the Puente Dos Hermanos bridge.

name: Sandy Beach
description: Sandy beach is one of the most popular beaches and hangout spots in the town of Rincón. The stretch along Sandy beach is filled with vacation rentals, restaurants, and bars, so during the high season, you're guaranteed to find a crowd.

name: Shacks beach
description: Shacks Beach is located on Puerto Rico's west coast, in the town of Isabela. Diving and snorkeling aficionados will enjoy the area's diverse marine life.

name: Survival Beach
description: This stunning beach is the perfect setting for your vacation pictures. To reach Survival Beach, you'll need to park at Surfer's beach then follow the path that's at the end of the road. While the path is short, it can be a bit challenging at times. Keep in mind that this beach is not really for swimming or spending the day, it's more of a photo spot.

name: Tropical Beach
description: Tropical Beach is located near Naguabo's famous Malecón, a beachfront boardwalk full of restaurants serving fresh seafood.

name: Villa Pesquera beach
description: You'll find Villa Pesquera beach on the Island's west coast. The beach is one of the most visited spots in the beach town of Isabela. Villa Pesquera is located across from a local food kiosks area that's also known by the same name, so after you're done swimming cross the street to order a refreshing piña colada or a Puerto Rican fritter.

name: Balneario Punta Salinas
description: Managed by Puerto Rico's national park program, this beach has facilities that only certain beaches on the island have. Among the facilities that you'll find on this beach are showers, bathrooms, green areas for recreation, basketball courts, beach volleyball area, and lifeguards.

name: Cueva de las Golondrinas Beach
description: Cueva de las Golondrinas beach is located near the more famous Poza de las Mujeres beach in the town of Manatí. After a short hike through land that belongs to the Hacienda La Esperanza Nature Reserve, you'll find this picture-perfect beach cove.

name: Playa Pastillo
description: Playa Pastillo in Isabela is a stunning beach that's perfect for long walks, photos, and enjoying the sweeping views of the Atlantic Ocean. At this beach, you'll find Isabela's famed Cuevas de las Golondrinas, a cave that's only accessible during some weeks of the summer months.

name: Reserva Natural Cayos de la Cordillera
description: This group of small islands is found just off the coast of Fajardo. Managed by Puerto Rico's Department of Natural Resources, the islands are known for their pristine beaches and abundance of marine life. Some of the islands under the reserve include Cayo Icacos and Palominos. Most of the islands can be reached via boat, with many local tour operators offering day excursions.

name: Cayo Icacos
description: Icacos is an uninhabited little island just off the coast of Fajardo on the east coast of Puerto Rico. With crystal-clear waters that crash gently against a strip of diamond-dust sand, Cayo Icacos (or Icacos Island) is the biggest and most scenic cay of the many that make up the La Cordillera Nature Reserve. Icacos can only be reached by boat, so make sure you book a catamaran day trip or a water taxi in advance. Although the island doesn’t have palm trees lined up for shade, it is perfect for swimming and snorkeling… you’ll discover a bountiful array of marine life.

name: Isla Palominos
description: This stunning uninhabited island is located just off the coast of Fajardo. Its crystalline waters make Palomino a great snorkeling spot. To reach this island, please coordinate with a local boat tour operator.

name: Balneario Caña Gorda
description: Located in Guánica’s Dry Forest, this beach is best for snorkeling, swimming, and hiking. Often recognized as a Blue Flag beach, Caña Gorda is lined up with palm trees for shade and its intense-blue waters crash softly on the white-sand shore. You can find various food vendors, chair rentals, picnic tables, restrooms, changing facilities, and showers. Ideal for families with kids, this southwestern beach also has a basketball court, on-duty lifeguards, and free parking.

name: Playa Carlos Rosario
description: Carlos Rosario beach in Culebra, is a secluded beach that's known as a great snorkeling spot. To reach the beach, you'll have to do a short hike from Flamenco Beach's parking lot.

name: Playa Colorá
description: You'll find this secluded beach after a 25-minute hike from the more popular Seven Seas Beach. Located to the far left of Seven Seas, this beach is a great photo spot, but swimming in its waters is not recommended as there strong rip tides and waves.

name: Playa de Guayanés
description: Located in the municipality of Yabucoa, this beach has the following facilities: gazebos, boat ramp, camping area, and food kiosks.

name: Playa Fortuna
description: A beach located in Luquillo.

name: Playa Tamarindo
description: With views of the Cayo Luis Peña, Tamarindo beach is one of Culebra's most stunning beaches. Tamarindo is loved by locals for its calm waters and diverse marine life, which are ideal for snorkeling, kayaking, and paddleboarding. During some months of years, visitors might also be treated to special sightings of sea turtles.

name: Playa Último Trolley (Playa Ocean Park)
description: Último Trolley is one of the most popular entry points for Ocean Park Beach, which stretches along the coastline of Condado. The mid-sized waves make this beach a trilling spot for surfers and amateurs alike. This beach has crystal clear waters and immaculate sand for the whole family to enjoy.

name: Balneario Pico de Piedra (Balneario de Aguada)
description: Pico de Piedra is the town's main beach as it has amenities that other beaches in the area don't have. The facilities in the beach include a parking area, food kiosks, bathrooms, showers, and more.

name: Balneario El Ojo del Buey
description: This beach is named after a rock that's found in the beach's shore that resembles the head of an ox. While most people visit to snap a picture with the famous rock, there's also a small beach area where swimming is safe.

name: Muelle de la Caña
description: Accesible from La Esperanza in Vieques, this old pier dates back to when sugar was cultivated on the island. This is a great spot to take pictures, go snorkeling, or jump in the water.

name: Balneario La Monserrate (Balneario de Luquillo)
description: Balneario La Monserrate is located in the eastern region of Puerto Rico, specifically in the town of Luquillo. The beach is managed by the Puerto Rico Department of Natural Resources, which means that the beach has a few extra "perks" that set it apart from most beaches in Puerto Rico. The facilities include bathrooms, showers, green areas, picnic areas, among others.

name: Balneario Seven Seas
description: The water in this beach is calm and crystal clear, making it a perfect spot for swimming and snorkeling. The facilities have bathrooms, showers, and BBQ areas. You can camp at this site for $10 a night per person with a minimum of two nights. There is also an area for trailer houses available to rent for a fee of $25 to $50 per day.

name: Playa Aviones
description: If you love to catch some waves and surf until sunset time, Playa Aviones is the right place for you. This beautiful stretch of beach livens up once the surfers start coming out (often in hordes throughout the year). But, beware: this is not a beach for beginners. Although the waves may not look too menacing at 3 or 4 feet high, there is a stone slab that can be quite dangerous if you don't know what you're doing. BONUS: This beach is right across the street from Kiosko El Boricua, so you can grab a bite after riding some gnarly waves.

name: Pelícano Beach
description: If you want to visit one of Puerto Rico's most pristine beaches, then head over to Pelícano Beach at Caja de Muertos Island in Ponce. This fantastic place has been recognized for its cleanliness and environmental care; it's no wonder it was the first-ever Caribbean Beach in a Natural Reserve to be awarded the prestigious Blue Flag Award. The calm, crystalline waters and white, sandy shore of the Caribbean Sea will allow you to the ultimate beach day experience.

name: Tamarindo beach
description: While this beach is physically located in the town of Guayanilla, access to the beach is only possible through Guánica's Bosque Seco (Dry Forest), specifically road PR-333. Drive to the end of the road, where you'll find a parking area from which you can follow the path to the beach. Keep in mind that at certain times of the year, the parking might be closed so you might need to park off-road. The beach is part of a nature reserve, and numerous protected species call it home.

name: La Parguera Bioluminescent Bay
description: La Parguera is a bioluminescent bay found in the southern town of Lajas— a two-hour drive from San Juan. One of three bioluminescent bays found along Puerto Rico's coastline, the bay's glowing effect is made possible by micro-organisms called dinoflagellates, which emit a short burst of light when the water is agitated. Various tour companies offer nightly kayak or boat trips to explore the bay's waters. Contrary to the other two bio bays found in Puerto Rico, La Parguera is the only one where swimming in the vivid waters is allowed, so don't forget to pack your bathing suit.

name: Cueva del Viento
description: La Cueva del Viento is found in the Bosque Estatal de Guajataca. The Guajataca Forest is one of 14 public forests managed by the Puerto Rico Department of Natural Resources, and it comprises 2,357 acres of public land. The forest has various trails, one of which leads to La Cueva del Viento. Once at the entrance of the cave, you'll find a wooden staircase that allows visitors to adventure into the cave's interior. The forest has parking available on-site as well as bathrooms, gazebos, and camping and recreational areas.

name: Río Abajo State Forest
description: The Río Abajo State Forest is located in the municipalities of Utuado and Arecibo, along the Tanamá River and Dos Bocas Lake. This state forest also offers great mountains for hiking, caves to explore, and diverse bird watching (including the Puerto Rican parrot). The camping area provides space for 40 people, the cost is $4.00 per person and $2.00 for minors. However, you need a permit to camp here that needs to be arranged previous to the camp date with the Puerto Rico Department of Natural Resources. Forest guides are available for rent in the area.

name: Bosque Rocoso de Piedra
description: This formation of rocks is almost unique in the world since it is only found in Spain, China, and other Asian countries, but to a lesser extent. Here, the forest covers over 5,200 acres of land. To visit this rocky forest, you must coordinate with the Office of Culture, Art, and Tourism of the Municipality of Juana Díaz, by calling 787-213-5311.

name: Cayo Enrique
description: Cayo Enrique is one of the small keys that make up the natural reserve area known as La Parguera in Lajas. Located in the southwest area of Puerto Rico, La Parguera is known for its crystalline and calm waters, which are perfect for snorkeling and other watersports. To reach Cayo Enrique, you'll need to arrive at La Parguera's main town area and purchase a round-trip ticket on one of the boats dropping visitors off at the keys. It is also possible to rent a small boat or kayak and make the trip yourself.

name: Isla Cardona
description: Cardona Cay, also known as Sor Isolina Ferré island, is one of the seven islands that form part of the city of Ponce. The island is small and uninhabited, located south of Barrio Playa. Many people enjoy water activities, such as kayaking, along its shore. A lighthouse was built in 1889, which is now considered part of the National Register of Historic Places.

name: Playa Peñón Brusi
description: Peñón Brusi is named after a big boulder that's found in the beach's water. This beach is great for families and those looking to have a relaxing beach day.

name: Cañón Blanco
description: You'll find this hidden gem in Puerto Rico's central mountain region, specifically in the town of Utuado. Magical, beautiful, and majestic are just some of the words that can be used to describe Cañón Blanco. Reaching this spot requires a bit of hiking, but once you arrive you'll see it was worth it. Aside from a beautiful landscape, keep an eye out for the indigenous petroglyphs etched into some of the area's large rocks.

name: Reserva Natural Humedal Punta Tuna
description: This nature reserve is located near Maunabo's distinctive Faro Punta Tuna. Comprised of mostly wetlands, the Punta Tuna reserve covers 1.4 miles of coastline. In the reserve, you'll find a small visitor center and multiple trails. Guided tours can be arranged in advance.

name: Bosque Estatal de Susúa
description: Located in the outskirts of Puerto Rico's central mountain range, the Susúa State Forest extends through the towns of Yauco and Sabana Grande. The forest has a visitor center, limited camping areas, and facilities for visitors.

name: Culebrita
description: This beautiful uninhabited island is located off the coast of Culebra, another one of Puerto Rico's beautiful islands. To reach this island, visitors will need to charter a boat or visit with a local tour company. Just as Culebra, Culebrita is an island paradise with stunning beaches known for its crystal clear waters and powder-like sand.

name: Lago Carraízo
description: Carraízo es el nombre de un embalse o lago artificial en el pueblo de Trujillo Alto, Puerto Rico. El lago Carraízo ocupa territorio de los municipios de Trujillo Alto, Gurabo y Caguas y se forma en el curso del Río Grande de Loíza. La idea de construir la represa surgió a principios de los años cuarenta debido a la necesidad de suplir de agua potable y energía eléctrica a la creciente población de San Juan. La construcción del embalse fue terminada en 1954.

name: Las Piedras del Collado (Cerro Las Tetas)
description: Las Piedras del Collado is a mountain peak found in between the municipalities of Salinas and Cayey. Also known by locals as Las Tetas de Cayey, this designated nature reserve is nearly 2,800 feet above the sea level and home to a picturesque forest. An array of local tour companies offer rock climbing, hiking, and even camping tours to the site.

name: Ceiba De La Libertad
description: The only living monument in Puerto Rico, planted in 1897 to celebrate the establishment of the Autonomous Charter, whose president was Francisco Mariano Quiñones, from San Germán. La Ceiba de la Libertad as it is known, is the only historical monument in Puerto Rico that identifies this event.

name: Charco Las Pailas
description: This swimming area is part of Comerío's río Hondo and it's located only 10 minutes away from the town center. The area has a series of natural water slides that are quite popular with locals.

name: Cascada Las Garzas
description: Also known as El Ataud, these waterfalls are one of the island's most famous landscapes. The falls are located high up in the mountains of Adjuntas, and can be reached after a short hike.

name: Charco Los Morones
description: You'll find Charco Los Morones in one of Puerto Rico's largest municipalities— Utuado. Once in the river area, you'll find enchanting natural pools, luscious greenery, and the peaceful state of mind that comes from being surrounded by the island's mountains.

name: Finca El Girasol
description: Come and visit our spectacular and beautiful space where you can take photos and bring a beautiful detail such as sunflowers for you and your loved one.

name: Río Tanamá
description: Río Tanamá extends through three towns, and it's known as the ultimate outdoor adventure destination. Various local tour operators offer tours through the river that include cave tubing, swimming, hiking, and more.

name: Charco Frío - Rio Tinajas
description: Las Tinajas is a series of natural pools that have been formed by the Fajardo River, which originates in El Yunque Rainforest.

name: Cascada Chorro de Doña Juana
description: Located in the municipality of Orocovis, the Chorro de Doña Juana is a mesmerizing waterfall that's composed by a series of three smaller chutes. Due to its convenient location along the main road, Doña Juana is very popular with locals. While you'll find that most people stop by to simply capture that picture-perfect shot, it is possible to swim in the natural pool that forms at the bottom.

name: Mirador de Guajataca
description: The Mirador de Guajataca offers some of the best ocean views found in Puerto Rico's north coast, if not on the entire island. If you're driving from San Juan to the west coast, you're bound to come across the spectacular views of Quebradillas. Make a pit stop at the lookout point to enjoy the view and take Instagram worthy pictures. On some days, you'll find a handful of local vendors at the spot selling fresh coconuts, Puerto Rican fritters, and even souvenirs.

name: Salto Curet
description: Salto Curet is an off-the-beaten-path waterfall in the town of Maricao. To reach the waterfall area, you'll have to do an upstream hike.

name: Cascada Las Delicias
description: To reach these enchanting waterfalls, you'll have to drive through the windy roads of the town of Ciales and make your way up to the even-higher town of Jayuya. The falls are within the grounds of the Tres Picachos State Forest, and they're easily reached after a short hike.

name: Bahía Urbana
description: The Bahía Urbana Amphitheater is a huge recreational space and concert hall located in the San Juan cruise ship ports. With multiple recreational spaces, Bahía Urbana is the perfect place to take a stroll and enjoy Puerto Rico’s “always sunny” weather. Wear your most comfortable outfit, sit in one of the benches and enjoy the view. People watch, enjoy the arrival of the cruise ships and if you're in the mood, take a water taxi across the bay! Some of the events you can find in Bahia Urbana are live concerts, movie screenings, festivals, cultural events, and more!

name: Domes Beach
description: Domes Beach is widely known as one of Rincón's best-surfing spots. Various surfing competitions, including the Corona Pro Surf, take place at Domes Beach. The beach is located right next to the Punta Higüero Lighthouse, which was built in 1892.

name: El Malecón de Naguabo
description: Located in the eastern town of Naguabo, this "malecón" is synonymous with paradise for the lovers of fresh seafood and beautiful views. El Malecón de Naguabo is one of the island's most visited waterfront promenades, and it's widely recognized for having over 30 restaurants and kiosks that visitors can choose from. During the weekends, local families flock to the "malecón" in search of the "catch of the day." A can't miss specialty of Naguabo are their famous "pastelillos de chapín," which are delicious Puerto Rican fritters filled with coffer fish.

name: Playa Tortuga
description: Located on the small island of Culebrita, Tortuga Beach is a piece of paradise that has white powder-like sand and crystal clear waters. The beach's name comes from the large number of turtles that visit the shores every year! Like any other beach in Culebra (except Flamenco), Tortuga doesn't have any amenities such as bathrooms, parking (this beach is accessible by boat only), or food kiosks.

name: Playa Melones
description: Melones beach is located on the west side of Culebra overlooking the Luis Peña Natural Reserve. Known for its calm and clear waters, this beach is never crowded making it the perfect place to relax and disconnect. Melones is an excellent beach for snorkeling and it is also home to many turtles due to the amount of seagrass that grows there.

name: Bridges Surf Spot
description: This surf-friendly beach in Aguadilla caters to all surfing levels, from beginners to pro surfers. Swimming on this beach is not recommended as it has a rocky shoreline.

name: Gas Chamber Surf Spot
description: You'll find this surf spot by making your way over to Crash Boat Beach in Aguadilla and then walking to the right of the pier.

name: Hole in the Wall Surf Spot
description: Hole in the Wall is found within Aguadilla's Bay. This is one of three breaks found in the bay, with the other two being Bridges and Schoolyards.

name: Little Fiji Surf Spot
description: This surf spot is found at Escambrón Beach has an exposes reef break with reliable surf.

name: Little Malibu Surf Spot
description: This surfing spot is perfect for beginners, bodyboarders, and swimming. The spot is located right next to the marina.

name: Maria's Beach Surf Spot
description: On the road that leads to Rincón's lighthouse, you'll find one of the town's most popular surfing spots, Maria's beach.

name: Pistons Beach Surf Spot
description: This surf spot is part of Maria's Beach. Surfing in this area is not recommended unless you're an experienced surfer.

name: River Mouth Beach
description: Located in Barrio Puntas in Rincón this beach east of Antonio's Beach.

name: School Yards Surf Spot
description: This surf spot is located down the same road as Bridges— another popular surfing spot.

name: Spanish Wall Surf Spot
description: This surfing spot in Rincón is popular with bodyboarders and has one of the best surf breaks in town. To reach this spot, you'll need to do a short hike from Domes Beach.

name: Playa Zoni
description: Located on the Northeastern coast of Culebra, Zoní Beach is one of the most amazing beach experiences you can have when visiting Culebra. Zoní is just as beautiful as its famous sister, Flamenco Beach, and it's also known for its white sand and clear waters. Unlike Flamenco, but much like all other beaches around the island, Zoní doesn't have amenities, such as bathrooms, parking, kiosks, etc., which means that it's not as popular and crowded as Flamenco.

name: Bosque Estatal Monte Choca
description: The State Forest of Monte Choca is comprised of 244 Spanish acres. Visits to the forest need to be coordinated in advance by calling (787)-859-2046.

name: Julio Enrique Monagas National Park
description: This national park is located in the town of Bayamón. Visitors to the park can enjoy the designated park trails, playgrounds, and a viewpoint that overlooks the metropolitan area.

name: Lago Dos Bocas
description: The Dos Bocas lake is located between the towns of Utuado and Arecibo. The lake area is surrounded by gorgeous scenery, and various boat operators offer rides around the lake and to and from several of the restaurants that are located in the lake's shores.

name: Mirador Orocovis
description: A superb lookout point where you can see some of the islands southern towns. This location has a children’s playground and picnic area.

name: Mirador La Plata
description: This viewpoint in Aibonito is located right on road PR-14 and it overlooks La Plata Valley.

name: Museo de la Historia Ramón Rivera "Bonyé"
description: Inaugurated in 2009, this museum is devoted to conserving the history of the town of Peñuelas. The museum preserves historical objects, artifacts, and documents dating to pre-Colombian and colonial times. Additionally, the museum also has pieces of art and temporary art exhibitions.

name: Museo de Arqueología, Historia y Epigrafía de Guayanilla
description: The museum's permanent exhibition is exclusively dedicated to indigenous archaeology. The Museo de Arqueología, Historia y Epigrafía de Guayanilla is also home to the Library of Agüeybaná— one of the most important leaders of the Taíno indigenous people at the time of the arrival of the Spanish colonizers.

name: Museo El Cemí
description: High in the mountains of Jayuya, you'll find el Museo el Cemí, which houses an impressive collection of Taíno artifacts. The museum structure was built as a replica of a Cemí— one of the Taíno people deities or gods.

name: Museo y Centro de Estudios Humanísticos Dra. Josefina Camacho de la Nuez
description: The Ana G. Méndez University established this museum in honor of one of their most beloved professors— Dr. Josefina Camacho de la Nuez. The museum's principal exhibits are dedicated to Puerto Rican and Caribbean art, ranging from pottery to artisan objects. One of the museum's exhibition rooms also houses a collection of unique archaeological finds from pre-Columbian times.

name: Teatro Ambassador
description: Located in the Santurce neighborhood of San Juan, this intimate theater has a varied calendar of events that includes theatrical experiences, comedy nights, and more. Teatro Ambassador is also available for private functions, events, and parties.

name: Casa Museo de Los Santos Reyes
description: The Museo de los Santos Reyes was inaugurated in 2004, and it was the first museum exclusively dedicated to the history of the Three Kings (Epiphany) tradition throughout Latin America. The museum is located in the town of Juana Díaz, which has been essential to the safeguarding of this holiday tradition in Puerto Rico.

name: EcoExploratorio - Museo de Ciencias de Puerto Rico
description: Take the family to play and learn at EcoExploratorio: Science Museum of Puerto Rico, with terrific science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) experiences. Come and watch tropical sea species, learn about the Artemis space mission and Caribbean mosquito diseases, experience a bioluminescent bay, travel virtually to space, become a weather reporter, and explore future STEM careers. Make connections between school, community, work, and the future through applied activities and hands-on learning for all family members.

name: Fundación Nacional Para la Cultura Popular
description: The Fundación Nacional para la Cultura Popular has been a hub for the scenic arts for the last twenty years. Since its foundation in 1996, the FNCP has staged numerous workshops, lectures, concerts, plays, and has been a haven for documents and memorabilia related to the arts in Puerto Rico. Moreover, the foundation prepared one of its rooms to serve as a library for researchers and students interested in the arts.

name: Casa Museo Felisa Rincón de Gautier
description: This historic landmark used to be the house of the first female mayor of San Juan. Doña Fela, as she was known to her constituents was the mayor of Puerto Rico's capital from 1946 to 1968. Her former Old San Juan residence has been turned into a house museum where you can find her original furniture, major awards she won during her lifetime, her photograph collection, and a unique collection of over 70 hand fans.

name: Museo Antigua Aduana
description: This historic building served as a center for managing and ordering the process of product exchange, sale, resale, import, export and negotiation that took place in Arroyo's port during the 19th century. In 1993, it became a museum and a center for the development of cultural activities. It has a room for recitals, concerts, exhibitions, book presentations, among other folkloric, artistic, and cultural activities.

name: Museo de la Hamaca
description: The hammock was invented by the pre-Columbian inhabitants of Puerto Rico and the Caribbean— the Taíno indigenous people. In the town of San Sebastián, you'll find el Museo de la Hamaca (Hammock Museum), which traces the history and evolution of the hammock.

name: La Casa de los Contrafuertes
description: La Casa de los Contrafuertes is an independent cultural center open to the public, that started in the year 2012 as an art work which is committed to seek, expose and encourage overlaps among the works of artists of all disciplines focusing on the Caribbean and its diasporas.

name: Museo del Tabaco Herminio Torres Grillo
description: Puerto Rico's only tobacco museum is located in the town of Caguas, in an old colonial neoclassical building that used to be a blacksmith shop. The Tobacco Museum traces the history of what used to be one of the most important cash crops of Puerto Rico and the wider Caribbean region. The tobacco that was cultivated on Caguas's land used to be of such outstanding quality that Cuba once imported it to be mixed in with their world-famous cigars.

name: Museo Olímpico de Puerto Rico
description: The Puerto Rico Olympic Museum is dedicated to the collection, conservation, documentation, and promotion of the history of Puerto Rican sports and athletes through permanent and temporary exhibitions.

name: Museo del Mar
description: El Museo del Mar is a fascinating little museum dedicated to nautical life. You’ll find numerous ship models including, Christopher Columbus’ caravels and the cruise ship Carnival Victory. You'll also find an informative mock-up of the Battle of San Juan (1797), in which the Puerto Rican forces were able to defeat the English in a bitter battle for the capital; and, of course, the largest collection of lifesavers in the world, according to the Guinness Records.

name: Museo del Mundillo
description: Mundillo is an artisanal form of handmade bobbin lace that's specifically important to the history of one particular town in Puerto Rico— Moca. This museum honors and continues the town's legacy, through the conservation of one-of-a-kind mundillo pieces as well as through offering mundillo workshops to groups of all ages.

name: Pablo Casals Museum
description: This location is dedicated to the cellist, Pablo Casals, who lived the last 17 years of his life in this city, where he finished his masterpiece, El Pessebre. Music lovers can browse the library and the musician's tape, as well as their piano, cello, and personal items.

name: Museo del Deporte de Puerto Rico
description: This sports museum, which is only a short drive away from the San Juan area, houses one of the most comprehensive collections of sports memorabilia covering athletes from Puerto Rico as well as the Caribbean. The museum is considered one of the world's five best sports museums. One of the museum's main attractions is the life-size statues of renowned athletes, which include Puerto Rican legend, Roberto Clemente.

name: Centro de Bellas Artes Adolfo Porrata Doria
description: The Centro de Bellas Artes de Guayama is housed in a beautiful and impressive structure that was built in 1927 and the grounds are surrounded by enchanting colonial gardens. The center has 11 exposition rooms, one conference room with space for 137 people, and a ballroom for cultural activities that can accommodate up to 180 people.

name: Centro de Educación Ecológico
description: The goal of this museum is to educate visitors in a fun and entertaining way about the evolution of life on planet Earth, endangered species, and the ecosystems of Puerto Rico. The museum is located within the grounds of the University of Puerto Rico's campus in the town of Cayey.

name: Museo del Café de Puerto Rico
description: The Museum: When visiting the town of Ciales, let the rich aroma of coffee drag you to Paseo Aroma de Café. Visit Puerto Rico Coffee Museum and learn about the local and regional history of this product as an expression of the general history of the island and the historical development of coffee in the economy of Puerto Rico, which reaffirms our national, cultural and collective character within the historical processes related to Puerto Rican coffee.

name: La Casa Estrecha
description: La Casa Estrecha roughly translates to “The Narrow House.” Indeed, this yellow two-story house is as narrow as it gets! From wall to wall, this house measures approximately 5 feet and since it is wedged between two standard-size buildings, the contrast is quite stark. Nevertheless, before la Casa Estrecha was transformed into a house, it was an alley that led into the central courtyard of the surrounding buildings. Eventually, the alley became obsolete, and it was given a ceiling and a façade so that it could be used as a house.

name: Museo Casa Portela
description: Inaugurated in 2010, the Casa Portela Museum has three permanent exhibitions, one dedicated to the history of the town, a military room, and a Hall of Fame for the town's star athletes. Additionally, the museum also presents itinerant expositions.

name: Museo de Historia y Cultura Alberto Ávila López
description: Administrated by the not-for-profit organization El Círculo Histórico-Cultural de Camuy, Inc., this history museum is full of artifacts and documents that present the history of the town of Camuy. Entrance to the museum is free, and visiting hours are Monday to Friday from 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM. (The museum hours are subject to change.

name: Museo Eugenio María de Hostos
description: Eugenio María de Hostos is one of Puerto Rico's most prominent historical figures and this museum is dedicated to honoring his memory and legacy. The museum is located within the same estate where Hostos was born and raised.

name: Galería de los Gigantes
description: La Galería de los Gigantes is dedicated to showcasing the history and legacy of eight of Carolina's most emblematic figures. The gallery has memorabilia and animatronic exhibitions that walk visitors through the life of these important figures. Felipe Birriel will welcome you, Julia de Burgos will recite you her famous poem Río Grande de Loíza, you'll walk into the office of Puerto Rico's first Puerto Rican governor Jesús T. Piñero, and more.

name: Museo Historia Casa Doña Bisa
description: The Casa de Doña Bisa Museum is located in the town of San Sebastían. The museum is housed within a historic property that's been preserved and restored to depict the way of living of the early 20th century. Visitors to the museum, are also encouraged to stop by the nearby Museo de la Hamaca (Hammock Museum).

name: Museo Histórico de Culebra "El Polvorín"
description: In Culebra's Historical Museum "El Polvorín," visitors will learn about the island's unique history, from the indigenous Taíno inhabitants to the more recent military occupation by the U.S. Navy. The small museum houses archeological artifacts, historical photographs, and many other historical items related to the history of this Spanish Virgin Island. The entrance to the museum is free of charge, but visitors are encouraged to leave a donation.

name: Museo Orocoveño Celestino Avilés Melendez
description: Found in the mountainous town of Orocovis, this museum is dedicated to preserving and promoting the Puerto Rican art tradition of carved wooden saints. Once a year, the museum also holds Puerto Rico's most important "santeros" gathering, which brings together the island's top artisans.

name: Museo de la Música Puertorriqueña
description: The Museo de la Música Puertorriqueña documents Puerto Rico's rich musical traditions and recognizes the island's talented musicians. The museum is located in Ponce's historical town center in what used to be the family home of the Serallés family— the owners of DonQ Rum. Open Wednesday to Sunday from 8:30 am to 3:30 pm.

name: Centro Educativo Amigos de las Tortugas Marinas
description: The Amigos de las Tortugas Marinas is a non-profit organization dedicated to the protection of leatherback turtles, as well as the education of the wider public on the importance of protecting our natural environment. ATMAR as the organization is also called, is based out of the town of Maunabo. Their headquarters, Centro Tortuguero, also function as a small educational museum.

name: Museo del Niño de Carolina
description: Puerto Rico's only dedicated children's museum has over 100 hands-on interactive exhibitions ranging from music and art to transportation and physics. In the museum's outdoor grounds, visitors will find a go-kart track, a plane donated by American Airlines, a mini zoo, and a small ferry making "Jungle Trips" through the Blasina Lake.

name: El Boricua
description: The iconic El Boricua in Río Piedra is an interesting place in a corner of the collegial town. This cultural space is one of predilect space for the students of the area. El Boricua is the house to intense conversations between students from every corner of the island, and even from different parts of the world. In here, you’ll be able to enjoy a cold beer, listen to some live music, play some billiard and dance the night away, with some salsa.

name: La Respuesta
description: La Respuesta is a club and pub that's devoted to creating space where art meets music and entertainment. It has a lively venue encouraging creativity and is also a perfect spot for those looking to enjoy hip-hop/R&B music.

name: Aguardiente Bar
description: Aguardiente is one of the most popular spots at La Placita. Expect to dance all night long and to enjoy their signature sangria. Aguardiente Bar is the place to hang out all night when visiting San Juan. Located in the most popular area; La Placita. Great atmosphere, DJ's mixing the hottest hits, Bottle service and Hookah available. Reservation avaliable. Limited capacity. Reserve on OpenTable.com

name: La Factoría
description: The very moment you enter our doors you can feel that La Factoría is not your ordinary bar. Our unmarked location is full of secret passages that lead to our six bars, each curated with a different ambiance and drink menu. Whether you seek to enjoy craft cocktails, dance the night away to live music, or simply relax in good company, we got you.

name: Marullo Bar & Tapas
description: With a tropical environment, this bar is a great place to enjoy yourself with family and friends. They make unique drinks like their Champagne Mojitos.

name: Mijani Club
description: Visit Mijani for a fun and upbeat night at La Placita. They often have live salsa bands and other local favorites so it is the perfect place to practice your Latin dance skills.

name: Tabaco y Ron
description: A good place to spend some time with friends and have some drinks for your enjoyment.

name: Candela's Shot Bar
description: Serving a variety of sophisticated drinks, they give their cocktails a personal touch with mixes including fruits and chocolate.

name: Eternal Lobby Lounge
description: Eternal Lobby Lounge is the perfect spot for young professionals looking for an elegant place to hang out. The lounge combines the feel of a New York lounge and a South Beach hotel. Visit and enjoy a relaxing evening and make sure you stay updated with the venue's attractions such as salsa nights, and artistic performances.

name: Funky Buddha
description: Funky Buddha is not just a place, it's an experience. The lounges are equipped with comfortable couches and soft pillows where you can relax and enjoy flavored narguile. The artsy walls and trendy music, make it the prefect place to end the night with your friends.

name: Chico Cabaret
description: Experience a unique and intimate setting with all of our live performers as part of the first Residency Program in Puerto Rico. Newly renovated VIP space with bottle service, a mixology bar, and delicious tapas menu. Perfect for a date night or night out with friends. Live Music & Entertainment every Friday & Saturday.

name: Paseo Tablado de Guaynabo
description: This urban boardwalk in Guaynabo is lined with small food stands that sell everything from Puerto Rican fritters to tacos, and drinks! During the weekends, the boardwalk is a popular night hangout spot.

name: Piñones
description: A picturesque ocean drive from Carolina to Loíza where you can enjoy local dining experiences and practice what Puerto Ricans call chinchorreo. Sample delicious specialties while you hop from food stand to food stand and go back and forth to the beach. Enjoy the peaceful waves at La Pocita or Vacía Talega, two secluded beaches where you can go swimming or soak in the sun.

name: Atlantic Surf & Bodyboarding School
description: Enjoy the north coast of Puerto Rico with the best-certified surf instructors and a safe surfing. Private group lessons are offered on weekdays and Saturdays. You can surf and body board in crystal clear water. Body boarding includes equipment and photos. They have 20 years of experience and are located in Caza y Pesca beach, Arecibo. The surf school is endorsed by Puerto Rico Tourism.

name: Surf Lessons Puerto Rico - Adventure Company
description: The Coastline offers several safe and fun locations for introductory surfing lessons. Surf Lessons Puerto Rico & Adventure Co.'s surfing trips are a great foundation to this exciting sport. Focusing on the Fundamental Reading of Saltwater, Surf Safety, Etiquette, Paddling, Catching Waves and Ocean Awareness are all part of the lesson. Their knowledgeable instructors have over 21 years of combined experience and will use their skills to teach the finer points of catching waves and turning techniques, during our beach lesson, and while in the water.

name: Caribbean Surf School
description: Puerto Rico Surfing lessons, rentals & instruction, ocean and beach safety. Weather and water conditions, water/beach etiquette, plus lots more...

name: Rincón Surf School
description: Surfing Lessons

name: Pedalea Isabela
description: Located in beautiful Isabela Puerto Rico, Pedalea is the best place in the area for your cycling and water sports fun. We are proud to offer the following services: bicycle rental, water sports like kayaking, snorkeling, boat sailing, and paddleboarding (depending on the weather and the season). They also offer food and drinks.

name: PR Dive
description: PR Dive is a complete service scuba shop. They focus on small groups, ensuring you have the best dive experience possible! They are your solution for diving!

name: Zipline of the Aerostatic Balloon Puerto Rico
description: The Jayuya Ziplines are the highest in the Caribbean with a height of 3,200 feet above sea level. The adventure includes three runs through three different ziplines. This one that appears in the video is the second jump that is the longest of the three and is called “Puerta al Cielo”. The ziplines have an extremely impressive 360 panoramic view. The length of the shots are between 2,165 and 1,443 feet. In addition, the facilities include a restaurant, a "gift shop", the "Hijos del Cafetal" Coffee Museum, a tour of the agricultural farm and a cafeteria.

name: VIP Adventures Puerto Rico
description: VIP Adventure has more than 20 years of experience in the field of touristic activities around the island and event planning for top companies in Puerto Rico. Our company concept is based on three important aspects: outstanding experience: unique activities, human and nature relations, and the best-personalized service to create your best tour experience in Puerto Rico.

name: Oceania Boat Tours and Watersports
description: Cruise through the heart of Carolina, and Loiza on our small group boat tours, immersing yourself in the rich Afro-Caribbean heritage in an intimate setting. Discover why our boat rides, featuring both sunset and sunrise options, stand out for early birds and sunset seekers alike. Your Exclusive Boat Excursion: Hop aboard for a boat ride that transcends the ordinary—it's a journey into Puerto Rico's cultural beats. Our small group tours make it personal, bringing the stories of Afro-Caribbean heritage to life with every wave.

name: K1 Speed
description: This location is Puerto Rico’s first K1 Speed in the Caribbean and is the first all-electric indoor go-karting center in the country’s history. The 40,000-sq. ft. facility is located within the chic and popular Outlet at Route 66 in the municipality of Canóvanas and will feature the best karting to be found on the island, in addition to bowling, bumper cars, and the latest racing simulators. This center will be the perfect location to host birthday parties, corporate events or company functions by offering a sophisticated karting experience you can’t get with anyone but K1 Speed.

name: Costa Caribe Golf & Country Club
description: Our 27-hole links-style championship golf course features several oceanfront holes offering breathtaking Caribbean views, 14 beautiful lakes, Puerto Rico’s first island green, and manicured course conditions year round. Play around at the championship golf course around and over 14 man-made lakes. Its ideal setting provides breathtaking views of the Caribbean and the Central Mountains. Open to members and the public.

name: Palmas Athletic Club at Palmas del Mar
description: Whether it be golf at one our two championship golf courses, tennis at the largest facility in the Caribbean, or fun at our member exclusive beach club facility Palmas has it all. Palmas Athletic Club is the ultimate family fun, sports and social environment in the Caribbean. We offer an experience like no other, with a full range of activities and services for the family to enjoy.

name: Punta Borinquen Golf Club
description: It is one of the oldest golf clubs in Puerto Rico. It islocated in Porta del Sol, northwest of the Island, in the grounds of the oldairbase of Ramey, in Aguadilla. It was created in 1940, and is characterized by being afield, very open, without lakes, but with lots of bunkers. Whipped by drafts,it presents its greatest difficulty in the 17th hole. It has an extension of5,000 meters. During the week you can play without problem at any time of day;On weekends, it is preferable to do so after 12 noon.

name: Río Bayamón Golf Course
description: The only golf course in Puerto Rico's metro area, the Río Bayamón Golf Course provides a peaceful and relaxed atmosphere and all the amenities. The golf course is an 18-hole complex that includes a clubhouse, putting green, chipping green, and driving range, as well as the convenience of a pro-shop and a restaurant. Driving Range has 58 stations in 2 tiers, 300 yards for your shots, and 75-foot high nets on both sides of the practice area.

name: WOW Surfing School & Jet Ski
description: Want to learn how to surf? WOW Surfing School is the right place to do it. A few steps away from the Isla Verde Ritz-Carlton Hotel (right on Pine Grove beach) you'll find one of San Juan's renowned surfing schools. Here you can partake in group classes or get an appointment for a private class. If you already know how to surf, you can rent one of their surfboards or Stand Up Paddleboards and have fun in the water.

name: Watersports 4u
description: Come and enjoy the most complete watersports center in the Caribbean. Reach new heights with a Parasail ride, have a fun day on the Banana Boat or test your skills on the Flyboard. That paired with a smooth Boat Ride excursion or a Tour inside the island, we offer pretty much everything you need to have fun in Puerto Rico!

name: Villa Campestre
description: Among the attractions of Villa Campestre are their educational farm, pool, toddler zone, and their small amusement rides. Villa Campestre is ideal for both kids and adolescents alike.

name: Parque Julio Enrique Monagas de Ponce
description: Parque Julio Enrique Monagas is perfect for any family outing. Built in 1994, this passive park is located between Ponce's Portugués and Bucaná rivers. It is the largest passive park in the island with many kiosks, volleyball courts, playgrounds, picnic areas, a skate park, a mini railway, and a lake with exotic birds and paddle boats. Many people come to spend the day with family, train, or hang out with friends. Business Hours: Open Tuesday through Sunday and Mondays that are holidays from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm

name: Parque Lineal de Loíza
description: The Parque Lineal de Loíza, which runs from Isla Verde to Piñones, offers visitors an extraordinary way to experience Loíza's beaches and the Piñones State Forest. At the beginning of this linear park, you'll find a beautiful beachfront plaza where you can admire San Juan's skyline from the distance. The park's main attraction is the 11km-long boardwalk that crosses through Loíza's State Forest. You can walk the boardwalk or speed things up by renting a bike or bringing your own.

name: Parque Nacional Isla de Cabras
description: This land-connected small island has some of the best views of the Bay of San Juan and the Old San Juan area. In the island, you'll find recreational facilities and on-site parking. The park is a great spot for walking and fishing.

name: Paddle Paradise PR & Outdoor Center
description: Paddle Paradise is located on one of the shores of the Carraízo Lake. Apart from camping, they also offer kayaking, paddle boarding, ziplining, fishing, among other things.

name: Arroyo Surfing Park
description: We are a family water park with a children's slide station, an adult pool with a tiki bar, and gazebo rentals. Also, for lovers of surfing, skateboarding and snowboarding we have the only largest surfing simulator in the Caribbean, the WaveOz Flowrider.

name: Playuela - Aguadilla
description: Located in Aguadilla, Playuela covers more than 4,000 feet of coastline, and it has five distinct ecosystems. The area is rich in flora and fauna, and several protected species call it home. Surfers are known to love the area as it has some of Puerto Rico's and the Caribbean's best surf break spots.

name: Isla Verde beach
description: Experience a tropical beach in the heart of the city. Because of its proximity to SJU airport, this award-winning beach is popular among visitors. One of the best beaches in the metropolitan area, Isla Verde is golden-sand shores are framed with tall palm trees, hotels, restaurants, and shops. Isla Verde beach is divided into three main beaches: Pine Grove, where locals go surfing; Alambique, a more relaxed strip of sand; and the Balneario de Carolina, a more relaxed location with lifeguards and parking space.

name: Bosque Estatal de Cambalache
description: The Cambalache State Forest is located in the town of Arecibo and can be easily reached by taking Highway 22, which crosses through the northern side of the island. The forest has various hiking trails, gazebos, camping facilities, and on-site parking. The park is especially popular with mountain biking enthusiasts.

name: Bosque del Pueblo
description: Casa Pueblo offers guided tours through El Bosque del Pueblo, the forest lands that are under their protection. Visits to the forest have to be coordinated in advance, by calling the following number: (787) 829-4842. To camp in this paradisaical location is to delve into nature in its maximum splendor. The sounds, the stars, the smells, the flora, and the climate make the stay a mystical and unforgettable experience. Camping price for adults is $20.00 and $10.00 for children under 15 years old.

name: Desecheo National Wildlife Refuge
description: Desecheo National Wildlife Refuge is an uninhabited marine reserve on the west coast of Puerto Rico. Although it is a relatively small island, the terrain is mountainous and rugged. The highest point on the island is 683 feet (208 meters) above sea level. Desecheo is a haven for scuba divers due to its superb reefs, underwater caves, diverse marine life, and clear waters, but actually stepping foot on the island is punishable by law.

name: Lago de Matrullas
description: This man-made lake was built in 1934, and it's one of Orocovis's most impressive sights. There's a local tour company on-site that offers kayaking tours (coordinate in advance).

name: Playa La Esperanza - Vieques
description: Thi beach is conveniently located in one of Vieques's main town areas— La Esperanza. Therefore, it is one of the few beaches in town that is walking distance from restaurants, shops, hotels, and tour operators. La Esperanza is also home to one of Vieques's most iconic landmarks— the Esperanza Pier.

name: Pools Beach
description: Pools Beach is located on the western side of the Puntas Beach area. Pools beach is great spot for experienced surfers as it has a rocky point and fast currents.

name: Peña Blanca beach
description: Tucked away in a residential area of Aguadilla, this small beach is a secluded spot with crystal clear waters. During the summer the water is at its calmest, while the winter months are best for surfing. When planning your visit, keep in mind that parking in the area is limited and that weekends tend to be more crowded.

name: Surfer's Beach
description: If you guessed that this beach is popular with surfers, then you guessed right. Surfer's beach is located in the town of Aguadilla and it's a great spot for both novice and expert surfers alike.

name: Middles Beach
description: Located on the north-west coast of Puerto Rico, Middles beach is one of the best surfing spots on the island. While swimming on this beach is not recommended, it is a great spot to watch the locals catch waves and enjoy Isabela's sunny shores. Once a year Middles beach hosts Puerto Rico's premier surfing competition— the Corona Pro Surf Competition.

name: Cabo Rojo National Wildlife Refuge
description: Established in 1974, the Cabo Rojo National Wildlife Refuge lies along the southwest coast of Puerto Rico. It is one of the nine refuges managed by the Caribbean Islands National Wildlife Refuge Complex.

name: Paseo Lineal Río Bayamón
description: Inaugurated in June 2003, this Bayamón park provides visitors with six miles of peaceful biking and walking lanes. The lanes start on the PR-177 road and end on the PR-22 road, with an approximate length of 9.0 kilometers. The park has a linear walkway with two tracks, one for pedestrians and one for bicycles. The park also has areas for passive recreation, and Zumba and Aerobic classes are offered at no cost from Monday to Thursday at 6:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m.

name: Guajataka Scout Reservation
description: Founded in 1938, Guajataka Scout Reservation or Campamento Guajataka is known within scouting circles as “El Santuario de Amistad” which translates to “The Sanctuary of Friendship. Located on the northwest part of the island in San Sebastián, the property partially borders the southern portion of Guajataca Lake. Guajataka Scout Reservation is a short drive from Río Camuy Cave Park and Bosque Estatal de Guajataca. The camp is the Puerto Rico BSA Council's only scout camp reservation and has a participant capacity of little more than 500.

name: Cerro La Santa
description: Between the limit of Farallón de Cayey and Espino de San Lorenzo neighborhoods, Cerro La Santa stands at 2,962 feet. Here are the television aerials of the Corporation of Puerto Rico for Public Broadcasting. To get there take road #184 towards Guavate, and then road #181.

name: Refugio de Vida Silvestre Embalse Lucchetti
description: The Lucchetti Reservoir Wildlife Refuge is a great option for recreational fishing and other outdoor activities. The facilities include a recreational area with restrooms, bathrooms, gazebos, camping area, parking lot, boat ramp, and an area for fishing. The reservoir was built in 1952 to generate energy and potable water.

name: Cerro de Punta
description: Cerro Punta in Jayuya is the island's highest peak at an elevation of 1,338 meters above sea level. Get panoramic views of the island by either driving or hiking up the mountain. If you're driving up, it's recommended to do so in a four-wheel drive. The hike up the road that leads to the peak is about 30 minutes long.

name: Charco El Mango
description: This stunning natural pool can be found in the mountains of Adjuntas. To find Charco El Mango, you'll have to drive to Puerto Rico's famous Ruta Panorámica— a road the crosses through some of the island's most beautiful sceneries.

name: Bosque Estatal Toro Negro
description: As you cruise the winding PR-563 through the Ala de la Piedra borough, you'll find on the side of the road the main entrance to Bosque Toro Negro, a vast forest with around 18 km of trails where you can hike, take a plunge into its cold, pristine ponds and set up your camping tent for a relaxing weekend in the woods. There's also an observation tower atop the Cerro Doña Juan, which is Orocovis' highest point, and which you can climb to experience one of the best views Puerto Rico has to offer.

name: Bosque Estatal De Carite
description: This state forest extends through five municipalities in the southeast region of the island. One of forest most popular spots is the Charco Azul swimming hole, which can be reached after a short 20-minute hike through the forest.

name: Vereda el Bolo
description: In the Bosque Toro Negro, the Trail El Bolo (#4 in the forest's map) is a 4.4 km-long trail that takes you from the forest's administrative offices to the Observation Tower Trail (#6 in the map). Prepare for a long and rewarding hike through the Toro Negro forest!

name: Surfing Puerto Rico
description: Visit Surfing Puerto Rico for surfing lessons! Unleash your adventurous spirit and catch your first wave in one the best surfing spots in the Caribbean!

name: AdvenTours
description: Fully-licensed all-inclusive outdoor adventure operator with 26 years of experience in: bird watching, photography, hiking, nature walks, night hikes, river trekking, butterfly tours, walking tours, photo walks, and more. Some of the tours offered pass through or are in San Juan, San Germán, Mayagüez, Cabo Rojo, Luquillo, Vieques, Culebra, Ponce, Jayuya, and Rincón. Island-wide transfers and transportation is provided 24 hours a day. Prices might vary depending on hotel location and prices of gasoline at the time of the tour.

name: Black Beard Sports
description: Black Beard Sports' social responsibility can be witnessed in many facets of Vieques society. From conservation and outdoor recreation to education and supporting culture and the arts, they are committed to providing positive role models and experiences for our youth.

name: Sail San Juan Bay
description: Authentic sailing is culture, old school sailing, sideways, with complimentary drinks and sightseeing the historic bay of San Juan. There is no need for engine noises, no fake pirates and no crowds, this is real life sailing, aboard a fast and fun racer-cruiser sailboat. We provide Sail Trips by the historical bay of San Juan in groups no larger than 6. 1.5 hrs.

name: Eco Action Tours
description: In this magical tour, we will explore one of the most singular sceneries on Earth. Paddling along mangrove channels to Laguna Grande, where the bioluminescent water is like a mosaic of lights resembling fireflies. This natural phenomenon is caused by tiny organisms called dinoflagellates.

name: Catamaran Spread Eagle II
description: Spread Eagle II is a 1997 SeaRunner Catamaran. She was custom designed and built especially for them, incorporating features that makes your day on the water an experience to remember. Spread Eagle II has a stairway that lowers at the front of the boat for easy access while at the island and reef. They also offer a fresh water deck shower for those that want to rinse off the salt. They have both sun and shade decks and a real bathroom/changing room. Their twin outboard engines are the most quiet and environmentally friendly available. The boat is U.S.

location.street_address: Dock J Villa Marina Yacht Harbour

name: Katarina Sail Charters
description: Katarina Sail Charters offers sailing, snorkeling, all-inclusive tropical drinks and food. The only charter on the west coast of Puerto Rico that treats you to an all inclusive day or evening sail! They offer great music, an attentive crew and room for everyone! Intimate boat capable of safely sailing children, families, groups and spring break parties! They offer snorkeling, afternoon sunset sailing and private charters.

name: Create Adventure Puerto Rico
description: We take you to hidden waterfalls, secret off-road beaches, you will be traveling with friends or family in a Jeep Wrangler equipped with one kayak, two bikes, fishing poles to fish off the kayak if desired, cooler and your private driver who is prepared to take those awesome pictures of you jumping off the cliff into the water (with your camera of course).

name: Las Tortugas Adventures Inc.
description: Get off the beaten path and explore a side of Puerto Rico that few ever see. Kayak along stunning coastlines on tropical blue waters. Explore coral reefs teaming with sea life. Discover the hidden beauty of their islands' mangrove forests, bio-luminescent bays and secluded beaches. Tours:

name: Bieque Eco Trips
description: They work with small groups and all of their activities are eco-friendly, to share with family and/or friends. Their eco adventures are designed so that everyone in the family can enjoy an eco-friendly and unforgettable vacation. They offer hiking, bio bay trips, snorkeling, mountain bike rides, kayaking and paddle boarding. Ask about their private trips in dinghy boats.

name: Sail Getaways
description: Beat the Crowds with Sail Getaways!

name: Serenity Sea Tours
description: Private, Taylor-Made Beach & Snorkel Tours

name: Adventures Tourmarine
description: Boat trips across Joyuda Bay, Sunset and West Coast boat trips, Snorkeling, Diving, and Fishing Charters.

name: Bio Island Puerto Rico
description: Bio Island Puerto Rico is the only company that travels by boat to the Bio-luminescence Lagoon in Las Croabas, Fajardo.

name: Cacique Eco Adventures Tanama
description: Explore the Tanama river in our all in one adventure, an important body of water that gives life to a diverse ecosystem. Give yourself the opportunity of exploring a river full of historic and ecological value, with a team of expert tour guides that will make your adventure a thrilling experience.

name: Eco Adventures Kayaks
description: Eco adventures offers eco kayaking, catamaran and rain forest tours from Fajardo. Their bilingual guides are enthusiastic, experienced, certified, and they enjoy sharing their deep understanding of the rainforest ecology. Group charters are also available. Tours: 1- Bio Bay Bioluminescent Kayaking Tour 2- Catamaran and Bio Bay Combo Tour 3- Rain Forest, Beach and Bio Bay Kayak Trio

name: Caribe Aquatic Adventures
description: Diving in San Juan is done behind the Normandie Hotel in Escambron Park (4 activities daily). NAUI & PADI resort scuba affiliates, more than 30 years as underwater guides. Also offering diving instruction in San Juan: Discover scuba, Open Water, Advanced and Specialties & snorkel tours. Dive Sites: San Juan (shore/reef dives, no boats) “Figure 8 Reef” and “Horseshoe Reef” outside the “Lagoon”. Snorkeling and beginners’ dives in the “Lagoon or Inside Reef”.

name: Batey Adventures
description: Batey Adventure is a family company with over ten years of experience in Ecotourism. Batey Adventure’s unique setting in the Tanamá National Forest offers breathtaking views of the limestone landscape and lush trails showcasing Utuado’s vegetation. You can choose from a variety of activities to experience the region: from hiking across an amazing hanging bridge to zip lining over an eco-farm and horseback riding through a picturesque hacienda

name: De Tour Con Ali
description: Explore beyond the shores with a certified guide and discover why Puerto Rico is called the "Island of Enchantment." We've broadened our services to become a one-stop-shop! We've added meeting planners and transportation services all around the island. Featuring sites mostly visited by locals, we turn your visit from ordinary into an extraordinary one! Tour with the best and let us worry about the rest!

name: Hacienda La Mocha
description: They are a family-owned sustainable coffee farm and eco-hotel. Also, they are honored to have been named a bird & butterfly sanctuary given the variety of these that live in La Mocha. Visit them and enjoy the grounds as part of one of their informative walking tours or stay and enjoy the full Hacienda La Mocha experience. Tour reservations have to be made in advance and be for 10 people or more.

name: Sojourn Puerto Rico
description: Sojourn Puerto Rico is a luxury private tour service based in San Juan Puerto Rico and dedicated to bringing you the ultimate in high end travel! Also, they are dedicated to bringing you authentic natural and cultural experiences all around the island. They offer exclusive private tours to some of the most exuberant places in the Caribbean. Tours and experiences include the Sacred Rainforest and Archaeological Experience, The Taíno Route, Caving in the Karst and The Loíza Experience. You can also customize your own experience. They also offer limo services.

name: Puerto Rico Magic Tarpon
description: Your adventure will begin at Cangrejos Yacht Club Marina. Your Captain will be waiting for you at Dock E, Slip 117-118. The actual fishing will take place at Torrecilla and San José Lagoons, two of the most exciting inland fisheries in Puerto Rico. Your Puerto Rico fishing charter experience includes not only world-class Tarpon and Snook fishing, but also incomparable scenery and wildlife. The very location of these beautiful lagoons guarantees the absolute calmest of waters, which, for our clients, means no getting seasick!

name: Peacock Bass & Tarpon Tours
description: We offer fully guided trips for tarpon, pea bass, snook, Jaguar bass that will include all bait and tackle bottled watersand sodas. We are located just 5 minutes from the International airport and all major hotels in the San Juan area.

name: Isla Nena Scuba
description: As a PADI five star dive center, Isla Nena Scuba provides serious dive education available in English, French, German, and Spanish. We offer intimate scuba diving and snorkeling tours from the boat or the shore. Not certified? Go and join us for a Discover Scuba experience! We pride ourselves on our social and environmental practices and superior services. Ask us about private instruction and boat charters!

name: Neptunes Divers of Puerto Rico
description: At Neptune’s Divers they are emphatic by the highest standards of the diving industry, but more than a diving organization in Puerto Rico, they are a great FAMILY. Their mission is sharing and fraternizing as a family. They specialize in shore dives in the Northern area of Puerto Rico, but they also visit other dive points on the Island; when the sea conditions allow them to. They coordinate excursions by boat in the different cardinal points of the island.

name: Culebra Divers - Scuba Diving, Snorkeling, Gift Shop
description: Culebra Divers has operated in Culebra since 1987. We are a small company and our sincere goal is to provide you with a great experience, lots of fun memories, and excellent customer service. Culebra Divers is a fully insured PADI 5-star Dive Center and the only dive operator in Culebra endorsed by the Puerto Rico Tourism Company. We are an authorized ScubaPro, Aqua Lung, TUSA, and Trident dealer.

name: Altura by Caribbean Adventure Company
description: Altura is a Nature Adventure Company settled in Puerto Rico. The word Altura means high, elevation or altitude. They believe this is one of the key elements or key ingredients found very well, in almost all Adventures in Life. Their mission is to provide a fascinating experience, that has this key ingredient ingrained in different nature adventure activities, that could challenge you and them also, but at the same time providing a beautiful platform to enjoy nature the way they like it, among friends. They love everything! That is nature base, well….

name: Island Kayaking Adventures
description: Island Kayaking Adventures specializes in kayaking and snorkeling tours in the beautiful east coast of Puerto Rico. They do day and night tours. Their most impressive adventure is the Glowing Bay Adventure in Las Cabezas de San Juan Nature Reserve in Fajardo.

name: Hacienda 8A
description: Hacienda 8A is the perfect nature place to visit just to get out of the city routine. It is a peaceful place in which you can celebrate birthdays, anniversaries, family gatherings, weddings as well as corporate activities. You can also do horseback riding through 300 acres full of beautiful mountains, valleys, and naturally occurring rivers as well as experience de local fauna.

name: Skydive Puerto Rico
description: LIVE THE BEST EXPERIENCE OF YOUR LIFE! Our tandem jump is by far the quickest, safest and most convenient way to experience the thrill of a real-life freefall skydive. Your instructor will begin with a short training and safety briefing. After this, you will understand the equipment and the sequence of events that follow. You and your instructor will then share a tandem harness while free-falling from 10,000 or 14,000 feet at speeds of 120 mph or more!!

name: Tour Guide Debbie
description: Hello, I am Tour Guide Debbie. I am a licensed tour guide since July 1999. My clients call me Puerto Rico story-telling tour guide. During my specialized interactive cultural tours you will visit and know why some of the oldest historical sites in the New World were built in Puerto Rico. Enjoy leisure walks at charming towns in the Northwest while listening to the narration of the history. Discover how was the rise of a colonial town inside the fortress city of Puerto Rico during a morning walk in Old San Juan.

name: Aquatica Dive & Surf
description: Established since 1987 and endorsed by the Puerto Rico Tourism Co., they offer scuba, surf and stand up paddleboard lessons, tours and sales in the Aguadilla and Isabela areas. Best prices in town! Professional and friendly staff. Representatives of major brands such as Atomic Aquatics, CressiSub, Costa del Mar, SCUBAPRO more... Tours and experiences include scuba lessons, surf lessons, snorkeling trips, gear sales,rentals, and repairs.

name: Tropical Trail Rides
description: Here at Tropical Trail Rides, we offer a variety of possibilities for your horseback riding adventure. We operate 7 days a week with 2 rides daily. The morning ride, at 9 am, is a perfect way to start your day. Or if you prefer, you can see the best sunsets on the 4 pm tour. Each tour lasts approximately 2 hours, and it’s amazing what you can do in those 2 hours! We cater to groups or individuals. Inquiries into specialty rides are welcome. We have 30 horses available and our horses are well cared for, very gentle, but spirited! We take pride in the health and happiness of our animals.

name: Snorkel and Beach Tours
description: Traveler Catamaran specializes in guided tours of the Fajardo Sound on the eastern coast of Puerto Rico. Sail aboard the 54 ft catamaran, as they give you a day to remember for both sail and snorkeling tours! The Traveler features extensive deck areas for sunbathing, on-board toilet facilities, safety devices and their experienced Puerto Rican crew. Discover uninhabited islands and cays with secluded, sandy beaches. Snorkel the crystal clear waters where sea turtles play! Or sit back on deck and watch the kids enjoy the Sea Slide while sipping an icy rum punch.

name: La Paseadora del Río Espíritu Santo
description: A boat ride perfect for the navigation of the only river in Puerto Rico that is safe enough to navigate through.

name: Salty Dog Catamaran
description: If you are visiting Puerto Rico, you must go sailing and enjoy the pleasures of the sea aboard Salty Dog, our delightful 46-foot sailing catamaran. Departing from Fajardo, our sailing catamaran is designed to offer you a smooth and stable ride to Icacos, Lobos, or Palominos Island.

name: Turismo con Perea
description: Come and Discover the West Coast of the Island of PR, our beaches, Gastronomy, and Adventures. You will love our attractions.

name: RD2 Happiness eco tours
description: Road 2 Happiness is a tour, lessons and rental destination in Rincón. Their tours consist of water sports, hiking, waterfalls, biobay tours and boat trips. They offer surf lessons as well as coaching and equipment rentals for water sports. They also have a restaurant called El Patio in downtown Rincón.

name: Adventure and Water Sports Inc. Patillas
description: Offers tours on paddle boats, hiking tours, snorkeling and sunset/night kayak tours. Visit places like El Yunque, Culebra, and Vieques. They also rent out jet skis, kayaks and paddle boards.

name: Monkey Island Tours (La Paseadora)
description: This is a very family-friendly activity! Captain Paco plays a conch shell and provides traditional Puerto Rican instruments for his passengers during the short ride out to the island. Bring your drinks, but simple sandwiches of ham and cheese on delicious local bread are served on the boat. La Paseadora provides shade, padded seats, and ample room to move around. This is an experience for those who enjoy nature, being on the water, and a kind, fascinating guide. There are no restroom facilities on the boat.

name: Flying Fish Parasail
description: Snorkel Express Tour features parasailing and snorkeling through The Black Reef.

name: Tanama River Adventures
description: Tanamá River Adventures offers different options to choose from. Their outdoor adventure activities include; hiking through the forest and river, crossing fields of coffee, banana, plantain and orange plantations and more. Learn about the history and culture from the local expert guides. Visit caves and caverns, as well as enjoy water springs and waterfalls. Explore their underground river experience, swimming, water jumps, waterfalls, easy climbing and explore ancient rock formations. All of their tours depart at 8:30 am or 9 am.

name: Aventureo PR Tanama
description: Since 2005 we have work local adventures guides at the Tanama caves. The Tanama is a unique gateway located between Utuado and Arecibo. Surrounded by limestone formations and cave we will hike through the forest into we reach the canyons and start the body rafting through caves natural pool and narrows in the canyon we have different routes and levels. Our guides will supply all safety equipment required to the adventures you choose.

name: Potrero y Cafetería Brisas del Mar
description: Potrero and Cafeteria Brisas del Mar is located in the town of Camuy, between the beautiful view of the sea and the mountains near the coast that makes the area one of a kind. Numerous fauna and flora makes the place wonderful for horseback riding. They have been doing outdoor activities for children and adults for many years: horse rides and excursions, outdoor activities, birthdays, outdoor weddings and private activities. The excursions are accompanied by specialized guides who know the area and it is not necessary to have experience, just wanting to have fun.

name: Al Este Tours & Experiences
description: Traveler Catamaran specializes in guided tours of the Fajardo Sound on the eastern coast of Puerto Rico. Sail aboard the 54 ft catamaran, as they give you a day to remember for both sail and snorkeling tours! The Traveler features extensive deck areas for sunbathing, on-board toilet facilities, safety devices and their experienced Puerto Rican crew. Discover uninhabited islands and cays with secluded, sandy beaches. Snorkel the crystal clear waters where sea turtles play! Or sit back on deck and watch the kids enjoy the Sea Slide while sipping an icy rum punch.

name: Guaitiao Ecotours
description: Guaitiao Ecotours is a company with a focus on eco-adventure that offers a variety of alternatives in nature.

name: Amador Island Tours
description: Amador Island Tours provides all tours, transfers and lodging services around the Island of Puerto Rico. Contact them through their website. They are more than glad to receive you in their beautiful island!!!

name: Segway Tours Puerto Rico
description: Segway Tours Puerto Rico offer Sightseeing tours in Old San Juan. For more information, please click here

name: Rent the Bicycle
description: We at Rent the bicycle with our guide can personalize the tour for you and talking with the guide is easy! For those who wanted to visit emblematic places, or see something different the bicycle tour is the perfect getaway. Rent the bicycle tour guide will make the different showing the best of a smooth and safe bicycle ride. We even can customize your tour, with stops at museums, etc. Please let us know your bicycle tour preference, we will make it special.

name: Extreme Fishing Puerto Rico
description: Can you imagine a pre-historic herring flying through the air at the end of your line? This is what you can expect when you fish the back-country lagoons of La Torrecilla and San Jose lagoons in San Juan, Puerto Rico with Capt. Juan aboard the Extremist. Tarpon is a unique fish and is protected by law. The fishing is 100% catch & release. To catch one is truly an incredible experience as tarpon fight very hard and are known for their awesome jumping ability. Tarpon fish come to our lagoons to feed and grow, and there are plenty of them.

name: EcoQuest Experiences & Tours
description: With 17 years of expertise in the tourism industry, Ecoquest Experiences & Tours specializes in organizing adventures and tours to interesting and exciting destinations in Puerto Rico. Our excursions include ziplining, rappelling, canopy bridges, 8x8 vehicles and Can-Am UTVs. Ecoquest strives to promote the ecotourism and conservation of the Island's natural wonders. We feel great pride in showing the world the Island's unique treasures.

name: Jerrys Adventures llc.
description: We are known for our Adventures tours: Hiking to a Hidden Waterfall, Center of Puerto Rico Tours, and Agricultural Paradise Tours. This is the opportunity of a lifetime. Our tour guides will lead you to discover a new aspect of Puerto Rico's geography that many locals still don't know about! To experience our adventure, you need to see, hear, and feel it for yourself. All our tours are something else! You will be exploring nature at its best, surrounded by fresh air and the sounds of waterfalls. So, we encourage you to call or email us so we can set you up for an unforgettable day.

name: Go Hiking PR
description: For more than 30 years we offer guided hiking adventures to the San Cristobal Canyon Between Barranquitas and Aibonito. We are Natures interpreter with the National Association of Interpretation. Also we offer Rappelling experiences on cliff and waterfalls in the central area. If you like to hike, visit waterfalls and enjoy nature, we are here to serve you.

name: Rocaliza Adventure Tour
description: They specialize in Nature Adventure Tours. Their two most popular tours are: 1) EL SALTO FULL DAY ZIPLINE AND WATERFALL RAPPELLING ADVENTURE Tour Includes: Hiking, waterfall climbing, waterfall rappelling, river trekking and ziplining 2) EL SALTO HALF DAY ZIPLINE AND WATERFALL ROCK CLIMBING ADVENTURE Tour Includes: Hiking, waterfall climbing, river trekking and ziplining.

name: Pirate Snorkeling Shack
description: Pirate Snorkeling Shack is a young, dynamic, explorer and adventurer in love with the natural beauty of Puerto Rico. Founded in 2013, Pirate Snorkeling Shack is dedicated to exploring, discovering, and preserving the natural areas in Las Cabezas de San Juan Natural Reserve and Ensenada Yegua in Fajardo Puerto Rico.

name: Culebra Island Adventures
description: Enjoy small group snorkeling tours on Culebra Island, one of the Caribbeans most pristine eco destinations. Experience snorkeling among turtles, sting rays and colorful fish while being guided by certified professional tour guides in breathtakingly beautiful and warm turquoise waters.

name: Glass Bottom Kayak Tours
description: We offer exclusive Glass Bottom Kayak Tours to the Bioluminescent Bay at Laguna Grande in Fajardo, Puerto Rico.We don’t let rain stop our tours!! Come ready to get wet rain or shine!
