Customers receive a full refund in case of operator cancellation due to weather alerts and/or thunder and lightning storms. Discover our Bio Bay on a glass bottom kayak tour in Puerto Rico, it’s a must-do for any adventurer! (Glass Bottom Kayak Tours)Tours & Services: A. Glass Bottom Bio Bay Kayak Tour Join us for an exclusive glass bottom kayak adventure to the Bioluminescent Bay in Fajardo.

name: Puerto Rico Tours Network
description: La Parguera is in the southwest of Puerto Rico, 15 minutes from Guánica, one (1) hour from Rincon, (2) two hours from San Juan. It is called the belly of Puerto Rico because its valleys are fertile farming lands. The pineapple is the symbol of its flag for the delicious “Piña Cabezona” (big head): The best pineapple of Puerto Rico. La Parguera has the Bioluminescent Bay and beautiful natural environment full of mangroves and canals. You can enjoy a variety of water sports, Restaurants, and Puerto Rico Tours Network/Puerto Rico Eco Tours 787 899-3478 or (787)538-0386, 787 206-9494

name: Yunque Ziplining
description: Experience nature and adrenaline in the Yunque Ziplining adventure-tour, which takes place in the lively town of Luquillo located on the northeast of Puerto Rico. A 45-minute drive from San Juan takes you to a secluded and private rainforest tucked in the mountains with unique views of El Yunque Rainforest, the only tropical rainforest in the US Forest System. Feel the buzz through the forest canopy in our 5 scenic ziplines, enjoy an exhilarating and easy rappel (optional), a fun hanging canopy bridge and an educational 10-minute hike in the rainforest. Our views are like no other!

name: Aqua Adventures, Inc.
description: Aqua Adventure is your one-stop-shop to all of your underwater happiness. They take great pride in being a Five Star PADI IDC Center with exclusive products, destinations, and awesome customer service. Whether you are vacationing in San Juan or on the eastern coast of Puerto Rico, whether your a novice snorkeler or an experienced diver, Aqua Adventure has something for you.

name: Island Scuba Puerto Rico
description: They offer their customers the opportunity to enjoy a breathtaking Wall Dive. Submerge and enjoy the breathtaking underwater scenery and marine life in the Caribbean, with a lot of spectacular dive sites, some of them just 12 minutes from the dock. There is so much to see, that you can dive a different reef everyday for two weeks and be amazed. Explore the most spectacular walls, colorful and pristine reefs in Puerto Rico and the Caribbean. Tours & Services include dive trips to Guánica, La Parguera, Guayanilla & Ponce.

name: Pure Adventure
description: Pure Adventure is a tour agency offering tour services and courses. It is located in Las Croabas, Fajardo. For more information, you may call at (787) 202-6551 or visit Pure Adventure. Tours and services include Culebra & Vieques Beach & Snorkel, Discover Bioluminescence Tour, Bio Bay Kayak Tour in Fajardo, Boat Cruise Tour to Vieques Island, Snorkel & Cruise Charter Boat to Vieques, Educational Kayak and Hiking Field trips.

name: Somos Pa'l Monte
description: Somos Pa'l Monte is an Ecotourism Agency focused on the promotion, education and training of people interested in the healthy and safe enjoyment of the natural areas offered by the island of Puerto Rico.

name: Encanto WaterSports
description: As a family company we want to offer you the opportunity to know our beaches and our culture in a family environment, our Encanto WaterSports team will give you the adventure you need, as jetski, kayak, flyboard, sup, and more.

name: Ocean Sports
description: Ocean Sports is a full service dive shop established in Puerto Rico since 1988. They provide certification courses, dive trips, equipment sales and repair, gear rental and gas fills (Air, Nitrox and Trimix). Their staff members have more than 50 years of experience in teaching and leading divers and are dedicated to providing the safest and most enjoyable experience possible for their customers.

name: Coconut Revolution 101
description: Do you have what it takes to survive on a desert island? If you're curious, you should definitely take advantage of the unique experience of Coconut Revolution 101. You will explore how the coconut gives us food, water, shelter, and much more! You will be able to see and appreciate what nature has to offer for your survival and delight. Coconut Revolution 101 is for everyone, whether you are a family, a couple, or a corporate group. It is an experience full of adventure and learning, that will leave you with lasting memories.

name: Caribe Bliss Ocean Tours & Boat Rental
description: At Caribe Bliss we offer you the most blissful and relaxing boat tour experience to the most beautiful destinations in the Caribbean. We want to share with you the amazing and stunning crystal clear beaches of Puerto Rico by taking you to the best spots like Culebra and Vieques. We are family owned and operated, so we take our business personally.We are committed to providing the most comprehensive customer accommodations in the region.

name: Jak Water Sports
description: JAK Water Sports Equipment and Bike Rentals and Adventure Tours is a local family-owned and operated business on Vieques Island, Puerto Rico. They take pride in providing excellent customer service and customer satisfaction. We offer the following Tours: Biobay Tours on Glass Bottom Kayaks Motor Boat Sightseeing & Snorkeling Tours Paddleboard or Kayak & Snorkeling Tours

name: IMS SUP & SURF STORE
description: IMS is the only surf store and SUP school in the Municipality of Arecibo. Currently, they are offering services, such as kayak, boogie, SUP, skate, and bike.

name: Water Sports and Ecotours
description: Water Sports and Eco Tours offers self guided kayak and paddle board rentals for $15 a person the hour, pedal boat for $10, guided hikes at $5.00 a person by reservations for groups of 10+.

name: KNO Jet Ski Rental Puerto Rico
description: Offering brand new Yamaha 1.8 Supercharged Jet skis. Wide riding area on the crystal clear waters of Isla Verde, Puerto Rico. Come visit us behind the Courtyard Marriot or call us for more info!! Take our 1.5Hr tour cruising the coastline to El Morro! (Facebook: KNO Jet Ski Rental)

name: Ocean Pro Adventure Jet Ski Tour & Boat Rental
description: Our 90-minute journey departs from Cangrejos Yacht Club, Piñones. A memorable journey into the best waters of the Caribbean along the beaches of Isla Verde and the mangrove canals of the San Jose lagoon water system with one of our professionally experienced tour guides will be the best Jet Ski adventure you’ll experience in Puerto Rico. A 30 min stop to relax and enjoy the water is a must! Pure adrenaline.

location.street_address: Carr. 187 Boca De Cangrejos, Sector Piñones

name: Vaca Negra
description: It is part of the innovative concept that has captivated Puerto Ricans and visitors from around the world. Vaca Negra offers you an agrotourism and gastronomic experience in Hatillo. Enjoy the world of 100% aged cheeses in Puerto Rico. If you are a lover of cheese, surely every time you arrive at a party you will go directly to evaluate the table of the picadera to make sure that they have what you like and then you go through the bar, to see that there is good wine.

name: Benítez Fishing Charters
description: Imagine, only 20 minutes from the dock and you’re there, fishing for the famous “blue marlin” aboard a luxurious, air - conditioned 45’ Hatteras! This can be one of the most exciting alternatives for your visitors to San Juan. We’ve been in the big game fishing business here for 40 years, organizing everything from small groups to large tournaments.

name: The Butterfly People
description: An original, world-renown art form, using real butterflies encased in acrylic and sealed for eternity, is on exhibit in one of the most exquisite historic mansions in the Old City. Acquire the art for your own enjoyment or for an impressive and original gift. Also find a gift shop, cafe/bistro and Malula Antique Gallery.

name: Spicy Caribbee
description: This unique and fragrant shop is stocked with Puerto Rican coffee beans, local and Caribbean seasonings, traditional hot sauces, vanilla extracts and preserves. They also prepare Puerto Rican gourmet VIP gifts. Visit the store online at spicycaribbee.com to have your purchases shipped to your home.

name: Galería Martínez Géigel
description: We are located just a few steps away from the Puerto Rico Convention Center. Call us today and we will create a unique experience for your corporate group or team building experience. We can organize an art teaching class/cocktail where attendees can create their own art piece— an excellent option for small private groups/events.

name: Sea Ventures Dive Centers
description: Established in 1988, Sea Ventures Dive Centers is a PADI 5 Star Dive Center, with over 30 years of experience providing great diving throughout the Spanish Virgin Islands. They offer scuba diving for certified and non certified divers as well as snorkeling. People are welcome to ride along.

name: Club Brava & Ultra Lounge at Fairmont El San Juan Hotel
description: Previously known as Club Babylon, Club Brava is located at Fairmont El San Juan Hotel one of the hottest hotels in Puerto Rico. Club Brava is the host of many celebrities visiting the Island. The Club provides an exclusive and secure location for corporate and social private events among many other customized services.

name: Believe Bar & Grill
description: Our menu specializes in Caribbean food. We also have a Brunch menu, plus you can enjoy stand up comedy every other Friday Night as well as Karaoke.

location.street_address: Urb. Ponce de León Ave. Esmeralda P-10

name: Ron del Barrilito Visitor Center
description: From Bayamón, Puerto Rico to the world! Learn about the history and unique craftsmanship of Ron del Barrilito, the oldest Puerto Rican rum, still made in the same place and in the same way since 1880.

location.street_address: Ron del Barrilito - Hacienda Santa Ana

name: Teatro La Perla
description: Teatro La Perla is a historic theater located in the southern town of Ponce. Inaugurated in 1864, it is the second oldest theater of its kind in Puerto Rico, but "the largest and most historic in the Spanish-speaking Caribbean." The theater has a seating capacity of 1,047 and it is now a regular venue for concerts, opera, plays, and various civic and educational activities such as school graduations. The lobby of the theater has a small museum dedicated to the history of the building and past shows.

name: Casa Rosada Carlos Manuel “Charlie" Rodríguez
description: Known as the "Pink House", this historical structure in the town of Caguas dates back to the early 20th century. Casa Rosada is now a museum dedicated to honoring the memory of the first Puerto Rican to be "blessed" by the Catholic Church, Carlos Manuel Rodríguez. The first floor of the museum walks visitors through the first years of Carlos Manuel's life, whereas the second floor goes over the beatification process, which culminated in 2001.

name: Paseo de los Artistas
description: This beautiful promenade is located in the city center of Caguas, between the town's most important institutions and museums. On the third Saturday of every month, the town organizes an art fair complete with music, food, and local artisans.

name: Parque Ecológico Urbano
description: Spend a day connecting with nature in Ponce's Urban Ecological Park. You'll find various walking and cycling trails, outdoor exercise stations, and an amphitheater. The park also has a variety of plants and trees, most of which are native plus a couple of lagoons.

name: Museo de Recursos Históricos de Lares
description: This small museum is dedicated to art and history, presenting local crafts, paintings and historical photographs of the town of Lares.

name: Krazy Fire
description: Closed until further notice - 7/13/2018

name: Scandalo The Club
description: Scandalo is a fused name, with "escandalo" (in Spanish) and scandal. Promoted as a gay bar. It offers drag performances and other events that support the LGBT community. Enjoy a unique experience with a diversity of friends and locals!Recorded closed on Google. 7/17/2018

name: Zipline Tours PR
description: Puerto Rico's best zipline tours including canopy zip line adventures! Get ready for the zipline rides of your life with exciting zipline cables high over tropical forests and rivers as well as through the majestic rainforest canopy! Plus, they have rock climbing, rappelling, and exciting suspension bridges. There are many tours and combinations available!

name: Sailing Dreams and Sunset Cruises
description: Sailing Dreams is San Juan's premier sailing tours company. They cater to Lifetime Experiences that will make you dream again. Sailing Dreams commits to having the most personalized, idyllic, memorable, romantic, fun and/or relaxing sailing day of your life, while enjoying great sights of Magical World Heritage and Landmark Sites of Old San Juan. Your experience will be personalized to cater your celebration: Vacations, Marriage Proposal, Anniversary, Intimate Wedding, Birthday Party, Friends Getaway, etc.

name: Centro de Bellas Artes de Caguas
description: The Centro de Bellas Artes de Caguas (Finer Arts Center) is named in honor of the former mayor, Ángel O. Berríos, and was inaugurated in 1993. The structure is modern, and its capacity has made it one of the largest entertainment centers in Puerto Rico. The Caguas's Fine Arts Center has three rooms: the Felipe Rodríguez Concert Hall, the José Luis Moneró Room, and the Carmita Jiménez Convention Room. These rooms are available for all kinds of activities, from theatre productions to school proms, and more.

name: Museo de Arte Contemporáneo de Puerto Rico
description: The Museo de Arte Contemporáneo de Puerto Rico is now open to the public with a new weekend schedule, Friday to Sunday from 11:00 am to 5:00 pm. Entry to the MAC is conditioned upon the observation of the security measures being followed as a response to the current pandemic, and the public’s compromise with standard hygienic practices. Visitors will be required to use masks, comply with our disinfecting protocol, and pass through our temperature checkpoint.

location.street_address: Ave. Juan Ponce de León, esquina Ave. Roberto H. Todd

name: Isla Caja De Muertos
description: Dubbed as one of the top enchanting attractions in Puerto Rico, Caja de Muertos is a secluded and uninhabited nature reserve with one of the most pristine settings that you’ll find on the island. This natural wonder is ideal for visitors looking to reconnect with nature away from the city noise. At Caja de Muertos you can hike, go birdwatching, explore the lighthouse ruins, or simply unwind under the sun.

name: ZEN SPA Condado
description: The perfect oasis for balancing body, mind and soul. Pampering beyond expectation, to make anyone feel and look their best. Timely, high-quality spa treatments, hair salon, lockers, showers, sauna and steam As well as, facials, body massage, body wraps, manicures, pedicures and hair services. Zen Spa is courteous, has well-trained professionals and a serene ambiance.

name: Hotel Media Luna
description: Seasonal Hours

name: Casa BACARDÍ Puerto Rico
description: Step into Casa BACARDÍ, the world’s largest premium rum distillery, where the spirit of Puerto Rico meets the legacy of BACARDÍ. Just a short ferry ride across the bay from Old San Juan, Casa BACARDÍ welcomes you with a refreshing cocktail at the waterfront Bat Bar Pavilion, setting the scene for a memorable journey.

name: Aventuras Tierra Adentro
description: Aventuras Tierra Adentro, Inc. is a wholly Puerto Rican enterprise, established in 1987 and fully endorsed by the Puerto Rico Tourism Company. It is Puerto Rico’s pioneer company for various adventure activities, such as cave excursions, canyoning, via ferratas and rock climbing. Also offered are team-building events at a corporate level. The firm is headed by rock climber and speleologist Rossano Boscarino, recognized internationally for his achievements in vertical technique rope climbing.

name: Playa Santa
description: One of the most popular beaches in Guánica, Playa Santa has a broad white-sand shore brushed by crystalline waters and lined by coconut palm trees. It is a nice beach to relax and retreat, and you’ll find various kiosks offering kayak rentals and food stands at its entrance. There are no lifeguards or restrooms onsite.

name: Culebra Concierge
description: Our guest services company offers a ONE STOP solution for all of your needs during your Culebra vacation. Some of the services that we offer include: shopping, transportation, beach gear rental, food and grocery delivery, accommodations, and more!

name: Museo de Arte y Diseño de Miramar
description: MADMi is an art and design museum located in San Juan's historic Miramar neighborhood. We are an interactive space designed to inspire visitors to experience the richness of contemporary art and design in Puerto Rico. Our curatorial focus on the decorative arts, design, and visual arts stems from a bequeathed collection of industrial design objects and from the historic role of the house as a studio for distinguished Puerto Rican artists, most notably, the great Lorenzo Homar.

name: Roca Norte Outdoor Climbing Gym
description: Roca Norte Outdoor Climbing Gym is a unique rock climbing and camping spot, where you can experience the majesty of our karstic mountains while you rock climb with a stunning view waiting for you at the top. Since we are also an outdoor gym, it means you can not only come for a one-time visit but you can experience climbing training for a month or more.

name: Puerto Rico Tour Desk
description: Puerto Rico Tour Desk is a company created in 2014 by a Concierge group who decided to make a corporation that provides the highest-quality level of service. We are endorsed by the Puerto Rico Tourism Company. Furthermore, our team consists of people from different generations including Baby Boomers, Generation Y, X, and Millennials. Our diversified background enables us to connect and work with various types of people. In Puerto Rico Tour Desk, we strive for innovation by always keeping up with the latest technology and adapt to change.

name: The Outlets at Montehiedra
description: The Outlets at Montehiedra is the only Outlets concept mall in the Metropolitan area. Just take the highway

name: Caguas Real Golf & Country Club
description: Designed by John Sanford, this parkland-style layout is a tale of two very different nines. A relatively flat and benign front nine gives way to a rollicking back nine where hills, scenery, and elevation change define the experience. Located in the central-eastern part of the island, the golf course is modestly priced, a budget-friendly option with commensurate conditions and friendly customer service. The driving range is open Tuesday to Sunday: from 6:30 am to 7:00 pm. 19 Hole Bar & Sampler, the onsite restaurant, is open Tuesday to Sunday: from 11:30 am to 9:00 pm

name: Deportivo del Oeste Golf Club
description: With a southwestern island address where great food, beaches and the sparkling sea await, Deportivo is a sporty, value-priced golf club that offers an 18-hole, par-71 layout. A practice area, 19th hole bar and restaurant, and well-regarded teaching professional complement play here, where the course is rarely crowded and the vibe unassuming. It is one of three courses on the west coast, along with Royal Isabela and Punta Borinquen, all with exceptional views and scenery.

name: Fort Buchanan Golf Course
description: This 9-hole walking course dates to the 1920s, and it is routed such that golfers play it twice for a satisfying 18-hole round. Golfers can access the base with a pre-booked tee time, and it’s a popular pastime for cruise ship passengers given the nearby port. Located near the Bacardí factory on the northeastern coast, Fort Buchanan doesn’t have lodging, but it’s a worthwhile place to go for a fun round of daily fee golf.

name: Rainforest Zipline Park
description: The best zip line experience for all! * Included in the HALL OF FAME of Trip Advisor, five consecutive years of Excellence based on the feedback of our participants. *The number 1 activity recommended in Río Grande town. *People from 8 years and older, with or without experience, can come and enjoy the zip line experience with us!

name: Isla Caribe
description: Isla Caribe is a cultural tour and experience company based in Ponce, Puerto Rico. Our services include city walking tours, themed cultural tours (for example music and coffee tours), and school tours. We are a team of local passionate historians, anthropologists, travelers, certified guides and educators seeking to advance sustainable cultural tourism and to revive communities in areas that have great tourism potential in Puerto Rico.

name: Spotin Adventure Tours
description: Find unique adventure tours in Puerto Rico with a sustainable base. Discover off the beaten path experiences with local guides to hidden gems like the rainforest, coffee haciendas, and hidden waterfalls. Some experiences are: Yunque tour Coffee tour Old San Juan walking trip Puerto Rico as a local experience Window cave and waterfall trip Chinchorreo in the mountain trip Follow us on social media for more info and awesome photo/video content of our trips! @spotinpr facebook/instagram: @spotinpr

name: Sail Snorkel Party, Inc.
description: Sail Snorkel Party has been sailing, SCUBA diving and snorkeling for over 50 years in Puerto Rico! We now offer private sailing trips in and around the San Juan Bay for groups up to 6. If you would like to learn to sail before purchasing your own vessel or, spend a romantic afternoon aboard a nice and classic sailing vessel, the ‘Airborne’ is a 35 foot Pearson sloop, ready to sail at a moments notice, 15 minutes from anywhere San Juan. Our most popular trip is that of the San Juan Sunset! Most guests like to bring their favorite beverage to celebrate onboard!

location.street_address: #1 Taft st, Suite 10-F Cond. Playa Grande

name: Condado Tourism Center
description: Bienvenidos and welcome to the Condado Tourism Center (CTC). I'd like to welcome you to Puerto Rico if you're here as a visitor. If you live in Puerto Rico, I'm happy to share your island as my home. We feature premium bicycle rental, kayak and paddleboard rental, and short-term luggage storage within the facility.

name: Scuba Dogs PR - Guaynabo
description: 5-Star Diving Center certified by PADI. It offers snorkeling excursions, diving, "Discover Scuba" for beginners, and night diving for the most advanced. In addition, all levels of training in swimming, diving, rescue, first aid, birthdays, and activities for children.

name: Plenitud PR
description: Plenitud PR is a non-profit educational farm and community dedicated to service in sustainability and the arts. We provide people with the skills and knowledge needed to encourage inner growth and to live in harmony with themselves, each other, and the natural world. At the heart of our service is experiential learning in sustainability and the arts that engages people in community service, fosters relationships, and creates connections.

name: Caribbean Chiliboats La Parguera
description: Explore the keys, canals and mangroves of La Parguera aboard a Chiliboat water bike! Experience this unique Caribbean Nature Reserve in a fun and unconventional way, it will be a fabulous experience you will never forget!

name: Frutos del Guacabo
description: Frutos del Guacabo is a family business that arose as a response to the need of its founders to reinvent themselves in 2010. Since then, its continuous evolution and development have made it one of the undeniable references in the island's gastronomy industry. Besides being a production space, it is also a meeting point where culinary agriculture is promoted through a "Farm to Table" experience. Chefs, waiters, diners, and students exchange their knowledge and experiences to continue developing the gastronomy of the island.

name: Centro La Paz Yoga
description: We are a team of wellness-minded individuals helping Rincon locals and world travelers find peace in their minds and strength in their bodies. We offer: Private + Group Yoga, Private + Group Pilates, Massage Therapy, ACE Cupping Therapy, Arvigo Mayan abdominal therapy, Colonics, Reiki, Herbal Consultations and Doula Services. We feature a Guest Studio Apartment, Wellness Shop, as well as a pop-up vegan + veggie station provided by De la Tierra. We are located near downtown Rincon. Let us support you on your wellness journey. Om shanti om

name: ZEN SPA Guaynabo
description: The perfect oasis for balancing body, mind and soul. Pampering beyond expectation, to make anyone feel and look their best. Timely, high-quality spa treatments, hair salon, lockers, showers, sauna and steam As well as, facials, body massage, body wraps, manicures, pedicures and hair services. Zen Spa is courteous, has well-trained professionals and a serene ambiance.

name: ZEN SPA TOO
description: Wonderful Spa for girls ages 2-13 in a creative, colorful and fun-filled environment offering Facials, massages, body wraps, body scrubs, manicures, pedicures and hair services. Lots of glitters!

name: ZEN SPA RETREAT Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel & Casino
description: The perfect oasis for balancing body, mind and soul. Pampering beyond expectation, to make anyone feel and look their best. Timely, high-quality spa treatments, hair salon, lockers, showers, sauna and steam As well as, facials, body massage, body wraps, manicures, pedicures and hair services. Access to Infinity Pool and Fitness Center. Zen Spa Retreat is courteous, has well-trained professionals and a serene ambiance.

name: ZEN SPA OCEANO Caribe Hilton
description: An oceanfront oasis for balancing body, mind and soul. Pampering beyond expectation, to make anyone feel and look their best. Timely, high-quality spa treatments, hair salon, lockers, showers, sauna and steam As well as, facials, body massage, body wraps, manicures, pedicures and hair services. Tropical outdoor whirlpool and access to Fitness Center. Zen Spa Oceano is courteous, has well-trained professionals and a serene ambiance.

name: Jungle Bird
description: Amid the bustle of iconic La Placita de Santurce lies Jungle Bird, a hot leisure cocktail bar offering the best of the island experience. Serving not tiki, but Taino-tropical drinks combined with a surprising and ever-changing food menu to write home about --this jungle embodies the joy and relaxation of the Caribbean.

name: Caneca Coctelería Movil - Miramar
description: Hot days in the Caribbean are better spent with an iced cocktail. If it is made with fresh ingredients, better yet. Located in Lote 23 gastronomic park, in Santurce, as well as Mirmar, Caneca serves slushees, cocktails, and ice-cold beers, as well as an island-style food menu."

name: Caneca Coctelería Movil - Lote 23
description: Hot days in the Caribbean are better spent with an iced cocktail. If it is made with fresh ingredients, better yet. Located in Lote 23 gastronomic park, in Santurce, as well as Miramar, Caneca serves slushees, cocktails, and ice-cold beers, as well as an island-style food menu."

name: Surf Caffé
description: The perfect oceanside spot in Condado, Puerto Rico to enjoy quality cocktails, fresh appetizers and specialty coffee in good company.

name: Puerto Rico Sidecars, Inc.
description: At Puerto Rico Sidecars we’re the Caribbean's 1st and only sidecar company! Take in the breathtaking experience in one of our vintage sidecar motorcycles. We provide a once in a lifetime opportunity to see the beauty of Puerto Rico while riding in style. Each motorcycle accommodates up to two guests and comes with a private chauffeur, who will cater to each guest’s needs and requests. Our tours are not only super fun but also will give our guests the history and important facts about the sights. It’s by far the best way to see the island and really enjoy what Puerto Rico has to offer.

name: Vieques Sailing Charters
description: Vieques Sailing Charters excursions begins with breathtaking views of Vieques' stunning Caribbean coastline and virgin landscape as we sail to a remote location for a guided snorkeling tour. As you work up an appetite exploring the reef light fare is prepared on board with locally sourced ingredients and served with refreshing beverages. After a bit more relaxing and soaking up the sun, the return sail will have you wondering how four (4) hours can go by so quickly! Tour Includes: Sailing, guided snorkeling, snorkeling gear, light fare.

name: San Juan Paddleboarding
description: Located at Parque Benitez in the Condado Lagoon, San Juan Paddleboarding offers SUP board rental as well as kayaks. No reservation is required and we're open seven days a week from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Kayak rental for two people: $40 SUP board rental: $20 All rentals include two hours and basic training.

name: Trans Travel
description: Trans-Travel is a company dedicated to the service of ground logistics and tours throughout Puerto Rico. We utilize totally bilingual trained personnel to meet the needs of personalized service whatever the group size. We have a large variety of services and passenger transportation equipment which you can inspect at your convenience.

location.street_address: Álamo Street BF-12 Valle Arriba Heights

name: Crystal Clear
description: Crystal Clear is an eco-tourism operation that provides snorkeling tours, mermaid classes, and mermaids for events (parties, etc.). With every tour or event, the staff of Crystal Clear teaches about ocean conservation, how to best interact with marine life, and introduces you to the local environment.

name: Local Guest
description: We are a women-powered travel company dedicated to co-creating and promoting authentic tourism experiences by working hand in hand with local communities and entrepreneurs in order to build a new tourism ecosystem based on sustainable development practices. Do you want to make an impact? If the answer is yes, then you are the people we are looking for. At Local Guest, we are always looking for travelers who want to explore beyond and deeper. We are looking for committed people who want to experience the local culture while giving a hand to those who need it.

name: The Puerto Rico Sightseeing Pass (Puerto Rico Tours)
description: Take to the islands for a Caribbean getaway and make the beach your only priority with the Puerto Rico Sightseeing Premium Flex Pass, your way to save 40% on total admission costs at over 20 attractions.

name: The Innovation
description: Aboard the Innovation, snorkeling and customer service are our strengths. We provide the best snorkeling experience for all levels. We make sure you have an unforgettable day on the water regardless of your water skills. Pioneered for nautical tourism, Innovation became the first vessel to transport diving and snorkeling tour groups in Puerto Rico. Built in 1970 as a replica of a US Navy Seal LCPL Vessel, Innovation offers daily snorkeling excursions from Fajardo to La Cordillera Nature Reserve.

name: West Side Destination
description: Focused on two key aspects: A high-end code of conduct that incorporates the laid-back free-spirit feeling of the West into the life of the tourist’s adventurous experience. WSD is the start of a new era in tourism experiences in Puerto Rico, offering an evolved and refined adventure within the island's unadulterated areas and wonders. Our business stands for: -Adventure -History -Culture -Customer Service and Satisfaction

name: Rincon Waves Hydroflights
description: Our goal is to bring this experience directly to the consumer. Now everyone can experience what was once only a dream. We are the only Jetpack rental in P.R. offering the most thrilling hydro flight experiences on the beach where you can fly up to 30 ft above the water. We also provide Jetski rentals. We are registered with the Department of Natural and Environmental Resources of Puerto Rico.

name: Seeing Puerto Rico
description: Puerto Rico offers beautiful scenery, unique biological and geological phenomenon, wondrous culture and rich history. Book a tour with us, Seeing Puerto Rico, to discover what The Island of Enchantment has to offer.

name: Hacienda Agroecológica Recaos Ortíz
description: Hacienda Recaos Ortiz offers tours of their vegetable cultivation areas, giving visitors a unique opportunity to connect with Puerto Rico’s farmers. During your visit, you’ll learn about our cultivation methods, medicinal plants, and other educational activities. Come enjoy the outdoors, while you check out our seasonal crops and taste our rich cilantro dip.

name: Finca Península del Río
description: During this local farm experience, visitors will disconnect from daily life and find peace, serenity, joy, and unspoiled family time. The tour starts at our very own vineyard. Yes, you read that right— a vineyard in the Caribbean! Learn from our tour guides about the process of growing and caring for grapes in Puerto Rico's tropical environment. The second stop during this farm experience is at our vegetable and farinaceous fields, where visitors will learn how local farmers grow and produce food.

name: Island Journeys
description: Island Journeys is dedicated to providing El Yunque Rainforest Experiences in Puerto Rico that offer the perfect combination of hiking, nature, water activities, fun information, and relaxation. Our adventures are led by passionate local tour guides eager to share the beauty, culture, and natural wonders of their island with visitors from all around the world.

name: Made in Puerto Rico
description: Made in Puerto Rico, The Store, is the permanent store for products fully "Made in Puerto Rico". Our store is the main axis for the general public to know and buy the products of all our local partners.

name: Moca Climbing & Coaching
description: We are a local company offering guide services and personalized climbing instruction throughout Puerto Rico. Our guides are AMGA (American Mountain Guide Association) certified single pitch instructors. We speak Spanish, English, French, and Portuguese.

name: Colón Horse Riding
description: Colón Horse Riding offers memorable horseback riding tours throughout Vieques north shore beaches. Horseback riding tours depart every day during the following hours: 10:00 AM, 12:00 PM, 2:00 PM, and 4:00 PM. Rides last about an hour and a half and no experience is required to join.

location.street_address: Bravos de Boston Sector Puerto Diablo

name: I Ventures
description: At I VENTURES we are passionate about creating unique travel experiences & memories for a lifetime. We provide exclusive flight day trips and private charter flights to Culebra, Vieques, BVI, and many other beautiful destinations. Our day trips to Culebra, Vieques, and even more islands that have various packages available, which include snorkeling, transportation, and more. There are countless ways to enjoy your trip with I VENTURES—from luxury boat charter services and tours in amazing Puerto Rico—and we even have a schedule of daily flights to Vieques and Culebra Islands.

name: Caribbean Soaps
description: Caribbean Soaps is a family-run company that pioneered the handmade soap making business on the island. Made in Puerto Rico since 2001! Every soap is handmade in our shop using local ingredients like sea salt, honey, fresh aloe and local herbs. We are passionate about making the best artisanal soaps and natural bath and body products made in Puerto Rico. You can find our handmade soaps in our store in San Juan, online store, airport shops, local supermarkets, health food stores and even on some Royal Caribbean cruise ships!

name: Puerto Rico Helitours
description: Puerto Rico Helitours, a pioneer in the helicopter tours and experiences, offers exclusive excursions, charters and transfers all over Puerto Rico also customizing your desired experience. Visit the best places, taking in the greatest views from a helicopter! Some of our top sellers are: flying over our monumental historic city of Old San Juan, also enjoying the great views of our Atlantic Ocean in our north coast Enchanted Shore Tour, or discover all the nature Puerto Rico has to offer in The Green Escape were we fly over our metro, mountain, coast and city areas.

name: AC Fish Finder
description: AC Fish Finder will take you to the heart of the fishing action on your next trip to San Juan, Puerto Rico. We’ll take you to the best lakes & lagoons to catch Peacock Bass and/or Tarpon. Puerto Rico has some of the finest Tarpon fishing & Peacock Bass fishing in this hemisphere. Captain Angel Campos is a U.S Coast Guard licensed fishing guide with 40+ years fishing the waters around San Juan. Angel knows all of the best fishing techniques & places to fish the lakes around Puerto Rico.

name: Amasar
description: "Enjoy this new agribusiness experience in the high mountains of Puerto Rico, where the protagonist is the breadfruit fruit, categorized as a "Superfood." Take a tour through the farm until you reach the manufacturing area and learn about the innovative processes to create bread flour."

name: Atlantic San Juan Tours
description: We are here to provide efficient service to our clients. Our goal is to satisfy our clients in a pleasant atmosphere with the feeling of how we treat our guests with friendliness and care. REGULAR TOURS- We have fun daily tours. these are for guests who don't mind sharing the tour bus with guests from other hotels. We pick up guests from the different hotels usually in the mornings and explore the sights with our knowledgeable and friendly tour guides. This tour is offered on our air-conditioned 14 passenger vans or our 25 passenger Mini Coach Bus.

name: Caribe Tours PR
description: Caribe Tours invites you to an adventure in Ponce, Puerto Rico and the rest of the Island. We have a wide list of attractions full of adventure that you will enjoy; guided by a team of experts that aims to show you the best that our Island has to offer. Caribe Tours operates an extended fleet of over 150 vehicles to satisfy our customer’s needs. We have a wide range of experiences, from a basic tour in our city square; to explore the wilderness of the tropical rainforest or dry forest, and enjoy the best beaches in the Caribbean.

name: Centro de Conservación de Manatíes de Puerto Rico
description: Our center, an alliance between the 501c3 non-profit Caribbean stranding network and the Inter American University of Puerto Rico focuses on manatee conservation through four actions: rescue and stranding response; rehabilitation and veterinary care; population research; and community outreach. We also tend to sea turtles and marine birds that are found sick, ill, or injured on our island. What we’ll do and where we’ll be:

location.street_address: 500 Hwy., Ave. Dr. John Will Harris

name: Frank Ocean Trips (Parguera Sport Fishing & Boat Tours)
description: At Frank Ocean Trips we offer Bottom Fishing, Tarpon Fishing, and Deep Sea Fishing so that our costumers can pick the kind of fishing they like at this beautiful Caribbean sea side of Puerto Rico. Relax and enjoy the beauty of Parguera's keys!!! Take the sun, swim and share quality time with your party as you drink a cold beverage here at paradise. Join us to admire the beauty of our sunsets in one of our sandbars and when it gets dark we sail to the impressive Biobay. This is a once in a lifetime experience!

name: Pamil Fine Art
description: Pamil Fine Art Gallery, founded in 1994 by Paco González and Mildred Ascar is considered one of the leading contemporary art galleries in Puerto Rico. Dedicated to the promotion of modern and contemporary art, Pamil has become a must visit gallery in our cultural world. Masters and established, as well as emerging artists are regular participants in our well recognized exhibitions and presentations.

name: Biaggi Faure Fine Art
description: Biaggi & Faure Fine Art is a locally owned company that promotes the magic, energy and cultural richness of Puerto Rican modern and contemporary fine art. Founded in 1989 by our co-directors Gail Biaggi and Carlos Faure, Biaggi & Faure Fine Art has built a solid reputation of integrity and honesty driven by one-on-one consulting and outstanding customer service.

name: Walter Otero Contemporary Art
description: The gallery, located in Puerta de Tierra in the Old San Juan Historic District, was designed by the architect Luis Gutiérrez and the engineer Pedro Muñoz Marín. Five thousand square feet (5,000) dedicated to contemporary art will be divided into three floors. The main floor will show the main exhibits, and the ground floor will become the presentation and storage area. The third floor, a magnificent rooftop garden overlooking the San Juan Bay area will host gatherings and outdoor exhibits.

name: Apiarios Caraballo
description: Founded in 1972, Apiarios Caraballo Corp. is a Puerto Rican company dedicated to the production, collection, and marketing of high-quality bee honey. Since 2018 we have been inviting visitors to experience our agrotourism experiences. We currently have two agrotourism experiences: Beekeeping experience: A unique experience where tourists will visit an apiary in which they will have the opportunity to interact directly with beekeeping equipment and a hive (bees) in their surroundings.

name: Go Tarpon P.R. Inc.
description: Go Tarpon Puerto Rico Fishing Charters and Eco Tours is conveniently located at Cangrejos Yacht Club about 5 minutes from the International Airport, home of the most exciting lagoons in Puerto Rico. Get ready for a lifetime experience, a backcountry light-tackle fishing or fly-fishing charter adventure perfect for every member of your family. Our goal is that you and your party enjoy the best time ever! Enjoy Go Tarpon, "our island's perfect getaway."

name: Kiani Tours
description: Vieques, Puerto Rico is an island rich in history, culture, and natural places. From Laguna Kiani, to splendid, pristine beaches, ocean vistas, and the rocky area where Hombre de Puerto Ferro was discovered, there is much to explore. Tours & ServicesTours Beach Hopping Tours Historical & Cultural Tour Isabel II Historical Walking Tour Services Historical, Cultural, Educational and Sightseeing Island Tours

name: Parguera Fishing Charters
description: Deep-Sea Fishing around the Caribbean waters of La Parguera. Enjoy all-inclusive Offshore Fishing for Dorado, Wahoo, Blue Marlin and Tuna aboard MAREJA, a Full Cabin 31 feet Fly Bridge Bertram.

name: Puerto Rico Historic Building Drawings Society (PRHBDS)
description: Appreciate your surroundings on a guided tour with a focus on the architecture and history of the place.

name: Puerto Rico Bio Bay Tours LLC.
description: Puerto Rico Bio Bay Tours LLC.Tours: A. Bio Bay Puerto Rico Kayak Adventure "Day Kayaking" Bio Bay Puerto Rico Kayak Adventure (Day Time Kayaking) - Nature, Mangrove Forests, Historical Lighthouse, Bird Watching and Beach Time! Love Nature? Come and see the only place on the island where seven of eight ecosystems come together within the beautiful Las Cabezas de San Juan Reserve, enjoy birds, iguanas, crabs, mangrove tunnels, views of a historical lighthouse, views of the only tropical rainforest in the U.S. Forestry System El Yunque in the background and leisure time on Seven Seas beach!

name: Casa Pueblo
description: Casa Pueblo is a community-based organization that operates in the central mountains of Puerto Rico, specifically in the town of Adjuntas. The organization's main focus is the sustainable development of the region as well as the community-based management of the protected land that's under their purview, among many other projects.

name: HeliPR
description: Puerto Rico is known as "La Isla del Encanto" and we think the best way to see this enchanted island is from a bird’s-eye view! HeliNY is excited to have launched tour operations in San Juan, Puerto Rico in 2019 as HeliPR with our state-of-the-art Bell 407GX based at the Isla Grande Airport. Using our 30 years of experience, we are excited to offer the highest quality helicopter tour service available in the San Juan area. If you want to see the island’s beautiful mountains, rivers, beaches, the new and old architecture... we can show you all that and more!

location.street_address: Isla Grande Airport, South Ramp Lot 4

name: Clearly Puerto Rico
description: Clearly Puerto Rico offers luxury eco-tours in completely transparent kayaks at a variety of locations in Puerto Rico. Explore beautiful coral reefs and colorful fish swimming below your boat on one of our guided reef tours or paddle under the bright night sky on one of our unique LED stargazing experiences. Activities are suitable for all ages and skill levels (5+) and a memorable activity the whole family can enjoy.

name: Cabezas de San Juan
description: It is located on the northeast tip of the Island and its name arises from the shape of the three rocky headlands that extend to the Atlantic Ocean. Its land was acquired by the Puerto Rico Conservation Trust in 1975 and was designated as a Nature Reserve in 1986.

name: Hacienda La Esperanza
description: This Natural Reserve was one of the most advanced and rich sugar estates of the 19th century and today it is the largest nature reserve in the northwest region of Puerto Rico. With an extension of 2,201 acres, this includes much of the topographic features and characteristic ecosystems of the northern area, including chains of "mogotes" that support an evergreen forest with springs; herbaceous, palustrine (freshwater) and estuarine wetlands; forests and vegetation of coastal dunes; sandy beaches and rocky coastline; and the mouth of the Río Grande de Manatí, among others.

name: Hacienda Buena Vista
description: Hacienda Buena Vista is a natural protected area that includes one of the most important coffee and minor fruit estates. During the time that it functioned as a hacienda, Buena Vista served as the setting for a unique relationship between land, water, and slavery. Today, the heart of what was the hacienda contains a carefully restored historic site with structures that are more than a century old and a unique hydraulic turbine.

name: Cañón de San Cristóbal
description: Natural Protected Area Cañón de San Cristóbal is a topographic formation consisting of cliffs that form depressions and deep valleys, as a result of the erosion of rocks by the passage of the waters of the Usabón River. Due to the continuous failure, erosion, dissolution, and detachment of rocks, puddles and waterfalls have also formed that run through the Protected Natural Area. The composition of this topographic and geological phenomenon is a mostly sedimentary and igneous rock, belonging to the Late Cretaceous.

name: Medio Mundo y Daguao
description: Medio Mundo y Daguao is the most extensive Natural Protected Area under Para la Naturaleza management and contains the second largest mangrove forest in all the islands of Puerto Rico. Together with the terrestrial, coastal, transitional, estuarine and aquatic ecosystems found in this area, they provide habitats for some 26 species of rare, endemic, vulnerable and endangered species. Among those that have been documented, are the West Indian Manatee, the Yellow-shouldered Blackbird, the Puerto Rican Boa, and several species of sea turtles that depend on the area’s ecosystems.

name: Frozen G Spot La Parguera
description: We are a bar dedicated to the sale of Frozen Drinks, including the famous Sangria, Mojito, Margarita, Passoã Frozen and Piña Colada. Also Promotional items, hats, shirts.

name: El Viequense Sea Tours
description: El Viequense Sea Tours is owned and operated by Capt. Luis A. Meléndez. Book your bio bay tour with El Viequense, for an amazing experience at Vieques's bioluminescent bay.

name: Esperanza Riding Company
description: Esperanza Riding Company will take you on a scenic trail ride on ridgelines that offer unparalleled views of the island, down into arroyos that lead to beaches only accessed by foot, and along the cliff edge of our waterfront pasture. There is no better way to explore the island than on the backs of our smooth-gaited local Paso Fino related horses. Our experienced guides are happy to share their knowledge of the local flora and fauna and history of the island. Join us for one of our group (up to 10-12 people) or private rides that we offer at 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM daily.

name: D' galeria
description: D'galería is the only full-scale Contemporary Art Gallery in Fajardo, and the eastern region of Puerto Rico, created by Puerto Rican fine artist Jaime Díaz. The gallery showcases his work rooted in the unique style that makes Jaime one of the only artists on the island to master painting, muralism, sculptures and digital design. He also shares his creative space with emerging and established artists to bring culture and diverse artistic view points to those who appreciate fine art.

name: Hook'd on Adventure Parguera
description: Explore La Parguera - Swim the Bio Bay - Snorkel the Reefs We are a family owned business, focused on providing small private boat tours and charters. Join us on our Sunset and Bio Bay tour of La Parguera, or come explore the area during the day. This small town has a lot to offer, from snorkeling, mangrove channels and crystal blue waters. Contact us or book through our website to enjoy this adventure! Our captains and vessels are approved and certified by the US Coast Guard. Get Hook’d on Adventure!

name: Mini Boat Adventures
description: Ride your own Mini Speed Boat! Follow our convoy through a string of secluded islands. First stop: Icacos Puerto Rico!* On the route, enjoy white sand beaches and enjoy guided snorkeling along the best coral reefs of La Cordillera Nature Reserve. Plus, your Mini Boat comes packed with snorkeling gear, snacks and refreshments. Arguably, snorkeling in Puerto Rico has never been more radical! No boating license needed! This is a fully-guided excursion. Just choose the number of friends that will ride with you!

name: KERC's Experiences
description: KERC Experiences is a boutique Tour operator company on a mission to "Experience the Culture and learn from direct experiences." As expert hosts and international travelers with a commitment to share our experiences to promotes cultural exchange & sustainable leadership, base on ethical, moral and Christian values. We created personalized experiences to satisfy intellectual curiosity, expand the historical and cultural knowledge of our guests. Our international team has over 15 years of experience combine in:

name: The Art Walk Puerto Rico
description: Did you know San Juan was selected among the 12 cities to watch in contemporary art worldwide? DISCOVER AND EMERGE YOURSELF IN PUERTO RICO’S VIBRANT ART SCENE! Theartwalkpr, is an independent creative cultural platform designed to promote Puerto Rico's vibrant art scene through curated experiences and art walks tours. Our mission is to encourage a spirit of appreciation, collecting, and philanthropy in support of Puerto Rican artists in local residents, visitors and international settings.

name: Playuelas Horse Rides
description: Playuelas Horse Rides is an equestrian center focused on family and active eco-tourism. We offer a rewarding horseriding experience, taking visitors on a guided tour through beautiful landscapes and lush meadows. The tour will begin at Playuelas' Horse Rides facilities, then we'll ride next to magnificent ocean views and across the luscious Playuela valley. During this extraordinary adventure, you'll see spectacular views of the following landmarks and landscapes: Playa Peña Blanca Poza de Pache El Mix Wilderness Las Ruinas

name: Van Life P.R. "Happy Family Surf"
description: During the aftermath of Hurricane María, we decided to stay home in Puerto Rico, face adversity and start and develop a local brand. A few of our friends and families decided to leave seeking a better future, but we wanted to raise our kids here and enjoy the beauty of our nature in our 1973 Westfalia Weekender. It has been more than a decade of family history and adventures in this bus and now we want to share them with you! The Van Life PR project is in honor of everyone who loves to be on the road. Enjoying beaches that

name: YogAsana Yoga Studio
description: Yogasana is a space that promotes physical and emotional well-being through yoga and meditation. We also offer Reiki, Aroma Therapy, private classes, and workshops. We are located in Cabo Rojo, the island's "zen spot," and where you'll find the best beaches.

name: El Poblado de Boquerón
description: El Poblado de Boquerón is located in one of the island's most popular weekend destinations for locals, Cabo Rojo. Spend the day exploring Cabo Rojo's postcard beaches, and then in the evening head to El Poblado. Part fishing village and part promenade, the Poblado area is lined with restaurants, bars, and local stores.

name: Puente de Piedra
description: You'll find this picture-perfect natural stone bridge in the island's extreme southwest in a town called Cabo Rojo. The path to reach the stone arch starts at the Los Morrillos Lighthouse, and it's a preferred trail for bicycling enthusiasts.

name: Steps beach
description: Steps beach is located on the Island's west coast in Rincón, a town known as Puerto Rico's surfing center. During the winter surf season, surfers flock to Steps to catch some of the town's best waves. Once the waves die down, Steps transforms into a quiet swimming beach and a great snorkeling spot.

name: Tres Palmas Marine Reserve
description: The Tres Palmas Marine Reserve was established to protect the area's marine biodiversity, including the unique elkhorn coral. This marine reserve includes the popular surfing and snorkeling spot known as Steps beach.

name: Calle Cerra
description: This legendary street in Santurce once housed some of salsa's most important record labels and offices, including the famous Fania Records. After the labels and offices closed, the street was neglected, and it wasn't rehabilitated until the last few years when a handful of local entrepreneurs brought the street back to life with new restaurants, bars, and murals. Once a year, the street celebrates the Santurce es Ley Festival, where local and international muralists are invited to use the street as their blank canvas.

name: Paseo Lineal Costero de Isabela
description: Spanning over 4 miles, this boardwalk makes for the perfect outdoor experience in Isabela. Whether you prefer to bike, walk, or run, you'll love the ocean views that will accompany you along the route. If you're interested in renting a bike to enjoy the Paseo Lineal, you can stop by Pedalea, a bike rental company in Isabela. Directly across from Middles beach, you can also rent a scooter from RIDE PR.

name: Parque de las Palomas
description: Found right next to the historical Capilla del Cristo in Old San Juan, this park's name translates to "Pigeon Park" and it is called this way thanks to the many pigeons that call it home. The park is especially beloved by children who enjoy feeding the pigeons with the dried corn that's sold by street vendors. The Parque de las Palomas also offers mesmerizing views of the Bay of San Juan, making a great pit stop while exploring Old San Juan.

name: Bahía de San Juan
description: For centuries San Juan's Bay has served as one of Puerto Rico's main entry points for goods, people, and the exchange of ideas that comes from travel. Used as the main port during the Spanish colonial times, the bay is protected by the imposing Castillo San Felipe del Morro, a fort that to this day continues to welcome cruises and merchant boats to the Island of Enchantment. Some of the best views of the bay are found next to the romantic Paseo de la Princesa, a promenade that runs along the outside walls of Old San Juan.

name: Campo Rico Trail Rides
description: ATV Tour: Take the Ride of a lifetime on an ATV in Puerto Rico!

name: Plaza-Mirador Represa El Salto
description: At this viewpoint, you'll find amazing views of two of the oldest dams in Puerto Rico. Known as El Salto I and El Salto II, the dams were built in the early 1900s to provide hydroelectric energy to parts of the island. While the dams are no longer operating, the cascading waterfall effect they produce is still quite impressive and worth a visit.

name: Cruz del Monte Limón (Cruz de Lazos)
description: Measuring 33 feet high, the Cruz de Lazos was built in 1960 atop one of the highest peaks in Comerío. Each year during Lent, the Catholic church organizes a pilgrimage from the center of town to the Cruz de Lazos.

name: Cañón Las Bocas
description: This canyon is part of the Las Bocas Reserve, and it is located between the towns of Barranquitas and Comerío. To visit the area, we recommend scheduling a visit through the local Sierra Club chapter or a local tour provider.

name: Cuevas de la Mora
description: This cave system is located in the central mountain region of Puerto Rico, specifically in the town of Comerío. In the interior of the caves, you'll find a number of indigenous petroglyphs dating back to the Taíno indigenous people. To visit the Cuevas de Mora, we recommend coordinating a visit with a local tour provider.

name: Media Luna Recreational Area
description: The Media Luna recreational area is one of Comerío's main tourist attractions. In the area, visitors will find playgrounds, water play areas, basketball courts, and more.

name: La Parguera
description: La Parguera is an idyllic seaside destination found in Puerto Rico's southwestern region. In the town's main square, you will find a lively atmosphere filled with food kiosks, live music, and beautiful views of the Caribbean Sea. Unlike the rest of the seaside destinations found around the island, La Parguera doesn't have any beaches, but instead, it is surrounded by pristine cays. You can reach the cays by renting your very own small boat or arranging transportation with any of the local tour providers.

name: Ceiba Ferry Terminal
description: Ceiba's ferry terminal is located on the premises of the former Roosevelet Roads Naval Station on the east coast of the island. From this ferry terminal, visitors can catch a ferry to the nearby island municipalities of Vieques and Culebra. The terminal has a daily ferry schedule with multiple ferries visiting the islands every day. During the summer months, the terminal can be extremely busy, and purchasing tickets in advance is extremely recommended.

name: Paseo del Morro
description: Paseo del Morro is a boardwalk that borders the outer edge of Old San Juan's imposing Castillo San Felipe del Morro. One one side, you'll be flanked by the fort's massive outer walls and on the other side, you'll walk next to the Bay of San Juan. Once you reach the famous Gate of San Juan, a giant doorway that gives access to the inside of the city walls, the Paseo del Morro becomes one with the Paseo de la Princesa.

name: Playa Caracas
description: Playa Caracas, also known as Red Beach, is found at the Vieques National Wildlife Refuge. With golden sand and the turquoise water, visitors will agree that Caracas is the embodiment of a poscard-ready beach. While there are no restrooms on the grounds of the beach, there are a few small gazebos and on-site parking.

name: La Vergüenza Puertorrican Chinchorro
description: La Vergüenza Puertorrican Chinchorro is an ocean-view rooftop bar and restaurant with some of the best views of La Perla neighborhood and the Atlantic Ocean. The restaurant specializes in Puerto Rican and Caribbean cuisine, but it's also a great spot to just grab a local beer, sit back, and enjoy the views.

name: Piso Viejo
description: This bar is located in one of San Juan's hottest nightlife areas, Calle Loíza. Check out their social media pages for information on their live music nights, free salsa classes, and special happy hours.

name: Hacienda Mi Remanso
description: Hacienda Mi Remanso is an old tobacco hacienda with 50 acres of land located in the town of Caguas. The hacienda has a restaurant, bar, camping area, guest house, hostal, and an event space. Visitors of the hacienda can enjoy the outdoors by exploring the area's natural swimming pools, waterfalls, rivers, hiking paths, or by going fishing in the lake.

name: LocalTours
description: LocalTours puts travelers in touch with independent guides and tour operators around the world, offering you a curated selection of the best experiences.

name: TPC Dorado Beach
description: Located at the luxurious Dorado Beach Resort in Dorado, Puerto Rico, TPC Dorado Beach is home to two world-class Caribbean golf courses: the East Course and Sugarcane Course. In 1955, renowned golf architect Robert Trent Jones, Sr. was called on by Laurence S. Rockefeller to create the finest golf resort in Puerto Rico and the Caribbean, Dorado Beach Resort & Club. Originally home to four exceptional layouts, these famed courses have played host to PGA TOUR tournaments, celebrities, world leaders, and iconic players.

name: Janise Sailing Charters
description: Come aboard a unique sailing experience with Puerto Rico Sailing Trips (formerly known as EcoSailing). Choose between our amazing Janise Sailing Day Charter or our Janise Sailing Afternoon Charter. Discover pure serenity on our relaxing sailing voyage off the coast of Fajardo with its pristine waters and secluded islands. Our professional and friendly crew offers the ultimate onboard experience. Our charters are designed to let you relax and recharge. Everyone in our first-class team will make sure this will be the highlight of your vacation in Puerto Rico!

name: Caribbean Trading Company, Inc. - Rincón
description: Caribbean Trading Rincon is located just off the town plaza in downtown Rincón on the West coast of Puerto Rico. The focus is on authentic art, Rincon souvenirs, Caribbean treasures, and beach gear.

name: Artisan Directory of Puerto Rico
description: Now there is a place online to find that Puerto Rican craft you’re looking for! DirectorioArtesanal.com is an online directory of over 200 Puerto Rican artisans. The directory will help you find the perfect "artesania" (crafts). Then, from the directory, you can contact the artisan directly to make the purchase. Even find typical food and drinks, as if you were at a local craft fair!

name: Puerto Rico Art Gallery
description: We are a group of local artists (photographers and painters) working together to show the best of our beautiful Island and its warm people. Beaches, mangroves, birds, historical buildings, local customs, country views, flowers, our heritage, and our people enjoying life in this amazing paradise we call home. Our self-fulfillment system will allow you to select, print, and frame your favorite photo or painting instantly. Our art pieces are delivered directly to you by mail for your convenience and prompt enjoyment. Some of our art pieces can be purchased as originals.

name: Rutrex Puerto Rico
description: We are a full-service tour operator focused on experiential tourism: we believe that travel can help one grow and live fully through experiencing local culture. The guests we host, be it a family or a group, return home feeling a little bit Puerto Rican in their own right, brimming with rich memories of music, dance, street art, authentic food, and deep human connections that touch your heart.

name: Joya de Santana
description: Joya de Santana is an indigenous cemetery located in the town of Utuado.

name: Puerto Rico Rum Journey
description: Puerto Rico Rum Journey provides travelers a seamless way to book Rum tours, experiences, events, and merchandise. Our mantra is to spread the love of our island’s rum history and ways that you can enjoy rum.

name: Fusion Floral ART & Gifts
description: We are a full-service flower shop and gift gallery, specializing in destination weddings islandwide! In business since 2004, local art & flowers are our passion as is bringing joy to everyday and special occasions. In addition to flowers, here in our shop, you will find handcrafted works of more than a dozen local craftspeople, including bohemian jewelry, gourmet specialties, surf art & functional gift items made from coconuts, gourds, bamboo & sea glass.

name: E Bike and Kayak
description: Located in the heart of San Juan, Puerto Rico, we offer award-winning tours, both on land and sea! Our guided electric bike tours from Condado to Old San Juan (day or night) have many saying “this was the best way to explore the city” and “we can’t wait to go again!” Our unique night kayak/city lights tour has folks raving: “best adventure we did while on vacation — a MUST DO” and “the glow paint and photos were a nice touch, so cool!” Needless to say, an amazing urban adventure awaits… Allow our A-team of guides to lead the way, #letsGLOW!

name: Casa Del Trovador Luis Miranda “Pico de Oro”
description: This museum preserves and promotes the essence of one of Puerto Rico's most important musical genres, "trova." Sung by "trovadores" this musical genre is known as the music of the Puerto Rican "jíbaro" (peasant). Entrance to the museum is free of charge and guided tours are available.

name: Casita Verde Abelardo Díaz Alfaro
description: La Casita Verde is a cultural project that honors the illustrious Puerto Rican writer Abelardo Díaz Alfaro. It has a set of memorabilia, informative graphics, and a documentary of the storyteller to showcase his life and inform visitors of his legacy as a native Cagüeño writer, representative of the Criollísimo. The place also functions as a literary center that offers conferences and workshops on literary creations.

name: Centro Criollo de Ciencia y Tecnología del Caribe (C3TEC)
description: El Centro Criollo de Ciencia y Tecnología del Caribe (C3Tec) is a science-focused museum, where small and large interactive spaces provide visitors with an exciting experience. No matter their age, everyone can actively enjoy the exhibitions, innovative programs, and events designed to allow visitors to learn about science in an interactive way. C3Tec is dedicated to providing unforgettable experiences focused on science and technology.

name: Pa' Cuba 1954
description: A journey through time that will take you to Cuba in 1954. During your visit, you'll enjoy Cuba's gastronomy, live music, and festive atmosphere.

name: iTour Puerto Rico
description: For Fun Things to do in Puerto Rico, check out the Island’s Top Sightseeing & Best Adventure Tours! You may choose from: A Catamaran Sailing and Snorkeling Excursion to uninhabited Islands, a Kayaking Tour in a Bioluminescent Lagoon, or Piloting & Island Hopping in your own Mini Boat. Or try Learning to Surf, go Hiking, Climbing and Rappelling down Waterfalls in a Rainforest or experience the longest, highest, fastest Zipline in the western hemisphere; the Top Adventure Tours, Best Sightseeing Tours and Day Trips in Puerto Rico are all right here!

name: Birth of the New World Statue
description: Birth of the New World is a 350 -foot statue depicting Cristopher Columbus and it's located in the town of Arecibo. The statue is the work of Georgian-Russian painter Zurab Tsereteli. While the statue is not open to the public yet, visitors can admire it from afar. The road where the statue is found is lined with restaurants and food kiosks, so plan to grab a delicious bite nearby. Make a day out of your trip to Arecibo, and visit some of the town's other noteworthy attractions like the Parque Nacional de las Cavernas del Río Camuy or the area's breathtaking beaches.

name: Sandra Farms
description: Our company's philosophy follows traditional methods of growing and roasting coffee while applying more ecology-friendly ways. We use less water and energy, zero fossil fuel, and recycle biomass and compost. We roast your coffee upon receipt of your order to ensure freshness; then we notify you of the shipping date. When you are enjoying our coffee, we are certain you can taste the care that went into every precious bean.

name: Iglesia Católica San Antonio de Padua
description: Originally built from 1818 to 1824, Isabela's first church was destroyed by an earthquake in 1918. Following the earthquake, the church was rebuilt and the structure that stands today dates back to 1922.

name: Plaza Pública Manuel Corchado y Juarbe
description: Isabela's main town square dates back to the birth of the town in 1818. The land for the plaza was bought through funds collected amongst the residents of the town at the time, and once it was built it was lined with beautiful trees. The plazas original name, Plaza de la Concordia, was changed in 1900 by the Municipal Council to its current name, Plaza Pública Manuel Corchado y Juarbe.

name: Casa Alcaldía de Isabela
description: The construction process for Isabela's historical town hall started in 1922 and by 1923 the town was inaugurating its new "alcaldía." Since that year, this landmark has housed the town's administrative offices, and in the past, it also housed a jail and the telegraph offices.

name: Café Ama
description: We are a social impact arabica coffee brand, ethically grown in Puerto Rico. Founded by Ama, our 10-year-old entrepreneur. All proceeds from Café Ama support Friends of Puerto Rico SEEDS Youth Entrepreneurship Program. SEEDS allows children from Puerto Rico to practice their soft and technical skills by running their very own coffee business and 100% of the proceeds stay local, so you can feel good about helping the Island's community with every bag of coffee you order.

name: Parroquia San Francisco de Asís
description: One of Aguada's most treasured landmarks is its historical church, Parroquia San Francisco de Asís, which is located in the town's main square. The structure that stands today, was finalized in 1936 after the original structure was destroyed in the earthquake of 1918. The church's style is neogothic and it boasts the Island's tallest twin towers in a church. The church stained glass windows were imported from Spain in 1959 and its bells are from Germany.

name: Parroquia Santuario Protomártires de la Inmaculada Concepción (Ermita de Espinar)
description: The Ermita de Espinar was originally founded between 1516 and 1523 by Catholic friars coming from Santo Domingo with the purpose of converting local indigenous populations. The temple was an important location for the Franciscan order until it was abandoned in 1867. In the mid 20th century renewed interest in the ruins led to its reconstruction, and the process was finished in 1971. The Parroquia Santuario Protomártires de la Inmaculada Concepción is the only church on the Island whose original ruins are conserved in the interior of a modern temple that replicates the original.

name: Plaza Cristóbal Colón y Estatua al 5to Centenario
description: Dating back to Aguada's founding year in 1648, throughout the centuries Aguada's plaza has undergone multiple changes and renovations. The last phase of renovations was finalized in 2005, giving the plaza its current look. In the center of the plaza, you'll find a statue of Christopher Columbus, which was installed in 1993 to commemorate the 500th anniversary of Puerto Rico's discovery.

name: Ruinas de la Central Coloso
description: Starting in the mid 19th century, La Central Coloso was the economic engine of not just Aguada but of the entire northwest coast, and this continued until its closing in 2003. During the 20th century, La Centra Coloso produced more than four thousand tons of sugar per year.

name: Centro de Bellas Artes Aguada
description: Aguada's Fine Arts Center was inaugurated in the year 2000, and since then the center has hosted many plays and musicals. The theater was damaged by Hurricane Maria, and the town is currently working hard in its reopening but meanwhile, it serves as a venue for plastic arts expositions.

name: Antigua Estación del Tren
description: Aguada's train station was founded in 1885 and it was an essential part of a train system that connected all of the Island's western municipalities with the capital, San Juan. With the development of an interstate road system, the need for a train become obsolete, and the last train to depart from this station was in 1950.

name: La Pirámide de Aguada
description: Commissioned by Nelson Ruiz, this pyramid was constructed in 2009 by the architect Emiliano Matos and it honors America's pre-Columbian civilizations.

name: Parque Infantil Luis Muñoz Muñiz
description: This beautiful children's playground is often called Aguada's lung, and it's only minutes from the town's historic center. The park sits right across from the town's athletic complex.

name: Playa Punta Boquerón (Playa de los Cañones)
description: Also known as Playa de los Cañones, in this coastal area it's possible to find petroglyphs from Puerto Rico's pre-Columbian inhabitants, the Taínos.

name: Playa Carrizales
description: After passing Playa los Cañones, you'll find this beautiful and pristine beach, which ends in the river mouth for rio Culebrinas.

name: Playa Mameyito (Puerto de los Pozos)
description: This beach is located in what used to be the town's port. Nowadays, the area is brimming with coastal restaurants and you'll also find the Cruz de Colón, which commemorates the arrival of Christopher Columbus in 1493.

name: Playa Positas
description: This beautiful beach is located in the Guayabos neighborhood of Aguada. This beach is known for its rocky shore, which during the high and low tides forms natural pools in the area. Visitors will find diverse marine life and a vibrant ecosystem.

name: Playa Punta Rio Grande
description: This beach makes the perfect spot for watching the sunset as it is very tranquil and peaceful. You'll find this beach in the border with the town of Rincón.

name: Hacienda Jeanmarie Chocolat
description: Founded in 2009, Jeanmarie is the Island's first registered cacao hacienda. In this hacienda, you'll enjoy a unique experience where you'll be able to see the cacao plantation, learn about the chocolate elaboration process, and enjoy the outdoors.

name: Proyecto Uvas de Puerto Rico
description: Unique in Puerto Rico, this project allows visitors to learn about the cultivation process for grapes. You'll learn about the different types of grapes, how they're grown on the Island, and you'll also learn about other exotic fruits grown in Puerto Rico.

name: Finca y Productos El ñamero.
description: A unique experience, on the Island's west coast the tour through Finca y Productos El ñamero dives deep into the cultivation process for "ñame", a type of yam that is widely consumed on the Island. Visitors will also learn about the zone's agricultural history. The farm also sells fresh products grown on Puerto Rico's west zone.

name: Río Camuy Cave Park
description: The Río Camuy Cave Park is located in Puerto Rico's northwestern region, and it covers three towns: Camuy, Hatillo, and Lares. You'll find the main entrance to the park in the Quebrada area of Camuy.

name: WCK’s Volunteer and Agritourism Program
description: The Food Producer Network is World Central Kitchen’s long-term commitment to building resilient local food systems and strengthening food security throughout the Caribbean and Central America.

name: San Juan Bay Marina
description: The most complete marina in all of San Juan. For over 60 year we have strive to keep providing the best service and facilities. The only marina with haul facilities for yachts up to 65 feets and only dry stack facility in all the metropolitan area.

name: Pintos "R" Us Trail Rides
description: Pintos “R” Us offers guided tours along spectacular, world-renowned surfing beaches, past Rincon’s lighthouse and whale watching park, through lush tropical trails that twist, turn, and descend onto cliffs overlooking the historic Spanish Wall and beautiful turquoise ocean vistas. We are open 7 days a week for morning and sunset rides. During the summer, we only offer morning rides.

name: Primera Iglesia Metodista Unida de Ponce
description: The First Methodist Church was the first structure built in Puerto Rico by the famous architect Antonin Nechodom in 1907. The structure was listed in the US National Register of Historic Places on October 29, 1987.

name: Iglesia Santa María Reina
description: This historic church was finished in the late 1950s and it is the only church on the Island with a vaulted ceiling. The church offers weekly mass service and they have ample parking available. The church is also wheelchair-friendly.

name: Parroquia La Milagrosa
description: This small Catholic church in Ponce offers weekly mass services.

name: Parroquia La Resurreción
description: One of the multiple small Catholic churches found in the town of Ponce.

name: Primera Iglesia Bautista
description: On November 19, 1899, Ponce inaugurated its first baptist church. Today, mass is still offered at this historic church.

name: DISTRITO T-Mobile
description: We’re Puerto Rico’s ultimate venue for fun and entertainment. And because we believe fun shouldn’t be a once in a while thing, we’ve brought together Puerto Rico's spirit, flavors, and good vibes with innovative experiences to surprise visitors every time.

name: Caribbean Cinemas VIP at DISTRITO T-Mobile
description: Caribbean Cinemas VIP at DISTRITO T-Mobile will give you the best viewing experience you have ever had. The VIP Theaters have laser projectors and a complete surround sound package providing an intense experience.

name: Coca-Cola Music Hall
description: Coca-Cola Music Hall, an ASM Global managed facility, is a state-of-the-art venue opening in San Juan Puerto Rico in 2021 that will change the face of the music and entertainment industry on the Island. The new, three-level venue will satisfy the need that many producers face in hosting events in a space that is comfortable, intimate, and rider-proof.

name: Xperience Puerto Rico
description: We understand that it can sometimes be difficult to find and get to the best things to do in Puerto Rico, especially outside of San Juan, so we created XPR. We have searched out all the island's secrets to provide you with the very best Xperiences Puerto Rico has to offer. We provide single-day Xperience tours that connect you with the best-kept secrets of Puerto Rico. One of our local island guides will pick you up from your home in one of our XPR vehicles and take you on a day-long adventure you will remember for the rest of your lives.

location.street_address: Maralto Ocean Front Apts, Cll La Estacion

name: Río Espíritu Santo
description: The Río Espíritu Santo in Río Grande starts high up in the mountains of El Yunque Rainforest. If you include Río Espíritu Santo in your itinerary, you can enjoy a leisurely boat ride along the river bend or you can choose to go chasing waterfalls.

name: La Charca Aqua
description: This natural pool is the perfect spot for a river swim. La Charca Agua is located Ponce, where you'll also find plenty of other unique spots.

name: Playa Punta Borinquen
description: This remote beach is the definition of a perfect Caribbean locale. Found in Aguadilla, this remote spot is ideal for relaxing under the sun, catching some waves, or simply stopping by for the perfect photo backdrop.

name: Bosque de Pinos - Jayuya
