description: Enjoy a peaceful day exploring the quiet trails outside of the Toro Negro State Forest. Hiking through this location will give you a chance to enjoy the Island's unspoiled natural environment.

name: La Barrita Del Lado
description: Savor artisanal cocktails and delicious tapas at La Barrita Del Lado where it’s always “Happy Hour”, or as we like to call it #DelLadoHour. This outdoor bar welcomes you to enjoy some drinks along with friends while you listen to live music and view performances happening at La Plaza Central. Try out the frozen Pasión de la Barrita perfect to cool down from the heat or the Mambo Colada for those who are whiskey aficionados. There is a cocktail for everyone! You’ll find La Barrita Del Lado across from Barullo Taberna Española in DISTRITO T-Mobile.

name: Montadero Chocolate
description: "Bean to Bar" chocolatier that uses 100% Puerto Rican cacao. Visit us to see the process of making your favorite sweet, chocolate. At Montadero, we offer tastings, workshops, and plenty of mouthwatering treats.

name: Soul Women's Spa
description: SOUL WOMEN’S SPA & Maternity Wellness Center was born in response to the recognized need to provide women a place to achieve well-being and happiness under direct medical supervision and trained staff. Care, comfort, and convenience of medical services, relaxation treatments, and fitness offerings all under one roof. It’s one-stop to include on your personal calendar for a total immersion experience and your first step towards living a healthy lifestyle!

location.street_address: Clínica Las Américas Suite 108, 400 Ave. F.D. Roosevelt

name: San Juan Artisan Distillers LLC
description: San Juan Artisan Distillers is the only distillery in Puerto Rico that makes a rum based on sugarcane juice: we grind our cane, ferment, and distill, creating the first and only Estate Distilled rum made 100% from farm to bottle on the same property. Visit our artisanal distillery in Vega Alta to enjoy a unique agritourism experience. We make premium rums of the highest quality and during the tour you will get to see firsthand how Puerto Rican rum is produced.

name: Corporacion Piñones Se Integra (COPI)
description: COPI is a non-profit organization in the town of Loíza, that provides cultural and ecotourism activities for visitors. Their services include kayaking and bike rental, and some Saturdays, they also provide bomba dancing lessons.

name: Tabaco y Puros by Juana Díaz Cigars - Ponce
description: The Best Premiums Cigars of the World in the South of Puerto Rico. Una tienda donde encontrarás los mejores Cigarros y Puros del Mundo. Las Mejores y mas reconocidas marcas de cigarros tales como: Falto Cigars, Arturo Fuentes, Romeo y Julieta, Santa Ana, H.Upmann, Montecristo, Y mas.....

name: Patria Tours
description: On this experience you will explore the Old San Juan at the best time of the day. During sunset the sunlight highlights the beautiful historic architecture of the old town and the ocean breeze makes the walk pleasurable. Along the way you will learn about the town's historic events and Puerto Rico’s culture from a local’s perspective. By the end of the tour you can stay by El Morro Fort to welcome the night or walk into the old town to enjoy its restaurants and bars.

name: Siete Chorros
description: Called Siete Chorros for the seven small waterfalls that come together to form a natural pool, this spot is a must when in San Lorenzo. To find it, stop by the Colmado Bar Gonzalez and ask for directions to Siete Chorros, they'll direct you to the steps located behind their bar.

name: Convento de las Siervas de María
description: Just a few steps away from La Fortaleza, you’ll find the Convent of the Servants of Mary. Located in one of the most beautiful spots in the city (atop a cliff, with a matchless view of the bay), this convent also houses a “Casa de Salud”, where ailing women are restored to health by the nuns.

name: Arena Medalla
description: A Taste Of Victory It's always game night at this two-level, 12,500 square feet ultimate sports restaurant combining our passion for sports, beer, and amazing food all in one roof. Bienvenidos to La Casa del Triunfo Boricua, a celebration of Puerto Rico’s sports’ heritage past, present and future! Immerse yourself in action and watch your favorite teams play their A-game in the latest 30-ft panoramic, multi-view LED screen technology where you can enjoy a game or two from every corner; you are guaranteed never to miss a home run, knock out, or grand slam!

name: CL Tours
description: Historical, religious, cultural, sports, cinematographic and musical tourism excursions.

name: Hacienda Iluminada
description: Walk through our beautiful mountains & explore our coffee plantation while learning all about the process of Growing, Processing, and Roasting Single Origin Specialty Puerto Rican Coffee. Tours begin at 11 am and last approximately 5 hours

name: Meyer Nurseries
description: In 1998, the farm was bought by husband-wife team Chip and Dianne Meyer. Along with their two daughters, the couple packed their bags and settled in the small mountain town of Aibonito. Just within a couple of months, Hurricane Georges leveled approximately 75% of the greenhouses. Although the damage was severe, the family picked themselves up and began to rebuild.

location.street_address: Meyer Nurseries and Floral Farms Bo. Pasto Carr. 718 km 2.5

name: Hacienda Cascada
description: A breath of fresh Puerto Rican air. Agriculture, horses and activity rooms so that with your loved ones you can spend a pleasant time, enjoy and learn about agriculture on your Island.

name: Finca Neo Jibairo
description: Finca Neo Jibairo is an agroecological farm dedicated to the cultivation of fruits, vegetables, and specialty tobacco farming in Puerto Rico. Moreover, it is the first farm in Río Grande to be certified as an Agrotourism Farm (2020) by the Puerto Rico Tourism Company and endorsed by Made in Puerto Rico (2023). In addition to the cultivation areas, Finca Neo Jibairo offers various agrotourism experiences that you can book.

name: Viva la Cosecha
description: Experience that includes a tour of an agricultural farm, caves and physical-emotional well-being activities.

name: Hacienda Verde Tahití
description: This is a beautiful 25 acres farm growing pitahaya and ornamental plants, with four (4) unique accommodations; two (2) beautiful rustic cottage and two (2) glamping, all four (4) in the heart of the Pitahaya growing farm. The property has no light contamination around perfect for watching the most amazing starry sky. Enjoy gorgeous sunny days to walk around the tree tunnel trails around the pitahayas (dragon fruits), palm, and hayfield. Delight yourself with the ornamental plants around the open nursery. We offer an educational pitahaya tour with previous reservations required.

name: Plaza Felisa Rincón De Gautier
description: La plaza Felisa Rincón de Gautier está situada frente al Hotel El Convento y la Catedral en el Viejo San Juan, en la Calle del Cristo. Fue construida en honor a Felisa Rincón de Gautier, primera mujer alcaldesa electa en el año 1946.

name: MBTION VIP
description: MBTION is a boutique private experience operator that proudly offers a variety of tours designed and curated, thinking outside the box and aiming to take travelers to the very best places Puerto Rico has to offer and with the personal customer service discerning travelers want and deserve. We avoid at all costs mainstream, rundown and generic places regular operators offer and sell because they are cheaper, closer, or what everybody does. In that regard, we are true innovators.

name: Coquí Bayú
description: Coqui Bayú and Café Latino products provide visitors to Puerto Rico a way to take a piece of paradise with them and the diaspora a way to take a piece of home with them. Coqui Bayú and Café Latino brands are rooted in Puerto Rican customs and traditions that are conveyed in an amusing/entertaining and wholesome fashion/manner, appealing to children and adults alike. We source and/or manufacture all of our products locally. We collaborate with a number of local confectioners of coffee, chocolate, and honey.

location.street_address: Plaza de Recreo Antonio R. Barceló

name: Fundación Cortés
description: Sala Colectiva: Ignacio Cortés Del Valle –To display part of the artistic, cultural and entrepreneurial contributions of the Cortés Family and Cortés Hermanos, Inc. that span over 90 years, Professor Adlín Ríos-Rigau curated an exhibit titled "Familia Cortés: Art, Culture and Entrepreneurship” which showcases artworks in various media from family members of all five generations. This exhibit offers a well-deserved tribute to the ancestors and family legacy and highlights the significant contributions to the arts and culture of Puerto Rico and Dominican Republic.

name: Culebra Local Brands Gift Shop LLC
description: Culebra Local Brands Gift Shop is a beautifully crafted store that features products that are not only made in Puerto Rico, but mostly made by Culebra artisans and crafters. The store's owner would travel daily to Culebra from the big Island, and her desire to provide a space to showcase crafts, fashion, and other products made on the Island lead her to open this shop.

name: Aqua Experiences
description: Aqua Fitness offers the best water experiences in San Juan. Besides the rentals of the best kayaking, paddle boarding, and pedal boarding equipment in the Condado Lagoon, Aqua Fitness coordinates special activities in floating platforms for romantic couples, groups of friends, or just anyone that loves the water and fun. In addition, kayaking excursions are offered every weekend for those who want to experience the beautiful views of the lagoon at night while learning from the area's history, fauna, and folklore.

name: Báilalo PR
description: For fun-loving visitors, Báilalo PR becomes the first and only company that offers walking tours of the city with Silent System headphones guided by dancing instructors and tour guides to make the experience of getting to know the city, fun and exciting. Báilalo PR is also an excellent event for groups who want to celebrate special events such as birthdays, bachelorettes, graduations, and any other special occasions, guided by professionals that know how to bring the best smiles in everyone.

name: Juana Díaz Cigars
description: "Cigar Boutique, Cigar Bar, Cigar Lounge. We smoke cigars every Tuesday, in front of our Square Place from 5pm thru Midnight. We have a variety of Handmade Internationals Premiums Cigars and Accesories. Come and visit us! Do your best pairing with the best Whiskeys, Rums, wines and Draft Beers. Locally and Internationally."

name: Tours2 Puerto Rico
description: Tours2 Puerto Rico is an independent local tour company. Our goals is to make your visit to Puerto Rico a wonderful experience in a safe environment with the best high-quality service. We are committed to giving you a unique experience by taking you to explore hidden spots that only locals are familiar with. With a variety of Puerto Rico tours to choose from, we're sure you'll be happy working with us.

name: El Portal de El Yunque
description: Explore, Discover and Connect at El Portal de El Yunque. El Portal is the major visitor center of El Yunque National Forest and opened in 1996. In 2017, Hurricanes Irma and Maria caused structural damage to the building resulting in the need for major building repairs and reconstruction.

name: Finca Gaia LLC
description: Finca Gaia covers about 35 acres of natural forest in the karst region of Dorado with over 300 trees, including floral, fruit, exotic, native, and endemic trees. Our main focus is in agrotourism and agroforestry, which is the intentional mix of trees and bushes with crops to obtain environmental, economic, and social benefits in a ecologically sustainable way.

name: Lucero Agricultural, Corp
description: Café Lucero is cultivated in the mountains of the municipality of Ponce. This hacienda is located in the Barrio San Patricio, right on the boarder of the mountainous towns of Adjuntas and Jayuya. Established in 2006, Café Lucero is a high quality coffee that has been chosen to represent the Island at the Specialty Coffee Association Expo for various years.

name: Circuito Agroturístico
description: First and only certified agrotourism circuit. This circuit includes Yauco's Placita Agrícola, its agricultural and artisanal products; Finca de Apiarios Caraballo, where you'll learn about bees and honey production first hand; Café Don Luis, where you'll learn how to make a good cup of coffee.

name: Cosecha Don Juan
description: Enjoy the wonders of the countryside a few minutes from San Juan. Live the diversity of the harvest that can be cultivated around 4 acres of land, learn about implemented agricultural practices, and enjoy beautiful views. At the end of the tour, enjoy a dish or drink made with seasonal products available on the farm. Reservation is required before the visit.

name: Punta Tuna Ecotours
description: Travel to the past, history, and development of a great community. This tour is an immersion in nature where you can enjoy diverse ecosystems. The nature reserve of Punta Tuna tour is guided by community environmental interpreters highlighting the wonders of the place.

name: Cabacoop – Proyecto Cabachuelas
description: The Cabachuelas Natural Reserve is a karstic ecosystem characterized by mogotes, ditches, and a significant number of caves. The area is also characterized by its archeological value because some of the caves have pictographs & petroglyphs of our indigenous ancestors. Local guided tours are bringing by Cabacoop -“Proyecto Cabachuelas”, a community-based organization whose mission is to conserve and promote the natural, historical, and cultural resources of Cabachuelas Natural Reserve.

name: Bosque Forestal de Río Abajo - Villa Comunitaria Crozier
description: Crozier Community Village is a forest opening community-based opportunities. It aims to promote the development of the communities surrounding the Río Abajo State Forest between Arecibo and Utuado by creating and implementing socioeconomic, educational, cultural, and encounter with nature programs that use and conserve natural resources sustainably.

name: Comunidad Toro Negro, Inc
description: Comunidad Toro Negro Inc. is a community organization with a 17-year history to improve the quality of life of its residents through the conservation of natural resources that are part of its natural environment, self-managed projects of sustainability and resilience, and socioeconomic development initiatives. The Toro Negro Community became the first Solar Community in the Caribbean region to produce its energy in August 2018.

name: Destino Ecoturismo del Noreste – Ecosol Inc
description: A community-based non-profit corporation whose mission is to promote an economic development model of social responsibility that generates jobs with environmental awareness and sensitivity to ecosystems and all their life forms. Promote the development of sustainable solidarity ecotourism in the northeast region of Puerto Rico, supporting the talent of our communities to reactivate ecological tourism, highlighting natural attractions.

name: Reserva Natural de Humacao Efraín Archilla Díaz
description: The natural reserve invites us to explore several coastal lagoons, wetlands, and forests home to a diversity of native and migratory birds. Upon arrival, you will be greeted by local businessmen who will be ready to lead an experience full of adventure and learning. Also, you will find snacks and handicrafts, some of them made with raw materials from the forest.

name: Reserva Natural las Cabachuelas – Cooperativa de Trabajo Las Cabachuelas
description: A community-based non-profit organization whose mission is to conserve and promote the nature reserve's natural, historical, and cultural resources. This reserve is a karstic ecosystem characterized by mogotes, ditches, and a significant number of caves. The area is also characterized by its archaeological value since several of the caves present pictographs and petroglyphs of our indigenous ancestors. The organization is characterized by promoting the value and conservation of resources through education.

name: Finca Don Manuel
description: Cart tour of the 320-cuerda farm with pineapple, papaya, banana and banana crops. You will learn about farming techniques, responsible practices for energy generation, and water conservation. Likewise, you will learn about the packaging process of the products that are harvested there and end with a tasting according to the harvest.

name: Bucketlist Tours
description: Bucketlist Tours is your ticket to unique private experiences in Puerto Rico, a magical archipelago of 143 islands full of exceptional food, amazing people, and natural beauty that can astound even the most jaded local. We should know because it has been inspiring awe in us since the day we were born.

name: Semila PR
description: This cocoa experience is in the town of Barceloneta and offers a chocolate tasting and historical tour of cocoa in Puerto Rico.

name: Plaza Santo Domingo
description: The Santo Domingo Square is located between Dr. Ruiz Belvis, Dr. Santiago Veve, Carro, Las Ramas, and in front of the Porta Coeli Church. No document has been found that certifies the exact date on which the Plaza de Santo Domingo was built. However, according to the minutes of the San Germán City, it was built between 1834-1839.

name: Sol Theater
description: The emblematic theater is an example of the late Art Deco built-in 1940 by engineer Gustavo A. Ramirez. The current features date from the years 1946-47. Originally a military courthouse with a gabled roof was located, then was rebuilt in 1922-24.

name: Casa Acosta y Fores
description: The residence was built in 1917 by the architect Luis Pardo. This was the home of Jaime Acosta y Fores with his wife Delia Lopez Hardvin. The architectural piece is the typical picturesque Creole design, which is a magnificent example of the wealthy class of Puerto Rico in the early twentieth century, where art nouveau influence with the interior decorations.

name: Ramírez Roggio House
description: The Ramírez Roggio House, known formerly as the Kindy house, was the residence of Ulises Gregory and Pepita San Miguel. Ulysses was mayor of the city in 1905, 1907, 1911, and 1915. The regal masonry construction was fully restored by 1970, and it’s iconic because of its double Tuscan columns and striking stained glass windows, a notable example of Creole Neoclassical style.

name: Aurelio Tió Museum and Studio House
description: This building is a perfect representation of an urban household in the 17th century. It was the home of, poet and activist, Lola Rodríguez de Tió. She lived her early life in this house until she contracted in holy matrimony to Bonocio Tió. This home was then passed on to the next generation and so on until it reached Aurelio Tió, engineer and historian that contributed to San German's growth and development. Today, this historical building exhibits the memories of the Tió family, including letters, furniture and photographs.

name: MARA Museum of Art
description: The elegant neoclassical architecture was the original residence of the Ramirez de Arellano family, built-in 1903. Today it houses the Museum of Historical Art of San German, inaugurated on May 27, 1987. It has several rooms where present arts by famous painters, sculptures, and pieces of religious art.

location.street_address: Calle Lorencita Ramirez de Arellano de Ferre # 7

name: Dominguez Pharmacy Museum La Botica
description: La Botica was founded in 1877 in the central area of the town, being the first pharmacy in San German. Located in one of the most famous corners of the city for being very crowded since, in this place, the most consecrated intellectuals met to change ideas, discuss political events and comment on literary works, politics, and culture.

location.street_address: squina Dela Cruz, Calle Felix Arce (antigua Dr Veve

name: Finca Ilán Ilán
description: The tour teaches agroecological techniques for self-sustaining food production and uses permaculture and biodynamic systems such as forestry, agroforestry, syntrophic agriculture, etc. In addition, it is instructed on native, endemic, and threatened species of Puerto Rico, both flora and fauna. It begins in the vegetable area, passing through the ornamental ones, then the vanilla ones, where our butterfly farm will be, then passing through the coffee, cocoa, and corduroy area to finish with a secondary tropical rain forest and the camping and creek area.

name: Pío Pío Farm
description: We dedicated to the sale of poultry such as: laying chicks, geese, guinea pigs, quail, ducks, turkeys for local and home breeding; we also offer all the articles and products necessary for raising them, we have sales both to the retail and wholesale, at the farm you can visit us and see all our birds and share with our farm animals we open on weekends Saturday 10:00am-5:00pm Sundays 11:00am-3:00pm.

name: Puerto Rico Paradise Farm
description: The farm offers sales of recao, cilantro, chili, rabbit meat, avocados, hemp, a tourist tour of the rabbit farm, scenic area, farm animals, and the different crops throughout the farm. Also, we offer agricultural technical advice to the farmers.

name: Kweens Klub
description: Kweens Klub (KK) located in the heart of Santurce in San Juan, Puerto Rico is the premier LGBTIQ+ nightclub of the Island. They offer a variety of local beers and good quality cocktails. Their main attraction are the drag shows where every Friday a international celebrity guest performs on their big stage. The second floor allocates one of the biggest tributes to the local drag icons with all their pictures. Also, they provide an open outdoor space. KK was opened in December 2021, and they have become popular because of the quality of the spectacles and the huge dance floor.

name: Scryer Rum Barrelhouse
description: Scryer Rum Barrelhouse produces its own rum and offers high-end cocktails designed using the rum as inspiration and principal ingredient. Scryer is made with the same restrictions as whisky - without sugar or added flavors - to elevate the product experience. Each cocktail is based on a classic drink, and there is something for everyone on the menu! Visitors can also enjoy delicious food, a cigar selection, tasting tours, flights, and more. .

name: Celia Rivera House
description: Beautiful urban Vernacular style residence of 1930, completely made of country wood. In its construction, the assembly in which the coupling system is alternated was used, using the techniques of the groove, tongue, and spike. This residence is one of the few houses that still have a frontispiece made of wood.

name: Higuaca Adventours
description: Tour Agency specializing in exclusive Island Adventures, Cultural & Culinary Immersions, Custom Tours & Itineraries, Leisure & Academic Group Travel, Travel Planning & Logistics, Study Abroad Programs, and Cultural Immersion Programs for Kids in Puerto Rico.

name: Fabriola's Boutique
description: We are a Jewelry store where you can buy trending brands such as Pandora, Uno de 50, Ti Sento Milano, Budhagirl, among others.

location.street_address: Calle Dr. Santiago Veve Esq, C. Alfonso XII

name: Caribbean Chiliboats Old San Juan
description: A wonderful tour with unique views of Old San Juan Bay and more than 500 years of history. Including the most important attraction in Puerto Rico: San Felipe del Morro Fort. Impressive views of: La Fortaleza (Governor's home), San Juan Door (original city entrance), "Baluarte de San Agustín", "Santa Elena" Battery, El Morro Wall, the "Garitas" and more.

name: Distrito Histórico de San Germán
description: The Historic District of San German is located in the western part of the city of San German of the Autonomous Municipality of San German, Puerto Rico. "Historic District of San German', so named the historic center when it was inscribed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1994, contains more than 100 essential buildings, including the Church of San German de Auxerre and the Convent of Porta Coeli.

name: Scuba Dogs PR - Escambrón
description: 5-Star Diving Center certified by PADI. It offers snorkeling excursions, diving, "Discover Scuba" for beginners, and night diving for the most advanced. In addition, all levels of training in swimming, diving, rescue, first aid, birthdays, and activities for children.

location.street_address: Parque Nacional del Tercer Milenio Esq. Calle San Agustín y Calle Normandie

name: Scuba Dogs PR - Guánica
description: 5-Star Diving Center certified by PADI. It offers snorkeling excursions, diving, "Discover Scuba" for beginners, and night diving for the most advanced. In addition, all levels of training in swimming, diving, rescue, first aid, birthdays, and activities for children.

name: Chimera Rooftop
description: "Chimera " means an unrealizable dream, this is where the concept for Chimera Rooftop comes from. We are the first Zero Waste Cocktail Bar in Puerto Rico, we don't use any type plastic one use products, our straws are hay, we compost all the garnishes and paper used at the bar plus the dry leaves from our plants and garden. We have a small Kitchen-Bar Garden on the back terrace where we get most of our aromatic garnishes and herbs. The compost from the bio-waste of the bar goes to feed our garden and decorative plants.

name: Yaucromatic
description: Yaucromatic is a public art project that began in 2017 and is run by the non-profit organization Arte Para Unir Inc. The community leader, Jonathan Hernández León is the organizer and together with a group of artists and volunteers they have impacted with works of art the Urban Helmet of Yauco. Currently the Yaucromatic project has 4 editions and more than 60 works of art that turn the town center into an open-air art gallery.

name: Isla Nena Biobay Tours - Vieques
description: Travel to the Caribbean island of Vieques where you can experience one the most unique natural phenomena in the world — the best bioluminescent microscopic organisms that glow in the dark! IMMERSE YOURSELF IN PUERTO RICAN CULTURE

name: Fifty Eight
description: Fifty Eight is Puerto Rico’s premier nightlife in the iconic La Concha Resort in Condado. We are combining music and entertainment with five starts hospitality. We set the standards for legendary nights that are as lively as sophisticated. Fifty Eight is the ultimate social playground for Puerto Rico’s artists, entrepreneurs, international celebrities, and everyone.

name: Café del Niño
description: After feeding our friends the pigeons and taking in the best view of San Juan Bay, families congregate in the delightful Café del Niño to play and enjoy a variety of coffees from Hacienda Lealtad. Children can enjoy arts, culture, and music at our unique open-air coffee shop with a view of the sea on the weekends. We are open from 10:00AM to 5:30PM.

location.street_address: Palacio Rojo, 54 C. de la Fortaleza,

name: H and J Island Adventures
description: H and J Island Adventures started to show visitors the best adventures they can have while visiting PR. Our tours include RT transportation, breakfast, water, and snacks. Our most popular tour is the "Muddy Rainforest Adventure," but we specialize in custom and private tours Island -wide as well. It's a small company with just 2 of us, but our treatment of guests and the history and experiences they receive while spending the day with us make us one of the best companies on the Island. We love to showcase the best of Puerto Rico, with safety always our top priority.

location.street_address: Alturas de San Pedro E1 Calle San Alfonso

name: Water Time Charter
description: Water Time Charter is a private Yacht Charters Company in Puerto Rico with more than 40 years of experience. If you’re looking for a romantic getaway, an adventure with friends and family, or even a day just for yourself, you have come to the right place. Our top-of-the-line yachts accommodate all ages and interests. Our destinations are: Palomino Island, Icacos Island, Spanish Virgin Island, White Bay, Jos Van Dyke, The Baths, Virgen Gorda

name: La Hoja del Chan, LLC
description: It all begins as a dream of the founder and owner of the company José G. Cruz or better known as "El Chan". His passion for the tobacco industry and what was implanted by his family lineage prompted him to create this great project. There he begins his line, selling his product at a table in front of the crowded "Los Pinos" business, emblematic suckling pig in the Guavate sector, the center of culture and history of Puerto Rico. Then the hiring for weddings and activities begins where culture mixes with the social—making known his product and craft skills.

location.street_address: Calle Baldorioty de Castro #12 Segundo nivel local 1

name: Conquistador Travels
description: Based in Fajardo, Puerto Rico for over 50 years, Conquistador Travels custom tailors your dream vacation. This family-owned business blends world-class traveling with Caribbean tourism. Daniel and John create personalized packages that range from boats to sailing and even land tours. With more than six different vessels to accommodate groups from 6 up to 200 passengers and land excursions, we know how to have a good time.

name: Infinity Water Sports PR LLC.
description: Our mission is to introduce the Evo-jet ski to the island, which will give a competitive advantage to our project. Our Evo-jet skis are designed for the passenger to navigate in a seated position with a steering wheel instead of the traditional jet ski saddle seating. Our goal is to provide our clients with the opportunity to experience a unique and exhilarating tour. Infinity Watersports PR offers a fun and safe form of recreation for the residents and visitors of Puerto Rico while promoting the development of Puerto Rico's tourism industry.

name: Islandclimber LLC
description: Hi, my name is Carlos Salinas, Founder of Islandclimber LLC and Cert. instructor. We are a guide service passionate about climbing and want to show you our wonderful island. The many places offer beautiful sceneries, great rock walls, unique local experiences, and not to mention world-class quality climbing. We strive to teach and share our knowledge about climbing, nature, and our culture. Come and join us on our next adventure! Climb on!

name: El Yunque Tours Inc.
description: El Yunque Tours (legal organizer since 2006) offers visitors a different way to discover El Yunque National Forest. Tours are dynamic and out of buses and cars, away from roadside attractions. Our main tourist corridors immerse themselves in the sights, sounds, smells, and nature that are indeed wonders of El Yunque National Forest. The adventure begins under the canopy through guided nature walks and hiking excursions.

name: Smart Wellness Travel LLC
description: Our boat charter is the perfect way to explore for families and friends who like privacy and adventures. We offer Wellness, Beach Hopping, Sunrise, Sunset, and Themed cruises trips in Culebra and Culebrita areas. We are proud to provide guests with the opportunity to discover these treasures with the best guides, who can tailor any trip to your liking. We also offer Hiking Tours in Culebra and Fajardo.

name: Indulge Chocolat
description: Indulge Chocolat is a local, family-owned, operated business that produces premium quality handcrafted fine chocolates. Guided by a sustainable philosophy, our chocolates and confections are produced with respect, personal care, creativity, and appreciation for nature's bounty. We strive to create products that provide memorable sensory experiences by using premium Grand Cru cacao, unadulterated local and worldwide organic ingredients, and fair-trade products.

name: aWa Outdoor
description: aWa Outdoor is a Latina women-owned business founded on the island of Puerto Rico by Paola Medina and Viviana Rivera. Inspired by water sports, the love of travel, outdoor adventures, and the enrichment of our culture, their brand is focused on water-protective products that reflect our island identity and Caribbean colors. Their main products are dry bags and fanny packs, made to be durable and colorful. Perfect for different outdoor activities and designed to have a great island time.

name: Escape To Paradise PR
description: Escape To Paradise PR is a company with the vision of bringing the best-personalized service to our clients. We are dedicated to working with small groups of 1 to 6 people. We took them to Culebra, Culebrita, Vieques and Icacos and Palomino. Our excursions include snorkeling tours, drinks, snacks, juices, and fruits. Depending on the chosen excursion, we give sandwiches to a BBQ on the boat, and alcoholic beverages are included. We have Full Day and Half day Tours.

name: Mareaito Charters LLC
description: Boat Charter company dedicated to doing private day tours to the sandbars of La Parguera and Sunset & Biobay tours. All our boats and Captains are USCG-certified. We have boats with a capacity of 13 passengers. Mareaito Charters is your “Passport to Paradise”

name: BlueKings
description: Come snorkel with an experienced marine biologist and get the chance to swim with sharks, turtles, rays, and other marine life. We offer these unique educational sea explorations to change your perspective of the ocean forever. No prior diving experience or certifications are necessary.

name: Federación de Windsurfing
description: The Windsurfing Federation of Puerto Rico (FWPR) promotes wind sports, travel, friends, and youth development. We coordinate several events during the year and facilitate people of all ages learning windsurfing, wind foiling, sailing, and other watersports. Contact us for classes, equipment sales, rentals, or event information about upcoming tournaments.

name: Sofrito Tours
description: Sofrito Tours, or Sofrito, was founded in 2022 as a company specializing in historical, cultural, and gastronomic tours around the beautiful island of Puerto Rico. As history and gastronomy experts, we needed to share our love for Puerto Rico with locals and visitors. We offer tours con sazón, meaning each tour is designed to provide an unforgettable gastronomic and historical experience with the Boricua essence that our guests will never forget.

name: Puerto Rico Offroad UTV Experience
description: Experience pure adrenaline in a one-of-a-kind Can-Am UTV offroad vehicle in the 2,300-acre Hacienda Campo Rico, located only 5 minutes from San Juan. Your 2-hour tour includes an exciting ride through a variety of rugged terrains in trails with breathtaking views of different ecosystems. The adventurers will enjoy amazing sceneries of the karst region including haystack mountains, valleys, wetlands and beautiful lagoons. Our safe and sturdy Can-Am UTV offroad vehicles count on the latest top-of-the-line technology.

location.street_address: Avenida Roberto Sanchez Vilella Final Este Calle 535

name: Pahi Island Yoga & Wellness
description: Inspired by ancient Polynesians, the greatest sea navigators in history, our studio is about finding your way. These great explorers did not rely on assistance from the compass, as did generations hundreds of years later, but rather on the wind and by looking upward towards patterns in the stars. Their voyages were remarkable as they traversed the expanse open sea to as far as the Americas. In mythology, it is said that competing tribes from their original island Hiva forced a population to disperse and search for new islands and make new homes for themselves.

name: Samadhi Yoga Ayurveda Institute
description: Beyond the mat, Samãdhi is a conscious way of living, practicing and sharing yoga. The Samãdhi method, based on the deep roots of yoga therapy and Ayurveda, more than a system, sequence or style of yoga, it is a method of connection and attention.

name: Coquí el Original
description: Coquí el Original®’s designs are not passing trends. They spark lovely memories of our “Isla del Encanto” and its unique Caribbean sounds, warmth, and culture. All of our pieces are crafted in either solid 14k gold or solid sterling silver .925. The collection is designed by the Cuban-Puerto Rican jeweler, Natalio Barquet Junior. Exquisitely and impeccably finished, our jewelry is meant to be cherished for a lifetime. We are the definition of locally designed Puerto Rico high jewelry.

location.street_address: 200 Calle de la Fortaleza, Viejo San Juan

name: OSJ Yoga & Well-being
description: Our serene studio offers a sanctuary in the historic city of Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. Our studio goal is to create a modern and fresh space where our clients feel energized and inspired at the same time.

location.street_address: 100 Calle Del Muelle Capitolio Plaza Suite. 110 & 111

name: CASAYOGA
description: Our space is an oasis in which you can just pause the daily grind for a moment and give yourself some love. We want you to feel right at home every time you visit the house. This is why we will always greet you with relaxing smells and good energies, no big ego's, just peace. We want everyone to feel comfortable no matter their age or level of fitness experience.

name: Santosa Yoga & Health
description: Santosa Yoga is based in beautiful Puerto Rico in the Condado area of San Juan. We offer yoga, meditation, breath healing and yoga of parenting classes, workshops, and retreats. We like to take advantage of the tropical weather, so we hold outdoor yoga classes on beaches or in other places of natural beauty.

name: BORIHIPI
description: Wellness Retreat. Camping. Yoga. Coaching. Forest Bathing. Soul reset.

name: Hot Yoga Puerto Rico
description: The only Hot Yoga studio in Puerto Rico, raising the temperature to 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: SUP Action Paddleboarding Co.
description: We are a group of friends committed to promoting the great sport of Stand Up Paddleboarding (SUP) in PR and the Caribbean

location.street_address: Avenida Fernandez Juncos, San Juan Bay Marina Local #2

name: Rogative
description: Founded in San Juan, Puerto Rico, ROGATIVE was inspired by my own travels and experiences living outside of Puerto Rico, including that strong feeling that tugs at your heart when you are away from home. ROGATIVE comes from the beautiful bronze statue by Lindsay Daen, La Rogativa. A sculpture that pays tribute to efforts of the townspeople, who joined forces and stopped the 1797 invasion attempt. 200+ years later, La Rogativa still exemplifies the true spirit of Puerto Ricans.

name: Ashtanga Yoga Puerto Rico
description: AYPR is the home of Progressive Ashtanga Vinyasa® Yoga, a style founded by David Kyle that honors the older Traditional Ashtanga Yoga lineages and embraces the modern revisions of Rocket® vinyasa yoga. Progressive Ashtanga Vinyasa is known for being a contemporary form of yoga asana and philosophy that gives it a sense of versatility when practice by a range of different students. For over 16 years, people have been experiencing the transformational power of this practice here in Puerto Rico.

name: Ruta Artesanal Boricua, Inc
description: We are pioneers in the creation of experiences for cultural tourism focused on the Boricua Artisanal Heritage. The experiences include guided tours in artisan markets and workshops, among others.

name: Martínez Dairy
description: At Martinez Dairy, you will experience the life of a third-generation farmer, where the cattle are worked to obtain fresh milk from one of the industries in Puerto Rico. You will have a tour of the place guided by Pablo Martínez, the current owner of the dairy. You will learn about the entire livestock process, from the breed, care, grazing, reproduction, milking process, dairy industry, and more. You will be dedicated to serving and answering all your questions. In addition, farmer experiences for a day and cow therapy are available on-site.

name: Hidden Excursions PR
description: Excursion with exclusive group and certified personnel to El Yunque National Rainforest! We offer an excursion that provides the opportunity to take a tour of the mountains of the tropical jungle of Puerto Rico. An experience full of fun, history, culture, and connection with nature.

name: Finca Bee Happy
description: A unique mix of eco-tourism, hiking activities and authentic Puerto Rican family entertainment.

name: Chocolate Cortés
description: The company Cortés Hermanos was founded in 1929 by Pedro Cortés Forteza in the city of Santo Domingo, who with his leadership distinguished himself by promoting tradition, quality, discipline and constant commitment to their customers. Qualities that to this day remain preponderant in the company, leading us towards excellence and constant improvement and allowing us to experience sustained growth over time.

name: Aguadilla Water Sports
description: Explore the entire beautiful coastline of Aguadilla, Puerto Rico! Be astonished while experiencing all our incredible coastal paradise and its turquoise blue water has to offer. Feel confident, accompanied by one of our experienced crewmates who will ride alongside you on their own Jet Ski to maximize your Adventure. Enjoy all of our coves and small hidden gems, feeling safe and secure.

name: Hacienda Chocolat
description: Agricultural farm dedicated to the cultivation of Puerto Rican fine and aroma cocoa.

name: Panorama Farm
description: PANORAMA FARM ADVENTURE! Located in the scenic town of Las Marías, Panorama Farm is home to Café Ama Love, a socially driven coffee brand. The farm’s mission directly supports the SEEDS youth entrepreneurship program, with all proceeds funding initiatives that empower Puerto Rican youth. This farm offers a connection to the land and a meaningful contribution to the community through adventures with our tours. Our goal is to provide visitors with an unforgettable journey! ABOUT OUR TRIPS

name: Plaza Del Caribe
description: Since 1992, Plaza Del Caribe has been the most important shopping center in the South and Southwest regions of Puerto Rico. It is the only closed mall with two anchor stores, Macy's and JCPenney. With a radius of more than 30 miles, a wide variety of more than 110 national and international stores and vendors in Puerto Rico. In addition, it has over 25 places to eat, a gym and a cinema with ten rooms. The offer expands on weekends with Puerto Rican crafts that can be purchased at the Balcón Artesanal and with agricultural products in the PLACITA@PLAZA.

name: Bellaventura del Caribe LLC
description: Bellaventuras del Caribe, LLC offers Catamaran sailing excursions, including snorkeling and paddle boarding. Our visitors discover the island from a unique place, being in close contact with nature, and admire a variety of coral, rays, turtles, and tropical fishes. We encourage sailing using wind power through the beautiful Caribbean archipelago islands, cays, and islets comprising the Spanish Virgin Islands.

name: Predator Gaming Center
description: Bowling & Foodcourt @ Dorado del Mar, Puerto Rico.

name: Scent Charmaine
description: Discover a range of locally crafted products including creams, soaps, and more, all handmade by a talented artisan.

name: BlueKattleia
description: On our store you can find a variety of accessories such as clothing, sandals, handbags, macrame and more.

name: Splash Charters
description: Our private yacht charter in Puerto Rico will allow you to experience the island in an elegant, fun manner. Our 5-star crew will deliver the finest personal service and experience during your voyage. Enjoy fantastic food, drinks, jet skis, sea bobs, and more aboard our luxurious 60' yacht. Enjoy Puerto Rico's most popular destination: Cayo Icacos, the largest and most picturesque cays that makeup La Cordillera Nature Reserve off the northeast tip of Puerto Rico.

name: El Museo Invisible que Cuenta la Historia de Pocos
description: The Invisible Museum addressed how collective memory and tangible and intangible cultural heritage come together for the institution of museums of memory.

location.street_address: PR 140 Interior calle Juan Rosado Colón Km. 54.3

name: Hecho Acá
description: Hygiene and personal care products based on medicinal plants and aromatherapy.

location.street_address: carr 125 km 4.8, barrio voladora sector quebrada grande, Moca

name: Nátura PR
description: Small-group, nature, historical, and adventure tours. Educational experiences. Tourism consulting.

name: Universidad Ana G. Méndez
description: From health sciences, technology, business, entrepreneurship, tourism and culinary arts, to design, communications and digital media, among others, we have the right program for you.

name: Pachamama Nature Park
description: A new ecological dog park and hotel in San German.

name: Galeria "cuco" Davila
description: Gallery dedicated to the 10 times AA baseball champions "Los mulos del Valenciano" contains pieces and memorabilia from over 70 years of history. Trophies, photos and memorabilia of great team moments are on display.

name: Paseo Escuté
description: Small monumental district where there are important buildings following the custom of European urban walks. There are the City Hall, the José M Gallardo Library and the center for the elderly.

name: Escuela Municipal de Bellas Artes
description: It offers free choir, modeling, theater, classical ballet, municipal band, Juncorriqueña orchestra, drawing and painting, folkloric ballet, bomba barrels, bomba dance and trova workshops for young people from Junco. In the building you can also see the Junco Queens Room and the Mayors Room.

name: Placita de la Bandera
description: As part of the creation of the Flag of the 78 Towns and One Flag project, this beautiful little square was created where the Juncos Flag and several murals and messages were included.

name: Puerto Rico Bean to Bar
description: Puerto Rico Bean to Bar is an agricultural company located in the town of Lares. We are dedicated to the cultivation and processing of cocoa, manufacture of chocolate and products derived from it. Our grains come from our farm "Las Tres Palmas" and from farmers' farms in the area.

name: Wabiola
description: We are dedicated to the production of soaps, lotions, shampoos, conditioners, mother tinctures and other products for health and wellness. They are vegan products, free of dyes and perfumes that are harmful to the skin and the environment.

name: La Casa del Libro Museo Biblioteca
description: La Casa del Libro Museum Library (LCDL) houses a world–renowned collection of rare books from the 15th century on, historical documents, printing presses, book arts related artifacts and art exhibits. Temporary shows on rare books, book arts and artists take turns throughout the year. When not on display, rare books are shown by appointment only. Please call in advance if you are interested in a private show.

name: Museo de Arte - Casa Amarilla Dra Concha Meléndez
description: The Yellow House is located on Padial street, Ruiz corner. Belvis in Caguas.

name: Municipio de Coamo
description: Coamo is located in the southern region of the Cordillera Central. To the north it is bordered by Barranquitas and Orocovis; to the south with Santa Isabel, to the west with Juana Díaz and Villalba and to the east with Aibonito and Salinas.

name: PRParadiseTours
description: Come to Puerto Rico and enjoy with us an amazing vacation with tours of the Rain forest,old San juan,Bacardi rum distillery,caves,tubing in caves,nature walks,stand up paddling,ziplinig and much more.we specialize in the rain forest.Big groups and private tours are available.All our guides are certified license tour guides.

location.street_address: Quintas de cupey F calle 14 apto F104

name: Hang Gliding Experience PR
description: Enjoy a pleasant day with us flying over the slopes of the Yunque and flying through one of the most beautiful valleys of Puerto Rico "El Valle de Las Piedras" whose highway # 31 connects with the Towns of Juncos, Las Piedras and Naguabo. Actually, an experience that no one can tell you.

location.street_address: PR-186 RAMAL 9948 4.0 BARRIO CUBUY SECTOR MARINES

name: Puerto Rico Landscapes
description: Take memories of Puerto Rico with you. Souvenir art photos, collages, sketches and mail postcards about beautiful places of Puerto Rico.

location.street_address: m-27 calle flor de diego, urb. river garden

name: Artesanías Nitaína
description: Take home a bit of paradise with these handcrafted soaps, moisturizing lotions, candles and more.

name: Apitursimo PR
description: Educational tour in an apiary. Know the importance of bees and interact directly with them.

name: Torrefacción Café La Finca
